- This collection of Beetroot Recipes from the blog archives was first published in January 2017. It has been updated and republished in August 2023.

name: Sabudana Khichdi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak sabudana in water for 3-4 hours until they bloom and absorb all water.
- Roast peanuts until golden and let them cool.
- Grind roasted peanuts into a fine powder.

quick_step:
- Soak sabudana until soft.
- Roast and powder peanuts.
- Fry cumin seeds and peanuts in oil.
- Add soaked sabudana, salt, and lemon juice.
- Cook covered until translucent.
- Garnish with coriander and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and fry 2-forty five g of peanuts until crisp, then remove and set aside.
- Add cumin seeds to the hot oil and let them splutter.
- Add soaked sabudana to the pan along with salt and mix well.
- Add fried peanuts and lemon juice, mix thoroughly.
- Cover and cook on low heat for 2 minutes until sabudana becomes translucent.
- Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and mix well before serving.

name: Poori Bhaji
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and crush the potatoes.
- Chop the tomatoes and green chillies.
- Mix turmeric, red chilli powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder in a small bowl.

quick_step:
- Mix dry spices together.
- Heat oil and temper with cumin and whole spices.
- Add ginger, spices, tomatoes, heeng, salt, and green chillies; cook until soft.
- Add hot water and crushed boiled potatoes; simmer.
- Add garam masala, kasuri methi, and coriander leaves; finish cooking.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add jeera and khada masala.
- Add grated ginger and the mixed dry spices; sauté briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes, heeng, salt, and green chillies; cook until tomatoes soften.
- Add hot water and crushed boiled potatoes; mix well and simmer.
- Finish by adding garam masala, kasuri methi, and chopped coriander leaves; stir and cook for a few minutes.

name: Chole Bhature Breakfast Plate
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak chickpeas overnight and boil them with cinnamon, bay leaves, cardamom, black pepper, turmeric, and salt until soft (about 5-6 whistles in a pressure cooker).
- Finely chop onions and tomatoes.
- Chop green chilies as per taste.
- Chop fresh coriander leaves.

quick_step:
- Soak and boil chickpeas with whole spices.
- Prepare onion-tomato masala with spices.
- Add boiled chickpeas to the masala and simmer.
- Garnish with coriander and serve hot with bhature.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a wok and add cumin seeds.
- Add finely chopped onions and green chilies, sauté until onions turn golden.
- Add ginger garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add chopped tomatoes and a pinch of salt, cook until tomatoes soften.
- Add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, kitchen king masala, turmeric powder, and red chili powder; cook the spices well.
- Add the boiled chickpeas along with two hundred and forty ml water, mix well and simmer for a few minutes.
- Garnish with chopped fresh coriander leaves and remove from heat.

name: Egg Fried Rice Breakfast
instructions:
prep_step:
- Beat the eggs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
- Prepare cooked rice, preferably cold or leftover rice for best texture.

quick_step:
- Beat eggs and season.
- Heat oil and scramble eggs.
- Add cooked rice and mix.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
- Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until just cooked.
- Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir well to combine with the eggs.
- Season with salt, pepper, and soy sauce if using.
- Stir-fry for a few minutes until the rice is heated through and slightly crispy.

name: Banana Smoothie Bowl
instructions:
prep_step:
- Peel and slice the ripe banana.
- Measure out the plant-based milk and oats.
- Prepare any desired toppings by chopping fruits or nuts.

quick_step:
- Slice banana and gather ingredients.
- Blend banana, milk, oats, and optional nut butter/seeds until smooth and thick.
- Pour into a bowl and add desired toppings.
- Serve immediately.

name: Vegetable Poha Cutlets
instructions:
prep_step:
- Rinse poha in water and drain well, keep aside to soften.
- Boil and mash the potatoes.
- Finely chop mixed vegetables, green chili, ginger, and coriander leaves.
- Prepare all spices and keep ready.

quick_step:
- Soak and soften poha.
- Cook and mash potatoes; chop vegetables and spices.
- Sauté spices and vegetables; mix with poha and potatoes.
- Shape into cutlets and coat with bread crumbs.
- Shallow fry until golden and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves, sauté for a minute.
- Add chopped green chili and ginger, sauté briefly.
- Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt; mix well.
- Add softened poha and mashed potatoes, mix everything thoroughly.
- Turn off heat, add chopped coriander leaves and mix.
- Shape the mixture into small cutlets, coat with bread crumbs.
- Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the cutlets until golden and crispy on both sides.

name: Bread Pakora
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop green chili finely.
- Prepare the batter by mixing gram flour with water to a smooth consistency.
- Add chopped green chili, red chili powder, turmeric, carom seeds, and salt to the batter.

quick_step:
- Prepare spiced gram flour batter.
- Dip bread slices into the batter.
- Deep fry until golden and crispy.
- Drain excess oil and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
- Dip each bread slice into the gram flour batter, coating both sides evenly.
- Carefully drop the coated bread slices into hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.
- Remove and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.

name: Stuffed Cheese Garlic Bread
instructions:
prep_step:
- Grate the garlic finely.
- Mix butter, grated garlic, salt, chilli flakes, oregano, and coriander together to form a flavored butter spread.
- Slice the bread if not pre-sliced.

quick_step:
- Mix butter with garlic, salt, chilli flakes, oregano, and coriander.
- Spread the mixture on sliced bread.
- Top with grated cheese.
- Bake until crispy and cheese is melted.
- Serve hot and enjoy.

cook_step:
- Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly on each slice of bread.
- Top each slice with a generous amount of grated cheese.
- Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) until the bread is crispy and the cheese is melted and golden.

name: Sprouts Salad Bowl
instructions:
prep_step:
- Sprout the chana and moong dal until tender and ready to eat.
- Wash and peel the vegetables as needed.
- Chop cucumber, tomato, radish, carrot, and chakandar into small pieces.

quick_step:
- Chop fresh vegetables into small pieces.
- Mix sprouts and chopped vegetables together.
- Serve fresh as a healthy breakfast salad.

name: High-Protein Chocolate Peanut Butter Breakfast Parfait
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice the fresh strawberries.
- Mix peanut butter, cocoa powder, and honey together to create the chocolate peanut butter layer.
- Prepare homemade granola if not store-bought.

quick_step:
- Mix chocolate peanut butter layer ingredients.
- Layer yogurt, chocolate peanut butter mixture, strawberries, and granola in a glass.
- Repeat layers as desired and serve immediately.

name: Blue Raspberry Smoothie Bowl
instructions:
prep_step:
- Gather all ingredients and wash the berries.
- Peel the banana and slice it for easier blending.

quick_step:
- Add blue raspberries, banana, and plant-based milk to a blender.
- Blend until smooth and creamy.
- Pour into a bowl and top with mixed berries, granola, chia seeds, and a drizzle of honey.
- Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Mango Smoothie Bowl
instructions:
prep_step:
- Peel and chop the ripe mango into small pieces.
- Gather all toppings such as granola and chia seeds.

quick_step:
- Blend chopped mango, yogurt, honey, and ice cubes until smooth.
- Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
- Top with granola and chia seeds for added texture.
- Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Besan Chilla
instructions:
prep_step:
- Sift the besan to remove lumps.
- Chop green chili and coriander leaves finely.
- Grate fresh ginger.

quick_step:
- Prepare batter by mixing besan with water and spices.
- Heat pan and grease with oil.
- Pour batter and spread evenly.
- Cook until golden on both sides.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Mix besan with water to form a smooth batter of pouring consistency.
- Add chopped green chili, ginger, cumin seeds, salt, and coriander leaves to the batter and mix well.
- Heat a non-stick pan and grease it lightly with oil.
- Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it evenly like a pancake.
- Cook on medium heat until the edges start to lift and the bottom turns golden brown.
- Flip the chilla and cook the other side until golden and cooked through.

name: Moong Dal Chilla
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak moong dal for a few hours or overnight until soft.
- Grind soaked moong dal with cumin seeds, salt, turmeric, black pepper powder, cumin powder, chopped onion, and garlic into a smooth batter.

quick_step:
- Soak moong dal and grind with spices and onion to make batter.
- Heat pan and pour batter to form round chillas.
- Cook both sides until golden brown.
- Serve with green chutney and paneer.

cook_step:
- Heat a non-stick pan and pour a ladle of batter to form a round chilla.
- Cook on medium heat until the edges start to lift and the bottom is golden brown.
- Flip and cook the other side until golden and cooked through.
- Serve hot with green chutney and paneer.

name: Rava Idli
instructions:
prep_step:
- Dry roast rava lightly until aromatic and let it cool.
- Chop green chili and grate ginger.
- Prepare tempering by heating oil and adding mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chili, and ginger.

quick_step:
- Roast rava and prepare tempering.
- Mix yogurt and water to form batter with rava and tempering.
- Add baking soda and mix gently.
- Steam batter in idli molds for 15 minutes.

cook_step:
- Mix yogurt with water to make a batter and add roasted rava, salt, and tempering.
- Let the batter rest for 10 minutes to soften.
- Add baking soda just before steaming and mix gently.
- Pour batter into greased idli molds and steam for 12-15 minutes until cooked through.

name: Instant Set Dosa
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak poha for some time before use.
- Add semolina, yogurt, soaked poha, and some water to a blender jar and blend to make a smooth batter.
- In a pan, sauté peanuts and roasted chana dal until well roasted.
- Transfer sautéed peanuts and chana dal to the blender jar along with fresh coconut, ginger, and green chili; blend and add this mixture to the dosa batter.
- Add baking soda to the batter and mix well.

quick_step:
- Blend semolina, yogurt, soaked poha, and water to make batter.
- Sauté peanuts and chana dal, blend with coconut, ginger, and chili, then add to batter.
- Add baking soda and mix well.
- Cook dosas on hot pan, reduce flame, cook until golden and fluffy.
- Serve with coconut chutney and butter or ghee.

cook_step:
- Heat a pan on high flame.
- Pour a ladle of batter onto the pan and cook on high flame initially.
- Reduce the flame to low-medium and cook the dosa on one side until the batter dries up and the bottom turns golden brown.
- Add butter or ghee on top of the dosa while cooking.
- Remove the dosa once cooked and serve hot with coconut chutney.

name: Neer Dosa
instructions:
prep_step:
- Add four hundred and eighty ml of water, five g salt, ten g sugar, and 1one hundred and twenty g of coconut milk into a blender jar.
- Add four hundred and eighty g of rice flour and five g ground coconut to the blender.
- Grind the mixture well for about 1 minute to form a smooth batter.
- Transfer the batter into a mixing bowl and add 2 more cups of water to adjust the consistency, mixing well to make a smooth, thin batter.

quick_step:
- Prepare a smooth batter by blending rice flour, coconut milk, water, salt, sugar, and ground coconut.
- Adjust batter consistency with water to make it thin.
- Heat a non-stick pan and pour a small amount of batter to form thin dosas.
- Cook dosas for about 1.5 minutes until edges lift, then remove.
- Serve hot with vegetarian or non-vegetarian curries.

cook_step:
- Heat a non-stick pan or dosa pan on medium to high flame.
- If using a non-stick pan, no oil is needed; otherwise, lightly grease the pan.
- Pour a small amount of batter onto the hot pan and spread it thinly to form a small dosa.
- Cook the dosa for about 1.5 minutes until the edges start to lift from the pan; do not wait for golden color.
- Carefully remove the dosa from the pan and repeat with the remaining batter.

name: Andhra Special Pesarattu
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak whole green gram (moong dal) in water for 4-6 hours or overnight.
- Drain the soaked dal and grind it with green chilies and ginger to a smooth batter, adding water as needed.
- Mix rice flour and salt into the batter and adjust consistency to a pouring batter.

quick_step:
- Soak moong dal for several hours.
- Grind dal with green chilies and ginger to make batter.
- Add rice flour and salt, mix well.
- Spread batter on hot pan to make crepe.
- Cook until crisp and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat a non-stick or cast iron pan on medium heat.
- Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it thinly in a circular motion to form a crepe.
- Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook until the bottom turns golden brown and crisp.
- Flip and cook the other side briefly if desired, then remove from pan.
- Serve hot with chutney or upma.

name: Onion Uttapam
instructions:
prep_step:
- Finely chop the onion, green chili, and curry leaves.
- Ensure the dosa/uttapam batter is well fermented and at room temperature.

quick_step:
- Chop onions, green chili, and curry leaves.
- Pour fermented batter on hot pan.
- Top with chopped onions and herbs.
- Cook until golden and crispy on both sides.
- Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

cook_step:
- Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and grease it lightly with oil.
- Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it slightly thick.
- Sprinkle chopped onions, green chili, and curry leaves evenly over the batter.
- Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook on medium heat until the bottom turns golden brown.
- Flip the uttapam carefully and cook the other side for 1-2 minutes.
- Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

name: Uttapam - Mixed Veg
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, tomatoes, green chili, and coriander leaves finely.
- Grate the carrot.
- Mix all the chopped vegetables in a bowl.

quick_step:
- Prepare and chop mixed vegetables.
- Pour fermented batter on hot pan.
- Sprinkle vegetables and salt on top.
- Cook until crispy and golden on both sides.
- Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

cook_step:
- Heat a non-stick pan and pour a ladle of fermented batter to form a thick pancake.
- Sprinkle the mixed vegetables evenly over the batter.
- Add salt to taste and drizzle some oil around the edges.
- Cook on medium heat until the bottom turns golden brown and the edges are crispy.
- Flip carefully and cook the other side for a minute.
- Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

name: Eggless Banana Muffins
instructions:
prep_step:
- Peel and mash the ripe bananas in a large bowl using a fork until smooth.
- Add almond milk, sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the mashed bananas and mix well with a fork.
- In a separate bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt.
- Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix with a fork until just combined.
- Optionally, fold in chopped walnuts and dark chocolate chips.

quick_step:
- Mash bananas and mix with almond milk, sugar, oil, and vanilla.
- Combine dry ingredients and add to wet mixture.
- Fold in optional walnuts and chocolate chips.
- Scoop batter into muffin liners.
- Bake at 350°F for 22 minutes until done.

cook_step:
- Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
- Line a muffin tin with muffin liners.
- Scoop the batter evenly into the muffin tins, filling about two thousand eight hundred and eighty g.
- Bake in the preheated oven for about 22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
- Remove from oven and let the muffins cool for a few minutes before serving.

name: Veggie Egg Muffins
instructions:
prep_step:
- Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
- Chop the bell pepper, spinach, and onion into small pieces.
- Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk until well combined.
- Add the chopped vegetables, cheese, salt, and pepper to the eggs and mix well.
- Grease a muffin tin with olive oil or cooking spray.

quick_step:
- Preheat oven and prepare vegetables.
- Whisk eggs and mix in vegetables and seasoning.
- Grease muffin tin and pour mixture into cups.
- Bake for 18-20 minutes until set.
- Cool slightly and serve.

cook_step:
- Pour the egg and vegetable mixture evenly into the muffin tin cups.
- Bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes or until the egg muffins are set and slightly golden on top.
- Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before removing from the tin.

name: Breakfast Burrito - Veg
instructions:
prep_step:
- Crack eggs into a bowl and whisk until fluffy.
- Slice avocado.
- Mix chipotle hot sauce and mayonnaise to make a simple sauce.

quick_step:
- Whisk and cook eggs until fluffy.
- Mix chipotle mayo sauce.
- Warm tortilla and layer eggs, tots, sauce, and avocado.
- Roll and toast the burrito.

cook_step:
- Warm the flour tortilla for about 10 seconds.
- Air-fry the tater tots until crispy.
- Cook eggs in a pan with a pinch of salt until set and fluffy.
- Assemble burrito by layering eggs, tater tots, sauce, and avocado on the tortilla.
- Fold in the sides and roll the burrito tightly.
- Toast the burrito seam side down until golden and warm.

name: Simple Breakfast Burrito - Egg and Sausage
instructions:
prep_step:
- Crack eggs into a bowl and lightly beat them.
- Cook sausage links fully and slice or crumble them.
- Warm the tortilla slightly to make it pliable.

quick_step:
- Beat eggs and cook scrambled eggs in a pan.
- Cook and prepare sausage.
- Warm tortilla to make it flexible.
- Combine eggs, sausage, and cheese.
- Wrap mixture in tortilla to form burrito.

cook_step:
- Heat butter or oil in a pan over medium heat.
- Pour in beaten eggs and scramble gently until just set.
- Add cooked sausage to the eggs and mix gently.
- Remove from heat and sprinkle shredded cheese over the egg and sausage mixture.
- Place the mixture onto the warmed tortilla and roll it up tightly to form a burrito.

name: Amazing Creamy Avocado Toast
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut and mash the ripe avocado until creamy.
- Season the mashed avocado with salt and desired spices.

quick_step:
- Toast bread slices.
- Mash and season avocado.
- Cook egg.
- Assemble avocado on toast, add egg, and garnish with black sesame seeds.

cook_step:
- Toast the bread slices until golden and crisp.
- Cook the egg to your preference (fried or poached).
- Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread.
- Top with the cooked egg and sprinkle black sesame seeds on top.

name: Tomato Cheese Toast
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice the tomato into thin rounds.
- Shred the cheese if not pre-shredded.

quick_step:
- Add tomato slices and season.
- Sprinkle cheese and oregano.
- Toast until cheese melts and bread is crisp.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Butter the bread slices evenly on one side.
- Place the bread slices buttered side down on a pan or baking tray.
- Layer tomato slices on top of the bread.
- Sprinkle salt, black pepper, and oregano over the tomatoes.
- Top with shredded cheese evenly.
- Toast or bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 5 minutes or until the cheese melts and the bread is crispy.

name: Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich With Honey-Sriracha Sauce on a Brioche Bun
instructions:
prep_step:
- Flatten the chicken breast to an even thickness.
- Marinate the chicken breast in pickle juice for 24 hours in the refrigerator.
- Mix flour, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, salt, and pepper to create the dredge.
- Crush corn flakes and set aside.
- Prepare the sauce by mixing chopped chives, mayonnaise, paprika, sriracha, and honey.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken breast in pickle juice for 24 hours.
- Prepare seasoned flour dredge and crush corn flakes.
- Mix honey-sriracha mayo sauce.
- Coat chicken in flour, egg, and corn flakes.
- Fry chicken until golden and crispy.
- Assemble sandwich on brioche bun with sauce.

cook_step:
- Heat oil to 350 degrees Fahrenheit for frying.
- Dredge the marinated chicken breast first in the flour mixture, then dip in beaten egg, and finally coat with crushed corn flakes.
- Fry the chicken breast in hot oil until golden brown and crispy, about 10-15 minutes depending on thickness.
- Toast the brioche bun lightly if desired.
- Assemble the sandwich by spreading the honey-sriracha sauce on the bun and placing the fried chicken breast inside.

name: Creamy Egg Salad Sandwich
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil the eggs until hard boiled and let them cool.
- Peel the eggs and chop them finely.
- Mix the chopped eggs with mayonnaise, salt, and black pepper.

quick_step:
- Boil and peel eggs.
- Chop eggs finely.
- Mix eggs with mayonnaise, salt, and pepper.
- Spread the mixture on bread slices.

cook_step:
- No cooking required beyond boiling the eggs.

name: Homemade Granola
instructions:
prep_step:
- Measure and combine oats, shredded coconut, chopped almonds, and chia seeds in a large bowl.

quick_step:
- Mix dry ingredients (oats, coconut, nuts, seeds).
- Heat oil and sweetener with cinnamon until boiling.
- Combine wet and dry ingredients.
- Spread on baking sheet and bake at 275°F for 45 minutes.
- Add raisins and store once cooled.

cook_step:
- In a saucepan, whisk together equal parts oil and sweetener with cinnamon and bring to a boil.
- Pour the hot mixture over the dry ingredients and fold until the mixture is wet but not soaked.
- Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet.
- Bake at 275°F (135°C) for 45 minutes until toasted and golden.
- Remove from oven, add raisins, toss to combine, and let cool before storing.

name: Paneer Bhurji
instructions:
prep_step:
- Crumble the paneer into small pieces.
- Chop onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and coriander.

quick_step:
- Sauté onions and green chilies in oil.
- Cook tomatoes with spices.
- Add paneer and mix well.
- Garnish with coriander and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onions until translucent.
- Add chopped green chilies and cook briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and oil separates.
- Add salt, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder; mix well.
- Add crumbled paneer and mix thoroughly with the masala.
- Add chopped coriander and mix well.
- Remove from heat and serve.

name: Stuffed Capsicum Omelette
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut the capsicum into bite-sized pieces.
- Beat the eggs with sugar, salt, and liquid sake.

quick_step:
- Chop capsicum into bite-sized pieces.
- Beat eggs with sugar, salt, and liquid sake.
- Cook capsicum in a pan with oil.
- Pour egg mixture over capsicum and cook until set.
- Serve hot as a nutritious breakfast.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add the chopped capsicum pieces.
- Pour the beaten egg mixture over the capsicum and cook until the eggs are set.

name: Masala Maggi Breakfast
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, tomatoes, green chili, and mixed vegetables finely.
- Keep all ingredients ready near the stove.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables finely.
- Sauté onions, chili, and tomatoes in oil.
- Add vegetables and spices, then water.
- Add noodles and masala, cook until done.
- Garnish and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions and green chili until translucent.
- Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add mixed vegetables and cook for 2-3 minutes.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; mix well.
- Pour water and bring it to a boil.
- Add Maggi noodles and the masala tastemaker packet.
- Cook until noodles are soft and water is mostly absorbed, stirring occasionally.
- Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Thalipeeth
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak wheat flour as required.
- Finely chop the large onion and green chili.
- Crush or finely chop garlic cloves.
- Mix ground wheat, besan, wheat flour, and soaked wheat flour in a large bowl.
- Add turmeric powder, sesame seeds, garlic, green chili, coriander powder, cumin powder, fenugreek seeds, and salt to the flour mixture.
- Add the finely chopped onion and mix everything well.
- Add water gradually and knead to form a thick but pliable dough.

quick_step:
- Mix all flours and spices with chopped onion and garlic.
- Knead into a thick dough with water.
- Roll out dough balls into flat rounds with a hole in the center.
- Cook on a hot pan with oil until both sides are golden and cooked.
- Serve hot as breakfast or snack.

cook_step:
- Heat a pan on medium heat.
- Take a ball of dough and place it on a cloth or plastic sheet greased with oil.
- Press the dough ball with a rolling pin to form a flat round shape with a hole in the center.
- Place the shaped dough on the hot pan.
- Pour some oil in the hole and around the edges.
- Cover and cook on medium heat for about 2 minutes.
- Flip the Thalipeeth and cook the other side for another 2 minutes until golden and cooked through.
- Remove from pan and serve hot.

name: Travel Friendly Methi Thepla
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and chop fresh methi leaves.
- Make a paste of methi, ginger, and green chillies.
- Sauté the methi, ginger, and green chillies paste well to remove excess moisture.

quick_step:
- Sauté methi, ginger, and green chillies paste to remove moisture.
- Knead dough using oil instead of ghee for softness and longer shelf life.
- Roll and cook theplas on a hot griddle.
- Cool completely and pack tightly to keep fresh for up to 10 days.

cook_step:
- Mix the sautéed methi paste with wheat flour, spices, and oil to knead a soft dough.
- Roll the dough into thin flatbreads (theplas).
- Cook the theplas on a hot griddle until both sides are golden brown.

name: Masala Cornflakes Mix
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut one cashew into two pieces.
- Measure and prepare all ingredients including moong dal, cashews, peanuts, curry leaves, spices, cornflakes, raisins, and roasted mustard seeds.

quick_step:
- Roast moong dal until light brown and set aside.
- Roast cashews and peanuts until brown and set aside.
- Roast curry leaves in oil and add spices.
- Mix in cornflakes, raisins, roasted nuts, and mustard seeds on low flame.
- Cool and store in an airtight container.

cook_step:
- Heat thirty ml oil in a wok on low to medium flame.
- Add moong dal and roast until light brown and aromatic, then remove and set aside.
- In the same wok, roast cashews on low flame until light brown, then remove and set aside with peanuts.
- Remove excess oil from wok and add ten ml oil.
- Add curry leaves and roast until crisp, then turn off the flame.
- Add salt, dry mango powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and sugar powder to the curry leaves and mix well.
- Add cornflakes and mix gently on low flame to keep them crisp.
- Add raisins, roasted cashews, peanuts, and roasted mustard seeds, then mix all ingredients well on low flame.
- Turn off the flame and let the mixture cool completely before storing.

name: Vegetable Sevai Upma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop all the vegetables into small pieces.
- Chop green chilies and ginger finely.
- Measure and keep vermicelli ready.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables and prepare ingredients.
- Tempered mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chili, and ginger in oil.
- Add vegetables and sauté.
- Boil water with salt and add vermicelli.
- Cook until water is absorbed and vermicelli is soft.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.
- Add curry leaves, chopped green chilies, and ginger; sauté for a minute.
- Add chopped vegetables and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
- Add water and salt; bring it to a boil.
- Add vermicelli to the boiling water and cook until the water is absorbed and vermicelli is soft.
- Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes on low heat.
- Turn off the heat and let it rest covered for a couple of minutes before serving.

name: Idiyappam with Hotel Style Vegetable Kurma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and chop the mixed vegetables into small pieces.
- Slice the onion and slit the green chilies.
- Grate the ginger and fresh coconut.
- Measure and prepare all spices and ingredients for the kurma.
- Boil water with salt for making the idiyappam dough.

quick_step:
- Prepare rice flour dough with boiling salted water for idiyappam.
- Steam the idiyappam noodles using an idiyappam press.
- Sauté whole spices and onions for the kurma base.
- Cook mixed vegetables with spices and coconut paste to make kurma.
- Serve steamed idiyappam hot with vegetable kurma.

cook_step:
- Prepare the idiyappam dough by mixing rice flour with boiling salted water and knead into a soft dough.
- Fill the idiyappam press with the dough and press the noodles onto idli plates or steaming trays.
- Steam the idiyappam for 8-10 minutes until cooked.
- Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom and sauté until aromatic.
- Add sliced onions, green chilies, and ginger; sauté until onions turn translucent.
- Add chopped vegetables, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt; cook for a few minutes.
- Grind grated coconut with some water to make a smooth paste and add it to the vegetables.
- Add water and cook the kurma covered until vegetables are tender.
- Add garam masala and chopped coriander leaves; cook for another 2 minutes and turn off the heat.
- Serve hot idiyappam with the vegetable kurma.

name: Appam with Vegetable Stew
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak rice and cooked rice separately for a few hours.
- Grind soaked rice and cooked rice into a smooth batter, add yeast and sugar, and ferment for 8-10 hours or overnight.
- Chop vegetables finely.
- Prepare spices by crushing cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves.

quick_step:
- Prepare and ferment appam batter.
- Chop and cook vegetables with spices in coconut milk to make stew.
- Cook appams on a pan until soft and fluffy.
- Simmer vegetable stew until creamy and flavorful.
- Serve appam hot with vegetable stew.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan, add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, ginger, green chili, and curry leaves and sauté.
- Add chopped vegetables and cook until tender.
- Pour in coconut milk and simmer gently, seasoning with salt.
- Heat a non-stick pan, pour fermented batter in a circular motion to form appams, cover and cook until edges are crisp and center is soft.
- Serve hot appams with vegetable stew.

name: Instant Ragi Dosa
instructions:
prep_step:
- Mix ragi flour and rice flour in a bowl.
- Add salt to taste.
- Gradually add water and whisk to form a smooth batter of pouring consistency.

quick_step:
- Mix ragi and rice flour with salt and water to make batter.
- Heat pan and pour batter, spreading thinly.
- Cook dosa with oil until crisp and golden.
- Serve hot with accompaniments.

cook_step:
- Heat a non-stick pan or griddle on medium heat.
- Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly in a circular motion.
- Drizzle some oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns crisp and edges lift.
- Flip if desired and cook the other side for a few seconds.
- Remove and serve hot with chutney or sambar.

name: Ragi Idli
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak idli rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 4-6 hours.
- Grind the soaked ingredients into a smooth batter using water as needed.
- Mix ragi flour into the batter and add salt.
- Allow the batter to ferment overnight or for 8-12 hours until it rises.

quick_step:
- Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds.
- Grind and mix with ragi flour and salt.
- Pour batter into molds and steam for 15 minutes.
- Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

cook_step:
- Grease idli molds and pour the fermented batter into them.
- Steam the idlis in an idli steamer or pressure cooker without the weight for 12-15 minutes.
- Check doneness by inserting a toothpick; it should come out clean.
- Remove idlis from molds and serve hot.

name: Millet Upma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak one hundred and twenty g foxtail millet in enough water for 15 minutes.
- Chop onion, green chillies, ginger, carrot, beans, and tomato.
- Gather curry leaves and measure dals and spices.

quick_step:
- Soak millet for 15 minutes.
- Prepare tempering with dals and spices in ghee.
- Sauté onions, chillies, ginger, and curry leaves.
- Add vegetables and spices; cook until soft.
- Add water and cook vegetables.
- Add soaked millet and cook covered until done.

cook_step:
- Heat ten ml ghee in a wide saucepan.
- Add five g chana dal, five g urad dal, two and one-half g mustard seeds, and two and one-half g cumin seeds for tempering.
- Once mustard seeds splatter, add chopped onion, green chillies, ginger, and curry leaves; sauté until onions turn transparent.
- Add chopped carrot, beans, and green peas; sauté for 2 minutes.
- Add chopped tomato, five g salt, and one and one-quarter g turmeric powder; sauté for 5 minutes.
- Add 1 one hundred and twenty ml water, cover, and cook vegetables for 5 minutes.
- Drain soaked millet and add to the pan; cover and cook on low flame for 15 minutes until millet is cooked and water is absorbed.

name: Korra Pongal
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash the pesarapam (millet) thoroughly in water.
- Soak rice overnight or for at least 2-3 hours for best results.
- Chop green chillies and ginger into small pieces.

quick_step:
- Wash and cook millet on low flame until colored.
- Pressure cook millet with soaked rice and salt.
- Prepare tempering with ghee, cumin, pepper, chillies, ginger, and curry leaves.
- Mix tempering into cooked millet and rice.
- Serve warm as a creamy, healthy Pongal.

cook_step:
- Cook the pesarapam on low flame for about 15 minutes until it gets a nice color.
- Add the cooked pesarapam to water in a pressure cooker along with soaked rice and salt.
- Pressure cook for 4 to 5 whistles on medium flame.
- In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds, black pepper, green chillies, ginger, and curry leaves; fry for 2 minutes.
- Add this tempering to the cooked millet and rice mixture and mix well.
- Allow the Pongal to thicken slightly before serving.

name: Ven Pongal
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash the rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
- Chop or slit the green chilies and finely chop or grate the ginger.
- Prepare the curry leaves by washing them well.

quick_step:
- Soak rice for 30 minutes.
- Boil rice with water and salt until cooked.
- Temper spices in ghee including cumin, pepper, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, and asafoetida.
- Mix cooked rice with tempered spices.
- Simmer for 15 minutes and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Boil nine hundred and sixty ml of water in a pot on medium flame.
- Add soaked rice and salt to the boiling water and cook until the rice is soft and cooked through.
- In a separate pan, heat ghee on low flame.
- Add cumin seeds, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, black peppercorns, and asafoetida to the ghee and sauté until fragrant.
- Add the cooked rice to the pan with the tempered spices and mix well.
- Simmer the mixture on low flame for 15 minutes to blend the flavors.
- Turn off the stove and serve hot.

name: Sweet Pongal
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak the rice and moong dal together for 15 minutes.
- Grate or chop jaggery if using a block.

quick_step:
- Soak rice and moong dal.
- Roast dal in ghee.
- Cook rice and dal with water until soft.
- Prepare jaggery syrup and add to cooked mixture.
- Add cardamom, fried nuts, and raisins.
- Simmer until creamy and serve warm.

cook_step:
- Roast moong dal in ghee until aromatic and slightly golden.
- Add soaked rice and water to the pot and cook until soft and mushy.
- Melt jaggery in a separate pan with a little water and strain to remove impurities.
- Add the jaggery syrup to the cooked rice and dal mixture and cook on low heat until combined and thickened.
- Add cardamom powder, fried cashews, and raisins in ghee, and mix into the pongal.
- Cook for a few more minutes until the pongal reaches a creamy consistency.

name: Egg Curry (Dhaba Style)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil the eggs, peel and set aside.
- Finely chop onions, mince garlic and ginger, and chop green chili.

quick_step:
- Boil and peel eggs.
- Prepare onion, garlic, ginger, and tomato base.
- Cook spices and tomato puree to make masala gravy.
- Add eggs to gravy and simmer.
- Garnish and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
- Add garlic, ginger, and green chili; sauté for a minute.
- Add coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder and mix well.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.
- Add water and salt, bring to a boil to form the gravy.
- Add boiled eggs and simmer for 10 minutes to absorb flavors.
- Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Dal Khichdi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash two hundred and forty g rice and two hundred and forty g moong dal together and keep aside.
- Chop onions, tomatoes, potatoes, green chillies, and prepare ginger and garlic (either chopped or paste).
- Measure out all spices and other ingredients.

quick_step:
- Wash rice and moong dal together and set aside.
- Sauté spices, ginger, garlic, onions, tomatoes, and vegetables in oil.
- Add spices, rice-dal mixture, and water; pressure cook for 4 whistles.
- Prepare optional tempering with ghee, garlic, and curry leaves.
- Mix tempering and garnish with coriander; serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat twenty ml oil in a pressure cooker.
- Add 1 one and one-quarter g asafoetida and five g cumin seeds; let them splutter.
- Add ginger, garlic, and curry leaves; sauté until fragrant.
- Add chopped onions and fry on medium flame for 3-4 minutes until onions change color.
- Add chopped tomatoes and green chillies; cook until tomatoes soften.
- Add chopped potatoes and green peas; mix well.
- Add five g turmeric powder, five g red chili powder, and five g garam masala powder; mix well.
- Add the washed rice and dal mixture; fry for 30 seconds on medium flame.
- Add one thousand four hundred and forty ml water and salt to taste; stir well.
- Close the pressure cooker lid and cook on medium flame for 4 whistles.
- Turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally before opening the lid.
- Optionally, prepare tempering by heating fifteen ml ghee, adding 4 garlic cloves and curry leaves, cooking until garlic turns brown, then pour over the khichdi.
- Garnish with chopped coriander leaves if desired and mix lightly.

name: Masala Sabudana Vada
instructions:
prep_step:
- Rinse sabudana thoroughly and soak in water for 4-5 hours or overnight until soft.
- Drain excess water from soaked sabudana and keep aside.
- Roast peanuts until golden and grind coarsely.
- Boil and peel potatoes, then mash them well.
- Chop green chilies and coriander leaves finely.

quick_step:
- Soak sabudana until soft.
- Roast and grind peanuts; boil and mash potatoes.
- Mix all ingredients into a dough.
- Shape into vadas and deep fry until golden and crispy.
- Drain and serve hot.

cook_step:
- In a mixing bowl, combine soaked sabudana, mashed potatoes, ground peanuts, green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander leaves, and salt.
- Mix all ingredients well to form a dough-like mixture.
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan on medium heat.
- Shape the mixture into small round flat vadas.
- Deep fry the vadas in hot oil until they turn golden brown and crispy.
- Remove and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.

name: Egg Cheese Toast
instructions:
prep_step:
- Crack the egg into a bowl and whisk lightly with salt and pepper.

quick_step:
- Whisk egg with seasoning.
- Cook egg in buttered pan.
- Add cheese slice to melt on egg.
- Toast bread slices.
- Assemble egg and cheese on toast.

cook_step:
- Heat butter in a pan over medium heat.
- Pour the whisked egg into the pan and cook until slightly set.
- Place the cheese slice on top of the egg and let it melt.
- Toast the bread until golden and crispy.
- Assemble the sandwich by placing the egg and melted cheese on the toasted bread.

name: Cheesy Scrambled Eggs
instructions:
prep_step:
- Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk thoroughly with a fork until well combined.

quick_step:
- Whisk eggs until combined.
- Melt butter in skillet over medium-high heat.
- Add eggs and stir continuously.
- Add cheese slices and keep stirring.
- Turn off heat when eggs are almost done, season with salt, and serve.

cook_step:
- Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat and add butter.
- Pour the whisked eggs into the skillet and keep stirring continuously.
- Add the American cheese slices early in the cooking process and continue stirring.
- When the eggs are almost cooked, turn off the heat and season with salt.
- Plate the scrambled eggs and serve immediately.

name: Aloo Gobi Recipe
instructions:
prep_step:
- Peel & cube 2 medium potatoes to make 1one hundred and twenty g pieces of three-quarters by three-quarters inch each. Keep them immersed in water until required.
- Chop a cauliflower head, to make four hundred and eighty g (one hundred and eighty g) florets, chopped to 1one-half inch. Optionally add the florets to slightly hot water and rest for 3 to 4 mins. Later rinse them well and drain.
- Fine chop 1 medium onion, to make three-quarters to two hundred and forty g chopped onions
- Deseed & fine chop 2 medium tomatoes to make three-quarters to two hundred and forty g (or sixty g canned tomato puree (without citric acid) or use thirty g tomato paste stirred with forty five ml water)
- Always sauté & cook potatoes until half done before adding the cauliflower. Potatoes take longer to cook than cauliflower so avoid adding them together to the pan.
- Do not add salt till the potatoes are almost done. Adding salt will prevent them from cooking well since there is not much water used.
- The latter part of cooking has to be done on a low flame which helps the veggies to release some moisture and cook well without burning.
- If using tomatoes do not add them until the potatoes are soft cooked. The acidity in tomatoes will prevent the aloo from cooking faster.
- This can be made without onion, tomatoes, garlic & even green chili. I do make this baby version for my young boys as they are fussy to eat it with all those ingredients.
- My recipe shared here has all of the above ingredients and makes the best aloo gobi. However leaving out onion or tomatoes is just okay and the dish still turns out good. Leaving out both makes the dish very dry so use more oil.
- For a quicker version, just toss potatoes and cauliflower in spice powders along with little oil. Then bake them in a oven or air fryer. Make the onion tomato masala and then add the baked potatoes and cauliflower to the masala.
- Chop cauliflower florets to 1one-half inch in size. Add them to slightly hot water and set aside for 3 to 4 mins.
- Drain the water and rinse them well. Drain them completely.
- Cube potatoes to three-quarters by three-quarters inch. or you can also slice them to three-quarters inch. Keep them immersed in a bowl of water until used. Keeping them in water helps the potatoes to cook faster as they soak up some moisture.
- Mince ginger and garlic. Keep this aside.
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. When they sizzle, add ginger garlic & saute for 30 seconds.
- Then add the onions & stir fry until transparent.
- Add the potatoes and green chilli. Stir fry for 2 to 3 mins. Cover and cook on a low to medium heat until they are half done. If required you can splash some water so they cook faster.
- Keep stirring in between and cook covered.
- When they are slightly tender but still under cooked, add the cauliflower & stir fry for about 3 mins.
- Add red chilli powder, turmeric, roasted cumin powder, garam masala and coriander powder.
- Mix well. Sprinkle 2 to forty five ml water all over the aloo gobi or across the sides of the pan & mix well. This step helps keep the aloo gobi moist without drying out.
- Cook covered, stirring every few minutes, until both aloo & gobi are almost fork tender. Add salt and continue to cook covered on a low flame until the potatoes are soft & fully cooked.
- The veggies will release moisture at this stage and cook quickly. So keep an eye not to over cook gobi at this stage. It must remain slightly crunchy yet cooked.
- Next add the tomatoes and kasuri methi. Fry on a medium to high flame until the raw smell of tomatoes is gone.
- If needed add little oil at this stage. It takes about 2 to 4 mins for the raw smell of tomatoes to go away.
- Sprinkle amchur if using. Finally garnish aloo gobi with coriander leaves. Sprinkle some lemon juice if you want. Serve with rice, roti or any bread.
- I have updated the recipe to prevent the aloo gobi drying out. Simply sprinkle some water as you cook.
- This recipe has been updated to make it more flavorsome.
- A heavy bottom pan with a lid works well for this dish.
- You can also grill the potatoes and cauliflower in a oven or air fryer. Then add them to the prepared onion tomato masala.

quick_step:
- Peel & cube 2 medium potatoes to make 1one hundred and twenty g pieces of three-quarters by three-quarters inch each. Keep them immersed in water until required.
- Chop a cauliflower head, to make four hundred and eighty g (one hundred and eighty g) florets, chopped to 1one-half inch. Optionally add the florets to slightly hot water and rest for 3 to 4 mins. Later rinse them well and drain.
- Fine chop 1 medium onion, to make three-quarters to two hundred and forty g chopped onions
- Deseed & fine chop 2 medium tomatoes to make three-quarters to two hundred and forty g (or sixty g canned tomato puree (without citric acid) or use thirty g tomato paste stirred with forty five ml water)

cook_step:
- Peel & cube 2 medium potatoes to make 1one hundred and twenty g pieces of three-quarters by three-quarters inch each. Keep them immersed in water until required.
- Chop a cauliflower head, to make four hundred and eighty g (one hundred and eighty g) florets, chopped to 1one-half inch. Optionally add the florets to slightly hot water and rest for 3 to 4 mins. Later rinse them well and drain.
- Fine chop 1 medium onion, to make three-quarters to two hundred and forty g chopped onions
- Deseed & fine chop 2 medium tomatoes to make three-quarters to two hundred and forty g (or sixty g canned tomato puree (without citric acid) or use thirty g tomato paste stirred with forty five ml water)
- Always sauté & cook potatoes until half done before adding the cauliflower. Potatoes take longer to cook than cauliflower so avoid adding them together to the pan.
- Do not add salt till the potatoes are almost done. Adding salt will prevent them from cooking well since there is not much water used.
- The latter part of cooking has to be done on a low flame which helps the veggies to release some moisture and cook well without burning.
- If using tomatoes do not add them until the potatoes are soft cooked. The acidity in tomatoes will prevent the aloo from cooking faster.
- This can be made without onion, tomatoes, garlic & even green chili. I do make this baby version for my young boys as they are fussy to eat it with all those ingredients.
- My recipe shared here has all of the above ingredients and makes the best aloo gobi. However leaving out onion or tomatoes is just okay and the dish still turns out good. Leaving out both makes the dish very dry so use more oil.
- For a quicker version, just toss potatoes and cauliflower in spice powders along with little oil. Then bake them in a oven or air fryer. Make the onion tomato masala and then add the baked potatoes and cauliflower to the masala.
- Chop cauliflower florets to 1one-half inch in size. Add them to slightly hot water and set aside for 3 to 4 mins.
- Drain the water and rinse them well. Drain them completely.
- Cube potatoes to three-quarters by three-quarters inch. or you can also slice them to three-quarters inch. Keep them immersed in a bowl of water until used. Keeping them in water helps the potatoes to cook faster as they soak up some moisture.
- Mince ginger and garlic. Keep this aside.
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. When they sizzle, add ginger garlic & saute for 30 seconds.
- Then add the onions & stir fry until transparent.
- Add the potatoes and green chilli. Stir fry for 2 to 3 mins. Cover and cook on a low to medium heat until they are half done. If required you can splash some water so they cook faster.
- Keep stirring in between and cook covered.
- When they are slightly tender but still under cooked, add the cauliflower & stir fry for about 3 mins.
- Add red chilli powder, turmeric, roasted cumin powder, garam masala and coriander powder.
- Mix well. Sprinkle 2 to forty five ml water all over the aloo gobi or across the sides of the pan & mix well. This step helps keep the aloo gobi moist without drying out.
- Cook covered, stirring every few minutes, until both aloo & gobi are almost fork tender. Add salt and continue to cook covered on a low flame until the potatoes are soft & fully cooked.
- The veggies will release moisture at this stage and cook quickly. So keep an eye not to over cook gobi at this stage. It must remain slightly crunchy yet cooked.
- Next add the tomatoes and kasuri methi. Fry on a medium to high flame until the raw smell of tomatoes is gone.
- If needed add little oil at this stage. It takes about 2 to 4 mins for the raw smell of tomatoes to go away.
- Sprinkle amchur if using. Finally garnish aloo gobi with coriander leaves. Sprinkle some lemon juice if you want. Serve with rice, roti or any bread.
- I have updated the recipe to prevent the aloo gobi drying out. Simply sprinkle some water as you cook.
- This recipe has been updated to make it more flavorsome.
- A heavy bottom pan with a lid works well for this dish.
- You can also grill the potatoes and cauliflower in a oven or air fryer. Then add them to the prepared onion tomato masala.

name: Baingan Bharta Recipe (Eggplant Bharta)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Rinse eggplants well under running water and wipe dry with a kitchen tissue. Make 4 slits on the brinjal. If you want to use the garlic & chili – push the garlic cloves deep inside 2 slits. Also push the slit green chilies in the other 2 slits. Brush them with oil.
- On Direct Fire : With the help of a tong, place it on direct fire. You can do it either on the red hot coal or stovetop. Keep turning it to all the other sides and grill until it is done completely roasted & cooked through. It takes about 12 to 14 mins.
- To grill in oven : Line a metal tray with foil. Cut each eggplant to 2 parts and place them on the tray with the skin side on top. You can also place the tomatoes in the same tray. Broil/Grill them at 460 F or 240 C for 16 to 20 mins.
- In air fryer : Place baingan, chilies, garlic and tomatoes in the air fryer basket. Air fry at 400 F or 200 C. It takes roughly about 22 mins for the whole eggplant, 16 mins if you halve the eggplant & air fry.
- Once done, check by inserting a fork into the eggplant. It should go in smoothly & easily meaning it is soft and cooked well. (Check step-by-step photos above)
- Cool the eggplant and peel the skin. Optionally – Transfer the eggplant to a bowl and cover it for 5 mins. Once done remove the skin.
- Mash or chop the eggplant, grilled garlic and green chilies. Keep these aside. Peel and chop the tomatoes, onions and raw garlic as well.
- Pour oil to a hot pan. When the oil turns hot, add chopped ginger and garlic. Saute for 30 to 60 seconds until aromatic.
- Stir in the chopped onions and saute until they turn light golden, for 6 to 7 mins.
- Add tomatoes and salt. Cook until they become soft for 5 to 6 mins. Add red chili powder and cook for a few minutes until the raw smell from the tomatoes is gone, for 1 to 2 mins.
- Stir in the mashed eggplants, garlic and green chilies. (You may want to save half of the green chilies for later after taste testing)
- Mix and mash it a bit to blend well. Saute for 7 to 8 minutes on a medium heat & stir in the garam masala if using. Turn off the stove.
- Taste test and add more salt and green chili if required. Garnish with coriander leaves. If you like squeeze some lemon juice.
- Serve baingan bharta with roti, rice or naan.
- I love using extra garlic and chilies so I stuff the eggplants with some garlic cloves and chilies. If you don’t want, you may omit.
- Traditional bharta does not use garam masala as the charcoal grilled eggplants have a unique flavor of their own. Since I do not grill my eggplants on charcoal grill we do prefer garam masala. However it is a personal preference and you may omit it if you don’t like or simply use coriander powder along with red chili powder.
- For extra heat (spice) in the dish, you can use more green chilies. Adding more red chili powder will alter the flavor of the bharta.
- You can add half teaspoon cumin seeds to the oil before frying the ginger garlic.
- Use eggplants that have a smooth and glossy skin. Avoid over-matured eggplants with lots of seeds.
- After grilling the eggplants if you find seeds inside, just scoop them out and discard.
- For more authentic flavors & taste, grill eggplants on red hot coal.
- Adjust the amount of spices and tomatoes to your taste.
- For more tang add some lemon juice while serving.

name: Bhindi Fry Recipe | Okra Stir Fry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Choose okra or bhindi that are young and tender. Wash them well under running water.
- Drain them to a colander. Wipe off with a clean kitchen cloth or tissues.
- Cut off both the ends and discard. Chop them to half inch pieces. Set aside.
- Pour oil in a pan. When the oil turns hot, add half teaspoon cumin and allow them to splutter.
- Then add chopped bhindi and 1 slit green chili.
- Begin to saute them in oil on a medium heat. Stirring as often as needed. Over stirring can make them more slimy.
- You can skip this step and just use garam masala. While the bhindi gets fried, in a different pan dry roast peanuts and garlic on a medium flame until deep golden and aromatic. Then add coconut and sesame (both optional).  Lastly add in jeera. Saute just for a minute. When the sesame seeds begin to splutter turn off the stove. Cool completely. Make a coarse powder.
- When the bhindi shrinks and is no more slimy or sticky, then add salt and turmeric.
- Fry until bhindi is done to your liking. I usually take off the bhindi when it is no more slimy.
- Pour five ml oil to the center of the pan, add chili powder to the oil.
- Mix well and saute the bhindi for another 2 mins until the raw smell of the chili goes away.
- Now add the powdered peanuts and mix well.
- Serve bhindi fry with rice or roti as a side.

name: Stuffed Capsicum | Stuffed Bell Peppers Recipe
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil or steam 3 medium or 2 large potatoes until soft. I prefer to steam the veggies so they don’t over cook. You can also boil the whole potatoes in a cooker or in a pot. Here I peeled and diced the potatoes, transferred to a steam basket. I steamed them over a pot.
- You can sprinkle some mozzarella cheese on the stuffed bell peppers.
- Potatoes can be replaced with sweet potatoes or even with some cooked quinoa.
- If you love paneer, then you can stuff this paneer bhurji .
- You can simply scramble some eggs and fill it in the bell peppers.
- Stuff it with this chicken keema to make them chicken stuffed bell peppers.
- To make them keema stuffed peppers, make this mutton keema and stuff.
- Dice & steam potatoes, carrots & peas until fork tender, without making them mushy.
- Chop off the bell pepper tops and set aside. Deseed them as well. If you want you may level the bottom too so they stand well while cooking but make sure the bottom is still closed to hold the stuffing.
- Cut & save the edible portion of the capsicum tops to use in the stuffing.
- Heat fifteen ml oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and garlic. Let the garlic fry for 30 seconds.
- Then add the onions & chopped bell pepper tops. Saute until golden.
- Add chili powder, garam masala, kasuri methi. Mix & saute for 1 min.
- Next add the steamed veggies and mash them. Mix together salt and coriander leaves.
- Stuff the bell peppers with this potato mixture. Fry them in fifteen ml oil stirring often. You can also cover and cook for sometime.
- Baking: To bake them preheat the oven at 200 C or 400 F and bake for 8 to 15 mins depending on the size of capsicums.
- Serve stuffed bell peppers as a appetizer or side in your meal.

name: Veg Burger Recipe (Veggie Burger)
instructions:
prep_step:
- salt (use a bit, only if needed)
- To a small mixing bowl, add mayonnaise or Greek yogurt, mustard, olive oil, garlic, chilli flakes and black pepper. Taste test and add salt if needed. If your mayo is not sour add lemon juice as well. Mix and refrigerate until needed later.
- Pour 2 one-half to seven hundred and twenty ml water to a steamer/ cooker or a pot. Place a trivet or a rack inside the pot. Cover and bring the water to a boil.
- Meanwhile rinse potatoes & French beans. Trim off both ends of French beans and fine chop them. Peel and cube potatoes to 1 inch pieces. Add them to a steamer basket and place them in the steamer.
- Steam them until half done for about 5 to 7 mins. Meanwhile, peel and chop carrots to 1 inch pieces.
- When the potatoes are half done, transfer carrots & peas to the steamer. Cover and steam them until potatoes are done completely and fork tender. Even peas and carrots should be done by now.
- Cool all these steamed veggies and transfer to a mixing bowl. Once cool mash them well and then add garam masala, coriander powder, green chilies, coriander leaves and salt.
- Mix all of them. You will have a mushy and sticky mixture. To this add, bread crumbs or powdered poha or flour in batches only as needed.
- The mixture for the patties must not be too soggy or too moist. Slight stickiness is alright but it has to be firm. If not add more bread crumbs. Check pictures in the step by step photo section in the post.
- Taste test the mixture and add more salt or any seasoning if you prefer. Divide the dough to 4 to 6 portions depending on how thick or thin you want the patties to be.
- To a small mixing bowl, add gram flour or corn starch to make the batter. Add a pinch of salt & pour water just enough to make a fairly thick batter. Do not make the batter runny as the excess moisture will be soaked up by the patties making them too soft.
- Pour bread crumbs or panko crumbs to a wide bowl or plate.
- Take one portion of the vegetable patty mixture and flatten it to the same size as your burger bun. If the mixture is sticking. Place the patty in some flour or corn starch. This way make all the patties and place them aside in a plate.
- Dip each patty in the batter completely and then place them in the bread crumbs. Coat the patty well with the crumbs including the sides.
- This way coat all the patties and set them aside. Rest these for 10 mins so the crumbs stick well to the patties and don’t mess the oil/ pan while frying.
- Rinse each lettuce leaf separately under a slow stream of running water. You may also sprinkle a solution of 1 part vinegar mixed with 3 parts of water. Rinse well and let them sit of kitchen tissues so all of the water drips away.
- Slice onions and tomatoes to round thin slices. If needed deseed the tomatoes.
- Refer notes section to bake or air fry the patties. To pan fry , heat a pan with 1one-half to thirty ml oil. Let the oil become hot, then place 2 to 3 patties as many as your pan fits. Rotate the patties with your fingers gently to coat the patties with the oil.
- Fry them on a medium high heat until the base turns golden and crisp. Flip them gently and pour 1 one-half to thirty ml oil as needed. Fry until crisp & uniformly golden. For a proper golden to brown crust, increase the flame the last 2 mins.
- To shallow fry , pour one hundred and twenty ml oil to a small pan and heat it. When the oil becomes hot, gently place the patties in the hot oil & fry until golden.
- Gently turn them to the other side and fry until golden & crisp. Remove them to a wired rack to cool slightly before assembling. To make cheese burgers, place cheese slices over the very hot patties.
- Once done with frying the patties, transfer the oil to a cup. Slice each bun to 2 parts and spread some butter on the buns if you prefer. Toast them in the same hot pan. Remove them and set aside.
- Before assembling please recheck – Lettuce should not have any water dripping, patties not too hot and the burger bun is also not hot.
- Place the toasted bun in a serving tray and then the veggie patty. Optionally spread the burger sauce we made earlier or some ketchup to keep the patty in place. However this is optional & skip if you want your patty very crisp.
- Place the lettuce, then the onion and tomatoes. Optionally drizzle some sauce over the lettuce and onions if you like. Spread more sauce over the top slice of your bun and place it over the burger.
- Burgers are ready to serve. Potato wedges, boiled corn, cheese balls are some of the great sides.
- Vegetables like broccoli, cauliflower, sweet potatoes & sweet corn can also be used. Just steam them with other veggies.
- Mushrooms and spinach can be sautéed, chopped finely & then added to the mashed vegetables for patties.
- To make the patties completely breadcrumb free, use powdered poha, roasted gram flour (sattu), roasted besan or crushed cornflakes for binding. For the crumb coating, use powdered poha or crushed cornflakes.
- Spice them with any seasoning you like.
- Use vegan yogurt like this almond yogurt , eggless mayo or any vegan mayonnaise like nut mayo.
- Simply skip mayo and use guacamole or cream cheese or just any vegan cheese.

cook_step:
- salt (use a bit, only if needed)

- Before assembling please recheck – Lettuce should not have any water dripping, patties not too hot and the burger bun is also not hot.
- Place the toasted bun in a serving tray and then the veggie patty. Optionally spread the burger sauce we made earlier or some ketchup to keep the patty in place. However this is optional & skip if you want your patty very crisp.
- Place the lettuce, then the onion and tomatoes. Optionally drizzle some sauce over the lettuce and onions if you like. Spread more sauce over the top slice of your bun and place it over the burger.
