- Simply skip mayo and use guacamole or cream cheese or just any vegan cheese.

name: Navratan Korma Recipe (Navratan Curry)
instructions:
prep_step:
- I haven’t used yogurt or milk in this recipe. But you can always use one of them. To incorporate milk or yogurt, simply blend the onions and cashews with either sixty ml yogurt or sixty ml milk to a smooth paste.
- Yogurt adds a mild tang to the korma and milk adds a different rich flavor.
- To make the recipe vegan, use more cashews, skip cream and paneer. Or you can also substitute cream with coconut cream and paneer with tofu.
- A lot of restaurants use canned pineapple for garnish. They taste sweet & delicious because they are canned with sugar syrup. If using fresh pineapple make sure it is ripe and sweet. Also adding sour pineapple is likely to split your korma since cream has been added to it.
- Skip the chili powder for a milder korma. Alternately add black pepper.
- Don’t overcook the paneer. You may add it directly to the hot gravy.
- Bring seven hundred and twenty ml of water to a rolling boil in a pot. Add onions and cashews to it and boil for 3 mins until the raw smell of the onions has gone. Turn off the stove.
- Remove the onions and cashews with a slotted spoon. Set them aside to cool and later grind it along with green chili to a smooth paste in a grinder jar.
- To the same hot water, add the cauliflower florets and leave them for 1 minute. Later drain the water and rinse them under running water. This blanching is done to get rid of any worms in the florets so you may skip this step if not required. Set aside.
- Heat five ml oil or butter in a pan. Add cashews and almonds. Fry until light golden and then add raisins. As soon as the raisins swell remove all of the nuts and raisins to a small plate.
- To the same pan, add paneer and fry for 2 mins. Do not over fry they turn hard and chewy. If you want soft paneer, Keep them immersed in little warm water until we use later.
- There are 2 ways you can prepare the veggies. The first method is to immerse all the veggies in 1.one thousand two hundred ml of water and boil them until fork tender.
- The other method is to steam them. For this bring four hundred and eighty ml of water to a boil in a steamer. Place the potatoes in a steam basket and stem until half done. Later add the rest of the veggies and steam together until just cooked. Do not over cook them.
- On a low flame, heat oil or butter in a pan. Add cinnamon, cumin, bay leaf, cardamom and cloves to the hot oil.
- When they begin to sizzle Add ginger garlic paste and fry until the raw smell has gone.
- Then add the ground onion cashew paste and cook until it turns thick to a mass and begins to leave the pan, meaning the paste is cooked well.
- Add the ground spices – chili powder, garam masala, turmeric and coriander powder along with salt.
- Saute until oil begins to separate from the mixture.
- Pour three-quarters to two hundred and forty ml water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until slightly thick. Taste test and add more salt if required.
- Add all the steamed veggies and cook covered for 2 mins. Pour cream and stir.
- Add fried paneer and nuts. Turn off the heat and add kewra water or rose water if using. If using pineapple cool down the navratan korma slightly and add the pineapple chunks.
- Garnish navaratan korma with coriander, pomegranate arils and raisins.
- You may skip the cream in the recipe by increasing the quantity of cashews to 18 but it won’t be the same.
- If your cream does not have any stabilizers, it may split if you add it directly to the curry. So temper it first by pouring the cream to a small bowl and then stir in a few tablespoons of gravy with it. Then add back the entire thing to the pan.
- This korma tastes sweetish and a lot of times restaurants don’t add any ground spice that imparts heat to it, like green chilies or red chilli is not added. So it is up to you. You can also simply add some crushed black pepper for the mild heat.

quick_step:
- I haven’t used yogurt or milk in this recipe. But you can always use one of them. To incorporate milk or yogurt, simply blend the onions and cashews with either sixty ml yogurt or sixty ml milk to a smooth paste.
- Yogurt adds a mild tang to the korma and milk adds a different rich flavor.
- To make the recipe vegan, use more cashews, skip cream and paneer. Or you can also substitute cream with coconut cream and paneer with tofu.
- A lot of restaurants use canned pineapple for garnish. They taste sweet & delicious because they are canned with sugar syrup. If using fresh pineapple make sure it is ripe and sweet. Also adding sour pineapple is likely to split your korma since cream has been added to it.
- Skip the chili powder for a milder korma. Alternately add black pepper.

cook_step:
- I haven’t used yogurt or milk in this recipe. But you can always use one of them. To incorporate milk or yogurt, simply blend the onions and cashews with either sixty ml yogurt or sixty ml milk to a smooth paste.
- Yogurt adds a mild tang to the korma and milk adds a different rich flavor.
- To make the recipe vegan, use more cashews, skip cream and paneer. Or you can also substitute cream with coconut cream and paneer with tofu.
- A lot of restaurants use canned pineapple for garnish. They taste sweet & delicious because they are canned with sugar syrup. If using fresh pineapple make sure it is ripe and sweet. Also adding sour pineapple is likely to split your korma since cream has been added to it.
- Skip the chili powder for a milder korma. Alternately add black pepper.
- Don’t overcook the paneer. You may add it directly to the hot gravy.
- Bring seven hundred and twenty ml of water to a rolling boil in a pot. Add onions and cashews to it and boil for 3 mins until the raw smell of the onions has gone. Turn off the stove.
- Remove the onions and cashews with a slotted spoon. Set them aside to cool and later grind it along with green chili to a smooth paste in a grinder jar.
- To the same hot water, add the cauliflower florets and leave them for 1 minute. Later drain the water and rinse them under running water. This blanching is done to get rid of any worms in the florets so you may skip this step if not required. Set aside.
- Heat five ml oil or butter in a pan. Add cashews and almonds. Fry until light golden and then add raisins. As soon as the raisins swell remove all of the nuts and raisins to a small plate.
- To the same pan, add paneer and fry for 2 mins. Do not over fry they turn hard and chewy. If you want soft paneer, Keep them immersed in little warm water until we use later.
- There are 2 ways you can prepare the veggies. The first method is to immerse all the veggies in 1.one thousand two hundred ml of water and boil them until fork tender.
- The other method is to steam them. For this bring four hundred and eighty ml of water to a boil in a steamer. Place the potatoes in a steam basket and stem until half done. Later add the rest of the veggies and steam together until just cooked. Do not over cook them.
- On a low flame, heat oil or butter in a pan. Add cinnamon, cumin, bay leaf, cardamom and cloves to the hot oil.
- When they begin to sizzle Add ginger garlic paste and fry until the raw smell has gone.
- Then add the ground onion cashew paste and cook until it turns thick to a mass and begins to leave the pan, meaning the paste is cooked well.
- Add the ground spices – chili powder, garam masala, turmeric and coriander powder along with salt.
- Saute until oil begins to separate from the mixture.
- Pour three-quarters to two hundred and forty ml water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until slightly thick. Taste test and add more salt if required.
- Add all the steamed veggies and cook covered for 2 mins. Pour cream and stir.
- Add fried paneer and nuts. Turn off the heat and add kewra water or rose water if using. If using pineapple cool down the navratan korma slightly and add the pineapple chunks.
- Garnish navaratan korma with coriander, pomegranate arils and raisins.
- You may skip the cream in the recipe by increasing the quantity of cashews to 18 but it won’t be the same.
- If your cream does not have any stabilizers, it may split if you add it directly to the curry. So temper it first by pouring the cream to a small bowl and then stir in a few tablespoons of gravy with it. Then add back the entire thing to the pan.
- This korma tastes sweetish and a lot of times restaurants don’t add any ground spice that imparts heat to it, like green chilies or red chilli is not added. So it is up to you. You can also simply add some crushed black pepper for the mild heat.

name: Easy & Healthy Chicken Fried Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut chicken into cubes.
- Marinate chicken with olive oil, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, and soy sauce; mix well.

quick_step:
- Marinate and cook chicken until golden brown.
- Sauté mixed vegetables and onions.
- Combine chicken, eggs, vegetables, and cooked rice.
- Add soy sauce and mix well before serving.

cook_step:
- Cook chicken on medium heat for 4 minutes on each side until golden brown; set aside.
- Add mixed vegetables and chopped onions to the pan; cook until browned.
- Add eggs and scramble by stirring continuously.
- Mix scrambled eggs and vegetables together.
- Add cooked chicken and cooked rice to the pan.
- Add more soy sauce and mix everything well.
- Serve hot.

name: Veg Biryani
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil water with black pepper, cinnamon, bay leaf, and ghee.
- Soak the rice in the boiling water and cook until done.
- Mix curd with biryani masala, garam masala, coriander powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, and turmeric powder.
- Chop onions, green chillies, tomatoes, potatoes, coriander, and mint leaves.
- Cut potatoes into medium-sized pieces.

quick_step:
- Boil and cook rice with whole spices.
- Prepare masala base by cooking onions, green chillies, garlic, and tomatoes with spices.
- Add potatoes and cook until tender.
- Layer cooked rice with masala and herbs, then cook covered for 5 minutes.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions, cook until soft.
- Add green chillies and garlic paste, cook briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes and salt, increase flame and cook until tomatoes are soft.
- Add biryani masala and cook until oil separates.
- Add potatoes and cook well.
- Add the cooked biryani rice, chopped coriander, and mint leaves, mix gently.
- Cover and cook on medium flame for 5 minutes to let flavors combine and rice finish cooking.
- Turn off the stove and serve hot.

name: Chicken Biryani
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
- Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, salt, and lemon juice for at least 30 minutes.
- Slice onions thinly and chop tomatoes, coriander, and mint leaves.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with spices and yogurt.
- Soak and parboil basmati rice.
- Cook chicken with onions, spices, and tomatoes.
- Layer chicken and rice, add herbs and garam masala.
- Cook on low heat to finish (dum cooking).

cook_step:
- Heat oil or ghee in a heavy-bottomed pot and fry whole spices until aromatic.
- Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add marinated chicken and cook until chicken is tender and oil separates.
- Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and cook until tomatoes soften.
- Parboil the soaked rice with salt and whole spices until 70% cooked.
- Layer the chicken curry and parboiled rice in the pot, sprinkle garam masala, coriander, and mint leaves.
- Cover tightly and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-25 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
- Turn off heat and let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Chana Masala Recipe (Chickpea Masala)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Rinse dried chickpeas at least thrice. Soak them in 3 one-half to nine hundred and sixty ml of water overnight or for at least 8 hours.
- Drain the water and rinse them well. Pour water and pressure cook for 5 to 6 whistles on a stovetop cooker. You may also cook in an instant pot for 18 minutes on a high pressure. Let the pressure drop naturally.
- Make sure your chickpeas are soft and tender. Squeeze a chickpea to test, it should get mashed fully. If not cook them for a little longer.
- Heat a large pot and pour oil. When the oil turns slightly hot, add the whole spices – cinnamon, cloves, cardamoms and bay leaf.
- When they begin to sizzle add the onions and green chili. Saute until they turn light golden.
- Add ginger garlic paste and saute for a minute without burning.
- Add tomatoes and salt. Let cook until mushy, pulpy and thick.
- Stir in red chilli powder, turmeric, garam masala, coriander powder and cumin powder. Saute until the masala begins to smell good, for about 3 to 4 mins.
- Optional – If you want a smooth curry, cool this, discard the bay leaf, green chili and cinnamon. Blend in a blender to a smooth or coarse paste to suit your liking. I prefer to blend in 2 tbsps cooked chana along with the onion tomato masala. Add that puree back to the pan.
- Add the chana along with the chana stock or water (1sixty g). Pour another three-quarters to two hundred and forty ml water. If you don't puree the onion tomato masala, you will require lesser water. If using canned chickpeas, drain and rinse them before adding with 1one hundred and eighty ml water.
- Mix well. Taste test and add more salt. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
- When the consistency is thick (check pics), add amchur powder (optional) and kasuri methi.
- Garnish Chana masala with coriander leaves. Sprinkle some lemon juice if required. Serve with Basmati Rice , Jeera Rice, Naan or Chapati.
- To make the recipe in Instant pot, make the onion tomato masala on saute mode. Optionally If you want you may cool and blend this. Add the soaked chickpeas with four hundred and eighty ml water. Deglaze and Pressure cook on high for 35 minutes. When the pressure drops, open the lid. Cook on a saute mode for a few minutes until thick. Add kasuri methi and amchur.
- This recipe has been updated recently to make it simpler. If you prefer a chunky gravy do not blend the onion tomato masala. For a little texture, make a coarse paste & for a smoother curry blend it to a smooth paste.
- Use a good fragrant garam masala to make a flavorsome curry. Adjust the quantity of ground spices to suit your taste. If your garam masala is too strong, you may cut down by one and one-quarter g.
- Whole spices can be skipped but they add an extra layer of flavors. If you wish to blend the onion tomato masala, discard bay leaf and cinnamon.
- Ginger and garlic to be used in equal quantities. You can also use only fifteen g ginger  and skip garlic.
- If using bottled tomato puree, You may need more ground spices to balance the extra tart flavor.

cook_step:
- Rinse dried chickpeas at least thrice. Soak them in 3 one-half to nine hundred and sixty ml of water overnight or for at least 8 hours.
- Drain the water and rinse them well. Pour water and pressure cook for 5 to 6 whistles on a stovetop cooker. You may also cook in an instant pot for 18 minutes on a high pressure. Let the pressure drop naturally.
- Make sure your chickpeas are soft and tender. Squeeze a chickpea to test, it should get mashed fully. If not cook them for a little longer.
- Heat a large pot and pour oil. When the oil turns slightly hot, add the whole spices – cinnamon, cloves, cardamoms and bay leaf.
- When they begin to sizzle add the onions and green chili. Saute until they turn light golden.
- Add ginger garlic paste and saute for a minute without burning.
- Add tomatoes and salt. Let cook until mushy, pulpy and thick.
- Stir in red chilli powder, turmeric, garam masala, coriander powder and cumin powder. Saute until the masala begins to smell good, for about 3 to 4 mins.
- Optional – If you want a smooth curry, cool this, discard the bay leaf, green chili and cinnamon. Blend in a blender to a smooth or coarse paste to suit your liking. I prefer to blend in 2 tbsps cooked chana along with the onion tomato masala. Add that puree back to the pan.
- Add the chana along with the chana stock or water (1sixty g). Pour another three-quarters to two hundred and forty ml water. If you don't puree the onion tomato masala, you will require lesser water. If using canned chickpeas, drain and rinse them before adding with 1one hundred and eighty ml water.
- Mix well. Taste test and add more salt. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
- When the consistency is thick (check pics), add amchur powder (optional) and kasuri methi.
- Garnish Chana masala with coriander leaves. Sprinkle some lemon juice if required. Serve with Basmati Rice , Jeera Rice, Naan or Chapati.
- To make the recipe in Instant pot, make the onion tomato masala on saute mode. Optionally If you want you may cool and blend this. Add the soaked chickpeas with four hundred and eighty ml water. Deglaze and Pressure cook on high for 35 minutes. When the pressure drops, open the lid. Cook on a saute mode for a few minutes until thick. Add kasuri methi and amchur.
- This recipe has been updated recently to make it simpler. If you prefer a chunky gravy do not blend the onion tomato masala. For a little texture, make a coarse paste & for a smoother curry blend it to a smooth paste.
- Use a good fragrant garam masala to make a flavorsome curry. Adjust the quantity of ground spices to suit your taste. If your garam masala is too strong, you may cut down by one and one-quarter g.
- Whole spices can be skipped but they add an extra layer of flavors. If you wish to blend the onion tomato masala, discard bay leaf and cinnamon.
- Ginger and garlic to be used in equal quantities. You can also use only fifteen g ginger  and skip garlic.
- If using bottled tomato puree, You may need more ground spices to balance the extra tart flavor.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Dice paneer into cubes.
- Soak cashews in warm water for 15 minutes.
- Chop onions, green chillies, and tomatoes.
- Blend soaked cashews with tomatoes to make a smooth puree.

quick_step:
- Dice and fry paneer cubes with spices in butter.
- Soak cashews and blend with tomatoes to make puree.
- Prepare tadka with cumin, chillies, and onions.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and spices, then tomato-cashew puree.
- Add paneer cubes, simmer, and garnish with coriander and kasoori methi.

cook_step:
- Heat butter in a pan, add paneer cubes with salt, turmeric, and red chilli powder; fry until golden brown on all sides and set aside.
- In the same pan, add jeera, whole red chillies, green chillies, and chopped onions; sauté until onions turn translucent.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and basic masalas; fry until raw smell disappears.
- Add the tomato-cashew puree and cook until the oil separates.
- Add fried paneer cubes to the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.
- Garnish with coriander leaves and kasoori methi before serving.

name: Dal Tadka
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak the mixed dal if desired.
- Chop onions, tomatoes, green chilli, fresh ginger, and coriander leaves.

quick_step:
- Pressure cook mixed dal with turmeric and chilli powder.
- Prepare onion-tomato sauté with spices.
- Combine cooked dal with sautéed mixture and season.
- Make tempering with ghee, dry chillies, ginger, and Kashmiri chilli powder.
- Pour tempering over dal and simmer briefly before serving.

cook_step:
- Add one thousand ml water to three hundred g mixed dal along with turmeric and red chilli powder in a pressure cooker.
- Cook the dal for 3 whistles until soft.
- Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
- Add ginger garlic paste and green chilli; sauté briefly.
- Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add salt after tomatoes are cooked.
- Add cooked dal to the pan; if thick, add some water and mix well.
- Add garam masala, kasturi methi, and chopped coriander leaves; mix well.
- In a separate small pan, heat ghee for tempering.
- Add dry red chillies, finely chopped ginger, and Kashmiri chilli powder; sauté briefly.
- Pour the tempering over the dal and mix well.
- Simmer for a few minutes to blend flavors and serve hot.

name: Rajma Chawal
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak rajma (red kidney beans) overnight or for at least 6-8 hours.
- Chop onions finely.
- Prepare ginger, garlic, and green chili paste.

quick_step:
- Soak rajma overnight.
- Sauté spices and onions in mustard oil.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree; cook well.
- Add spices and soaked rajma with water.
- Simmer until rajma is cooked and gravy thickens.
- Garnish and serve hot with steamed rice.

cook_step:
- Heat mustard oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, bay leaves, dried red chillies, and a pinch of asafoetida; sauté well.
- Add chopped onions and cook for 8-10 minutes until golden brown.
- Add ginger, garlic, green chili paste, and thirty g asafoetida; mix well.
- Add tomato puree and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, rajma masala, garam masala, and salt; mix well.
- Add soaked rajma and enough water to cover; stir in kasuri methi powder.
- Cover and cook on low heat for 5-6 minutes or until rajma is tender and gravy thickens.
- Do not overcook or let it dry out; adjust consistency as needed.

name: Chole Bhature
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash the Kabuli chana twice and soak it in alkaline water with 1.twenty five g sweet soda for 6 hours.
- Soak two hundred and forty g semolina in two hundred and forty ml water for 5 minutes until soft, then drain excess water.
- Make a dough by mixing semolina, wheat flour dough, ten g salt, ten g sugar, 1.twenty five g sweet soda, and ten ml curd; knead well for 7 minutes until smooth and soft.
- Add fifteen ml oil to the dough and knead for another 3-4 minutes, then coat the dough with oil, cover with a cloth, and let it rest for 6 hours.
- Grind 2 medium onions with five g anardana into a paste without adding water.
- Grind 2 tomatoes separately and strain the juice to remove excess water.
- Peel and chop the potato.
- Prepare dry spices: cardamom, black pepper, cloves, and tea leaves.

quick_step:
- Soak chickpeas in alkaline water for 6 hours.
- Prepare soft dough with semolina, curd, and flour; rest for 6 hours.
- Cook spiced onion-tomato masala with chickpeas and potatoes in a pressure cooker.
- Temper the chole with ghee, ajwain, and ginger.
- Roll and deep fry the dough into fluffy bhature.
- Serve hot bhature with spicy chole.

cook_step:
- Heat ten ml oil in a pressure cooker and add cardamom, black pepper, cloves; fry briefly until aromatic.
- Add the onion and anardana paste, salt, and fry until the mixture is sticky and cooked.
- Add 1-ten g ginger garlic paste and fry for a minute.
- Add the strained tomato juice and cook on medium-high flame until raw smell disappears and oil separates.
- Add red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and fry the masala for 2 minutes until oil shines.
- Add 1.twenty five g sweet soda to the masala and mix well.
- Add soaked chickpeas, chopped potato, dry amla pieces, tea leaves, and 1.one thousand two hundred ml water; mix and pressure cook for 5-6 whistles on high flame.
- Lower the flame and simmer for 10 minutes, then turn off the gas and allow pressure to release naturally.
- Mash the potatoes slightly in the cooked chole and bring the mixture to a boil again.
- Heat fifteen ml ghee in a pan, add 1.seventy five g ajwain and ginger, cook for 15-20 seconds, then add this tempering to the chole.
- Divide the rested dough into portions, roll each into a puri shape without drying the dough.
- Heat oil for deep frying; fry each rolled bhature in hot oil until it puffs up fully and turns golden brown on both sides.
- Serve hot bhature with the prepared chole.

name: Jeera Rice with Dal Fry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak the lentils for 10-15 minutes.
- Finely chop the onion and tomatoes.
- Wash and soak basmati rice for 15 minutes.
- Chop green chilies as needed.

quick_step:
- Soak and cook lentils with turmeric and salt.
- Prepare tomato-onion masala with spices and sautéed garlic, cumin, and green chilies.
- Combine cooked lentils with masala and boil.
- Prepare tempering with ghee, cumin, garlic, green chilies, and Kashmiri chili.
- Add tempering to dal and mix.
- Cook cumin-flavored basmati rice.
- Serve dal fry hot with jeera rice.

cook_step:
- Cook the soaked lentils with double the amount of water, salt, and turmeric until soft and boiling.
- In a wok, heat thirty ml ghee and add 1.seventy five g cumin seeds, five g garlic paste, and 2-3 green chilies; sauté briefly.
- Add finely chopped onion, red chili powder, turmeric powder, chopped tomatoes, and salt; cook until tomatoes are soft.
- Add the cooked lentils to the tomato mixture and mix well; bring to a boil and then turn off the heat.
- In a separate pan, heat fifteen ml ghee, add cumin seeds, 2 green chilies, finely chopped garlic, and a pinch of Kashmiri red chili powder; cook slightly and add curry leaves if available.
- Pour this tempering into the dal and mix well.
- Cook basmati rice with cumin seeds (jeera) and water until fluffy.
- Serve the dal fry hot with jeera rice.

name: Lemon Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cook rice and let it cool to room temperature.
- Chop green chilies and gather curry leaves.

quick_step:
- Cook and cool rice.
- Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, peanuts, green chilies, and curry leaves.
- Add turmeric and salt to tempering.
- Mix cooked rice with tempering.
- Add lemon juice and mix gently.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.
- Add peanuts and fry until golden brown.
- Add chopped green chilies and curry leaves; sauté briefly.
- Add turmeric powder and salt; mix well.
- Add the cooked rice and mix gently to combine all ingredients.
- Turn off the heat and add lemon juice; mix well.

name: Thecha Curd Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cook rice and let it cool to room temperature.
- Chop green chili, garlic, and coriander leaves.
- Prepare thecha by dry roasting mustard seeds, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, and dry red chilies until aromatic.
- Grind the roasted spices with garlic, green chili, and peanuts to make a coarse chutney.

quick_step:
- Cook and cool rice.
- Prepare thecha chutney by roasting and grinding spices with peanuts and garlic.
- Temper mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chili in oil.
- Mix tempered spices and thecha chutney into rice.
- Add curd and combine well.
- Garnish with coriander and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and temper mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chili.
- Mix the tempered spices and thecha chutney into the cooked rice.
- Add curd to the rice mixture and mix well to achieve a creamy consistency.
- Garnish with chopped coriander and serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Veg Pulao
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak the rice for 10-15 minutes.
- Chop the potato and green chili.
- Chop coriander leaves.

quick_step:
- Soak and wash rice.
- Sauté spices, ginger garlic paste, and vegetables in ghee.
- Add rice, water, and herbs; mix gently.
- Cook in pressure cooker for 2 whistles.
- Let pressure release, fluff rice, and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pressure cooker and add ginger garlic paste, green chili, and spices (coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric, pav bhaji masala, garam masala).
- Add chopped potato and green peas, sauté for a minute.
- Add soaked rice and salt, mix gently with light hands.
- Add four hundred and eighty ml of water and chopped coriander leaves.
- Squeeze lemon wedge over the mixture and stir lightly.
- Close the lid and cook on medium heat until 2 whistles.
- Turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally.
- Open the lid, fluff the rice gently, and serve.

name: Mushroom Masala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and slice the mushrooms.
- Finely chop the onion and green chili.
- Gather and measure all spices.

quick_step:
- Prepare mushrooms and chop onions, green chili.
- Sauté cumin seeds and onions until golden.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and spices, cook masala.
- Add tomato puree and cook till oil separates.
- Add mushrooms and cook until tender.
- Finish with garam masala and cream.
- Garnish and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds until they splutter.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili; cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.
- Add sliced mushrooms and cook covered for 10-12 minutes until mushrooms are tender.
- Add garam masala and mix well.
- Stir in fresh cream and cook for another 2 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Chicken Maharani Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and cut the chicken into pieces.
- Soak cashew nuts in warm water for 15 minutes.
- Blend soaked cashew nuts into a smooth paste.
- Finely chop onions and prepare tomato puree.
- Mix yogurt with a pinch of salt and set aside.

quick_step:
- Prepare chicken and soak cashew nuts.
- Sauté onions, ginger, and garlic.
- Cook tomato puree with spices.
- Add chicken and cook with yogurt and cashew paste.
- Simmer until chicken is tender and finish with cream.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
- Add ginger and garlic paste, cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
- Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add chicken pieces and cook on medium heat until they change color.
- Add yogurt and cashew nut paste, stir well and cook for 5 minutes.
- Add water as needed to adjust gravy consistency and simmer until chicken is cooked through.
- Finish with fresh cream and garam masala, cook for another 2 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Kadai Paneer
instructions:
prep_step:
- Roast coriander seeds, cumin seeds, black pepper, and coriander again until fragrant and grind to a powder.
- Slice onions and capsicum into strips.
- Chop coriander leaves.
- Prepare tomato puree if not ready.

quick_step:
- Roast and grind spices to make masala powder.
- Fry paneer and sauté onions and capsicum separately.
- Cook onions with ginger garlic paste and tomato puree.
- Add spices, cream, paneer, and vegetables, then simmer with water.
- Garnish with coriander leaves and cashew nuts and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and fry paneer cubes until golden. Remove and set aside.
- In the same pan, add sliced onions and capsicum, stir fry briefly and remove.
- Add cumin seeds and sliced onions, fry until onions are translucent.
- Add ginger garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
- Add tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
- Add salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and the prepared masala powder, cook for 3 minutes.
- Add fresh cream and mix well.
- Add fried onions, capsicum, and paneer, mix and cook for 3 minutes.
- Add water, mix well, and cook for 5 minutes.
- Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and cashew nuts before serving.

name: Palak Paneer
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash the spinach 2-3 times thoroughly.
- Boil water with five g sugar and blanch the spinach in it for 2 minutes.
- Transfer the blanched spinach to cold water to retain green color.
- Add spinach, 2 green chilies, and coriander leaves to a blender and grind to a smooth puree without adding extra water.
- Chop onions finely.
- Grind tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and cashews together to make a smooth paste.
- Slice garlic cloves thinly for tadka.

quick_step:
- Blanch and puree spinach with green chilies and coriander.
- Prepare tomato-ginger-garlic-cashew paste and fry with onions and spices.
- Cook spinach puree with spices and add cream and butter for richness.
- Add paneer cubes and simmer to absorb flavors.
- Prepare garlic and red chili tadka and pour over the dish before serving.

cook_step:
- Heat thirty ml oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and bay leaves.
- Add chopped onions and fry on high flame for 3-4 minutes until golden.
- Add the tomato-ginger-garlic-cashew paste and cook well.
- Add salt, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and five ml water; mix and cook covered on low flame for 3-4 minutes until oil separates.
- Add roasted crushed fenugreek leaves and garam masala; mix well.
- Add spinach puree and 1.one thousand two hundred ml water (adjust as per serving preference), cover and cook on low flame for 7-8 minutes.
- Add malai (fresh cream) and butter; mix well to make the gravy creamy.
- Add paneer cubes (either fried or directly) and cook covered for 3-4 minutes on low flame.
- In a small pan, heat ten ml desi ghee, add sliced garlic and fry on low flame until golden brown.
- Add dry red chillies and five g red chili powder; fry briefly and pour this tadka over the cooked palak paneer.
- Mix gently and serve hot with paratha, naan, or rice.

name: Aloo Gobi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Peel and dice the potatoes into small cubes.
- Cut the cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
- Grate the ginger and mince the garlic.
- Chop the tomato and fresh cilantro.

quick_step:
- Prepare vegetables by chopping potatoes and cauliflower.
- Sauté cumin seeds, ginger, and garlic in oil.
- Add spices and tomatoes, cook until soft.
- Add vegetables, season, and cook covered until tender.
- Garnish with cilantro and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds until they splutter.
- Add grated ginger and minced garlic; sauté until fragrant.
- Add turmeric, chili powder, and ground coriander; stir well.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add diced potatoes and cauliflower florets; mix to coat with spices.
- Add salt and a splash of water, cover and cook on medium heat until vegetables are tender.
- Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Restaurant Style Mix Veg Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and chop mixed vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
- Finely chop onions and green chili.
- Puree tomatoes or finely chop them.
- Gather all spices and ingredients.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables and prepare spices.
- Sauté onions, ginger garlic paste, and green chili.
- Cook tomato puree with spices until oil separates.
- Add vegetables and water, then simmer until cooked.
- Finish with garam masala and garnish.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
- Add ginger garlic paste and green chili; sauté until raw smell disappears.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
- Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add chopped mixed vegetables and stir to coat with spices.
- Pour water, cover, and cook on medium heat until vegetables are tender.
- Sprinkle garam masala and mix well.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions:
prep_step:
- Marinate chicken chunks with garlic paste, ginger paste, red chilli powder, and salt for 15-20 minutes.
- Roughly chop onions and tomatoes for the gravy.
- Soak cashew nuts if preferred for easier blending.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with spices and garlic-ginger paste.
- Pan-fry chicken until nearly cooked and set aside.
- Prepare gravy by sweating onions, tomatoes, and cashews; simmer with spices.
- Puree and strain the gravy to a smooth consistency.
- Add butter, cream, chicken, and kasuri methi; simmer and garnish.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and pan-fry the marinated chicken pieces until almost cooked. Transfer to a bowl.
- In the same pan, add a little oil and a spoonful of butter, then lightly sweat the roughly chopped onions.
- Add roughly chopped tomatoes and cashew nuts to the pan and mix well.
- Add water, garlic paste, salt, malt vinegar, sugar, garam masala powder, and red chilli powder. Mix and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the mixture becomes soft and mushy.
- Turn off the flame and transfer the mixture to a container. Use a hand blender to puree it into a fine smooth paste.
- Strain the pureed gravy back into the pan, pressing to extract maximum flavor.
- Reheat the gravy, then add butter, cream, and the cooked chicken pieces.
- Add crushed kasuri methi and let the gravy simmer for 5-7 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh cream and kasuri methi before serving.

name: Rohu Fish Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and cut the rohu fish into pieces.
- Chop onions and tomatoes finely.
- Prepare ginger and garlic paste.

quick_step:
- Prepare fish and chop vegetables.
- Sauté spices and onions in oil.
- Add tomatoes and spices to make the masala.
- Cook fish in the masala with water until done.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds until they splutter.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and oil separates.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add fish pieces and gently coat them with the masala.
- Pour water and cover the pan; cook on medium heat until fish is cooked through and the gravy thickens.
- Garnish and serve hot.

name: Malai Kofta
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, tomatoes, green chillies, ginger, coriander leaves, and dry fruits if using.
- Mash paneer and boiled potatoes together until smooth.
- Mix chopped coriander leaves, chopped ginger, chopped green chillies, cornflour, salt, and dry fruits into the mashed paneer and potato mixture.
- Form the mixture into round kofta balls.

quick_step:
- Prepare the kofta mixture by mashing paneer and potatoes with spices and herbs.
- Shape the mixture into balls and deep fry until golden.
- Cook a spiced tomato and cashew nut gravy with aromatic whole spices.
- Blend the gravy to a smooth consistency and finish with cream and fenugreek leaves.
- Serve the fried koftas topped with hot creamy gravy and garnish with fresh coriander.

cook_step:
- Heat oil and butter in a pan, add cinnamon, bay leaves, cloves, cardamom, and cumin seeds and sauté.
- Add chopped onions and cook lightly without browning.
- Add chopped green chillies, black pepper, and chopped ginger and sauté lightly.
- Add turmeric, chilli powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder and sauté quickly.
- Add chopped tomatoes, salt, and cashew nuts; sauté until tomatoes just start to boil.
- Add water, cover, and cook until tomatoes are mashed and cashews are soft.
- Cool down the mixture slightly and blend to a smooth puree.
- Return the puree to the pan, add water to adjust consistency, add dry fenugreek leaves, sugar or honey, and salt; cook for 5 minutes.
- Add cream, stir well, and turn off the heat.
- Deep fry the prepared kofta balls in hot oil until golden and crisp; drain on paper towels.
- To serve, place koftas on a plate and pour hot curry over them; garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Bhindi Masala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and dry the bhindi thoroughly, then cut each bhindi into two halves.
- In a mixing bowl, add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, five g salt, and a little lemon juice to the bhindi and mix well.
- Add gram flour to the bhindi mixture and toss to coat evenly.

quick_step:
- Cut and marinate bhindi with spices and gram flour.
- Lightly fry the bhindi in oil.
- Prepare a spiced onion, tomato, ginger, and green chilli base.
- Add yogurt and cook the masala.
- Combine fried bhindi with the masala and simmer briefly.

cook_step:
- Heat thirty ml oil in a pan and lightly fry the coated bhindi until slightly crisp; remove and set aside.
- In the same pan, add oil, then add cumin seeds and a pinch of asafoetida; let them splutter.
- Add sliced onions and fry until they turn light brown.
- Add chopped green chilli and ginger pieces; sauté for 2 minutes.
- Add chopped tomatoes and salt to taste; cook until tomatoes soften and water starts boiling.
- Add Kashmiri red chilli powder, turmeric, cumin powder, coriander powder, and black salt; mix well.
- Add curd (yogurt) and cook on low flame until the mixture is cooked and well blended.
- Add the fried bhindi to the pan, cover, and cook on low flame for 2-3 minutes to combine flavors.

name: Baingan Bharta
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash the eggplant and prick it with a fork in several places.
- Finely chop onions, tomatoes, green chili, garlic, ginger, and cilantro.

quick_step:
- Roast the eggplant until soft and charred.
- Peel and mash the roasted eggplant.
- Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and spices.
- Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Mix in mashed eggplant and cook briefly.
- Garnish with cilantro and serve.

cook_step:
- Roast the eggplant directly on flame or in oven until the skin is charred and the inside is soft.
- Let the roasted eggplant cool, then peel off the skin and mash the pulp.
- Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
- Add chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili; sauté until golden brown.
- Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; cook until tomatoes soften.
- Add the mashed eggplant and mix well; cook for 5-7 minutes to blend flavors.
- Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot.

name: Matar Paneer
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions and tomatoes.
- Boil green peas if not already boiled.
- Fry paneer cubes until golden and set aside.
- Grind cooked tomatoes into a smooth paste.

quick_step:
- Sauté cumin seeds and green chillies in oil.
- Cook onions and tomatoes, then grind to a paste.
- Temper whole spices in oil and add ginger garlic paste.
- Add tomato-onion paste and spices, cook well.
- Add water, boiled peas, salt, and fried paneer.
- Simmer until cooked and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat thirty ml oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and green chillies, sauté.
- Add chopped onions and cook until translucent.
- Add chopped tomatoes and salt, cook until soft, then grind to a paste.
- In another pan, heat thirty ml oil, add bay leaves, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom, sauté until aromatic.
- Add ginger garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
- Add the tomato-onion paste to the pan and cook.
- Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder, coriander powder, and garam masala, mix well.
- Add two hundred and forty ml water and bring to a boil.
- Add boiled peas, salt, and fried paneer cubes.
- Simmer for a few minutes until flavors combine and gravy thickens slightly.

name: Chicken Korma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak cashew nuts and almonds in warm water for 15 minutes.
- Grind soaked nuts into a smooth paste.
- Slice the onion finely.
- Mix chicken pieces with yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt; marinate for 15 minutes.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
- Prepare nut paste by grinding soaked cashews and almonds.
- Sauté whole spices and onions until golden.
- Cook chicken with nut paste and simmer until tender.
- Finish with cream and garam masala.

cook_step:
- Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon).
- Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
- Add marinated chicken and cook on medium heat until chicken is sealed.
- Add nut paste and mix well, cook for 5 minutes.
- Add water as needed, cover and simmer until chicken is tender.
- Stir in cream and garam masala, cook for another 5 minutes.
- Adjust salt and garnish as desired before serving.

name: Veg Fried Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop all the vegetables into small pieces.
- Cook rice and let it cool completely to avoid clumping.
- Separate egg whites if using.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables and cook rice ahead of time.
- Sauté ginger garlic paste and vegetables in oil.
- Add egg whites and cook (optional).
- Mix in cooked rice and season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
- Garnish with spring onions and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add ginger garlic paste, sauté until fragrant.
- Add chopped vegetables and stir fry until slightly tender but still crunchy.
- Add egg whites and mix well until cooked (optional step).
- Add cooked rice to the pan and mix gently with vegetables.
- Add soy sauce, salt, and pepper powder; stir well to combine all ingredients.
- Garnish with chopped spring onions and cook for another 2 minutes before serving.

name: Better Than Takeout Egg Fried Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Separate green onions into white and green parts and chop both.
- Break apart cold cooked rice to remove clumps.

quick_step:
- Chop green onions and separate whites and greens.
- Scramble eggs with seasoning in pan.
- Add frozen vegetables and cook briefly.
- Stir-fry rice with sauces and seasonings.
- Finish by adding green onion greens and sautéing.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add white parts of green onions.
- Add eggs with salt and pepper, let set for 30 seconds, then scramble.
- Add frozen vegetables and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
- Add rice, soy sauce, sugar, white pepper, and vegetarian oyster sauce, stir-fry on high heat for 2 to 3 minutes.
- Add green parts of green onions and sauté on high heat for another 1 to 2 minutes.

name: Veg Hakka Noodles
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop all vegetables including onion, ginger, carrots, beans, and leafy greens.
- Boil two thousand ml of water and prepare noodles by cooking them until 80% done, then drain and spread on a plate with oil to prevent sticking.

quick_step:
- Boil noodles until 80% cooked and drain.
- Heat oil and sauté ginger garlic paste and onions.
- Add chopped vegetables and sauté briefly.
- Add leafy greens and season with salt.
- Mix in noodles, soy sauce, and spices; stir-fry.
- Garnish with spring onions and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat 3-sixty ml oil on high flame in a pan.
- Add ginger garlic paste and sauté for 30 seconds.
- Add chopped onions and cook until soft.
- Add chopped ginger, carrots, and beans; sauté for 30 seconds.
- Add leafy greens and salt; sauté for another 30 seconds.
- Add the cooked noodles, soy sauce, black pepper powder, and salt; stir-fry on high flame for 2-3 minutes.
- Add chopped spring onions and turn off the heat.

name: Rajma Recipe | Rajma Masala | Rajma Chawal
instructions:
prep_step:
- Restaurant creamy style – Cool down sixty g of cooked rajma masala slightly & add to a small blender along with sixty ml heavy cream/ cooking cream or homemade malai. Blend to a smooth puree and stir back to the prepared hot rajma masala. You may need to adjust the salt at this stage.
- For a special Dhaba style garnish – heat 1seven and one-half ml ghee in a small tadka pan. Add half tsp cumin seeds, 2 dried red chilies, 2 slit green chilies (deseeded), five g (half inch) ginger julienned. Let fry on a low flame until the ginger turns aromatic, for a minute or 2. Turn off and add a large pinch of hing and one and one-quarter g red chili powder (optional). Pour this over the finished Rajma Masala.
- Blanch & puree the onions instead of grating or chopping.
- Puree the tomatoes and use. Chopped or grated tomatoes often separate water in the gravy.
- Blend/mash thirty g of soft cooked rajma with little water and add it to the simmering gravy. Or puree them along with tomatoes & use. This will triple the taste, flavor & texture of your rajma masala. You will be surprised at how good your rajma smells & tastes.
- I haven’t used any cream like they do in the restaurants. However you can add a bit towards the end if you like.
- Add rajma to a large bowl and rinse them thrice. Soak them uncovered in nine hundred and sixty ml water for at least 6 hours to overnight. Discard the water and rinse them well.
- Transfer them to a stovetop pressure cooker or instant pot.  Pour 1one hundred and twenty ml water and pressure cook until soft, for 4 to 5 whistles. Or in the instant pot for 12 to 16 mins, depending on the age of rajma.
- Once cooked they should be soft enough yet hold there shape. If you mash a rajma with your fingers it should get mashed easily.
- Heat ghee or oil in a pot. Add cumin seeds and bay leaf. When they begin to sizzle add the onions and green chili.
- Saute on a medium heat until golden. Stir in the ginger garlic and saute for a minute, until aromatic.
- Pour the tomato puree & cook until the onion tomato mixture turns thick, for about 3 min.
- Stir in the spices – red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder and turmeric. Saute for 2 to 3 minutes, until the masala begins to smell aromatic.
- Add the rajma along with the stock (rajma cooked water). Pour more hot water as required (about one-half to two hundred and forty g, only as required) to make a gravy. (If using canned beans, drain the liquid from the can and rinse them before adding).
- Mix well and simmer for 10 to 15 mins, until slightly thick. To make the gravy thick, if you want mash a tbsp of the rajma and add back.
- Taste test and add more salt, one and one-quarter g garam masala if required and crushed kasuri methi. Optionally you may stir in cream and garnish with coriander leaves and ginger juliennes. You can also make a dhaba style tadka garnish or a restaurant style creamy finish from the post.
- Squeeze some lemon juice before serving. Serve rajma with chawal (rice).
- Press Saute button and pour ghee to the steel insert. When the ghee melts, add cumin seeds, bay leaf, chopped onions, green chili and salt.
- Saute for about 5 minutes stirring constantly to cook evenly until golden, about to caramelize but not burnt.
- Add ginger garlic & saute for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
- Add all the spice powders – chili powder, garam masala, turmeric, coriander powder and cumin powder.
- Press cancel. Add rajma and pour four hundred and eighty ml water. Deglaze to release any bits of food stuck at the bottom.
- Place a trivet and keep the bowl of tomato puree over that. Secure the IP with the lid and pressure cook for 18 mins (for softer beans, if you prefer al dente – 16 mins).
- When the pressure drops, open the IP. Rajma should super soft, yet hold shape. Pour the tomato puree and cook for 2 to 3 mins on saute mode. For a thicker consistency, mash some of the rajma. (If required pour about one-half to one hundred and eighty ml water to bring to a runny consistency.)
- Taste test and add more salt, one and one-quarter g garam masala, cream (optional) and crushed kasuri methi. Press cancel.
- Garnish with coriander leaves and ginger juliennes. Serve rajma with chawal. Drizzle some lemon juice.
- Different kinds of rajma have different cook times. I have used dark rajma which takes longer to cook. If you use chitra rajma, pressure cook for just 10 mins in Instant pot.
- Saute the onions well until golden to light brown, about to caramelize. This gives a better flavor and texture to the rajma masala. This helps the onions to dissolve in the gravy & gives a thicker taste.
- You will need around 2one-half to seven hundred and twenty ml water in total. Using lesser water can undercook your onion tomato masala and you won’t get a smoother gravy at the end. You may still adjust the amount of water to your need and taste.
- The amount of water to use changes if you alter the recipe.
- Beans and legumes that are sold since early 2023 are from the fresher stocks and they get cooked faster compared to those sold bet 2020 to 2022. This means you may need to cut down the pressure cooking times to avoid mushy beans.
- If using Canned beans, make the rajma masala on the stovetop and not in the instant pot. Start with two hundred and forty ml hot water to cook the rajma masala. As you cook, add more only if required.

cook_step:
- Restaurant creamy style – Cool down sixty g of cooked rajma masala slightly & add to a small blender along with sixty ml heavy cream/ cooking cream or homemade malai. Blend to a smooth puree and stir back to the prepared hot rajma masala. You may need to adjust the salt at this stage.
- For a special Dhaba style garnish – heat 1seven and one-half ml ghee in a small tadka pan. Add half tsp cumin seeds, 2 dried red chilies, 2 slit green chilies (deseeded), five g (half inch) ginger julienned. Let fry on a low flame until the ginger turns aromatic, for a minute or 2. Turn off and add a large pinch of hing and one and one-quarter g red chili powder (optional). Pour this over the finished Rajma Masala.

- Mix well and simmer for 10 to 15 mins, until slightly thick. To make the gravy thick, if you want mash a tbsp of the rajma and add back.
- Taste test and add more salt, one and one-quarter g garam masala if required and crushed kasuri methi. Optionally you may stir in cream and garnish with coriander leaves and ginger juliennes. You can also make a dhaba style tadka garnish or a restaurant style creamy finish from the post.

- Saute for about 5 minutes stirring constantly to cook evenly until golden, about to caramelize but not burnt.
- Add ginger garlic & saute for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

- When the pressure drops, open the IP. Rajma should super soft, yet hold shape. Pour the tomato puree and cook for 2 to 3 mins on saute mode. For a thicker consistency, mash some of the rajma. (If required pour about one-half to one hundred and eighty ml water to bring to a runny consistency.)
- Taste test and add more salt, one and one-quarter g garam masala, cream (optional) and crushed kasuri methi. Press cancel.
- Garnish with coriander leaves and ginger juliennes. Serve rajma with chawal. Drizzle some lemon juice.
- Different kinds of rajma have different cook times. I have used dark rajma which takes longer to cook. If you use chitra rajma, pressure cook for just 10 mins in Instant pot.
- Saute the onions well until golden to light brown, about to caramelize. This gives a better flavor and texture to the rajma masala. This helps the onions to dissolve in the gravy & gives a thicker taste.
- You will need around 2one-half to seven hundred and twenty ml water in total. Using lesser water can undercook your onion tomato masala and you won’t get a smoother gravy at the end. You may still adjust the amount of water to your need and taste.
- The amount of water to use changes if you alter the recipe.
- Beans and legumes that are sold since early 2023 are from the fresher stocks and they get cooked faster compared to those sold bet 2020 to 2022. This means you may need to cut down the pressure cooking times to avoid mushy beans.
- If using Canned beans, make the rajma masala on the stovetop and not in the instant pot. Start with two hundred and forty ml hot water to cook the rajma masala. As you cook, add more only if required.

name: Sambar Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice the onions and chop the tomato.
- Soak tamarind in warm water and extract tamarind juice.
- Measure and rinse the rice.

quick_step:
- Prepare tamarind extract and chop vegetables.
- Sauté spices, onions, and tomatoes in oil.
- Add tamarind juice, spices, and rice; cook until done.
- Add ghee and mix well.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add fenugreek seeds, red chilli powder, and curry leaves; sauté briefly.
- Add sliced onions and fry until translucent.
- Add whole red chillies and chopped tomato, cover and cook until soft.
- Add tamarind extract, water, salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and sambar powder; mix well.
- Add rice and cook the mixture for 15-20 minutes until rice is soft and the sambar rice thickens.
- Finish by adding ghee and mix well before serving.

name: One Pot Rasam Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak the rice for 10 minutes.
- Chop the tomato and crush the garlic cloves.
- Prepare tamarind paste by mixing tamarind with water if using raw tamarind.

quick_step:
- Soak rice and prepare tamarind paste.
- Temper mustard seeds, cumin, garlic, and curry leaves in oil.
- Cook tomatoes and add tamarind, spices, and water.
- Add rice and cook until done.
- Serve hot as a comforting meal.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pot and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves to temper.
- Add crushed garlic and sauté until fragrant.
- Add chopped tomato and cook until soft.
- Add tamarind paste, chili powder, salt, and water; bring to a boil.
- Add soaked rice and cook until rice is soft and rasam thickens slightly.

name: Tomato Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop the tomatoes and onions finely.
- Prepare ginger-garlic paste using a mortar and pestle or blender.
- Cook rice and keep it ready.

quick_step:
- Prepare ginger-garlic paste and chop onions and tomatoes.
- Heat ghee and temper with spices.
- Sauté ginger-garlic paste and onions.
- Add tomatoes and spices, cook until soft.
- Mix in cooked rice and combine well.
- Finish with ghee and serve with curd.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds, fennel seeds, ground black pepper, and bay leaf.
- Add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté until aromatic.
- Add chopped onions and garlic, cook until translucent.
- Add salt, chopped tomatoes, and tomato paste; cook until tomatoes are soft.
- Add chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, crushed pepper, and ground masala; mix well.
- Add the cooked rice and mix thoroughly with the tomato mixture.
- Add five ml ghee and stir well.
- Serve the tomato rice hot with a side of ground curd or yogurt.

name: Authentic Coconut Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash the jasmine rice thoroughly about four times to remove most of the starch.
- Zest one lime and set aside.

quick_step:
- Wash jasmine rice thoroughly.
- Mix coconut milk and water in a pot.
- Add rice, salt, sugar, and lime zest.
- Cook rice until done and let it rest.
- Fluff and serve with optional lime juice and green onions.

cook_step:
- In a pot, combine one can of coconut milk and one cup of water (about 22 ounces).
- Add the washed rice to the coconut milk mixture.
- Add a pinch of salt, a pinch of sugar, and the lime zest to the pot.
- Cook the rice mixture until done, then let it sit for 5 to 10 minutes off the heat to finish cooking.
- Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.

name: Veg Thali
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak rice and dal separately for 15 minutes.
- Chop mixed vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
- Knead wheat flour with water to make soft dough for roti.

quick_step:
- Soak rice and dal.
- Prepare dough for rotis.
- Cook dal and temper with spices.
- Cook rice and vegetable curry.
- Cook rotis on griddle.
- Serve all items together as a thali.

cook_step:
- Cook dal with turmeric and salt until soft, then temper with mustard and cumin seeds in ghee.
- Cook rice until fluffy.
- Prepare vegetable curry by sautéing spices and vegetables until cooked.
- Roll out dough and cook rotis on a hot griddle until golden brown on both sides.

name: Dal Makhani Recipe (Restaurant Style)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Fine chop 1 small to medium onion to make about one hundred and twenty g chopped (sixty five g)
- Soak black lentils and rajma for at least 8 hours. Well soaked lentils cook up to a creamy texture which is very important to make a delicious dal makhani. To speed up the soaking process, you may soak them in boiling hot water for 4 hours.
- Precook the lentils well before adding them to the makhani masala. Even slightly undercooked dal will not work well here.
- Butter is the key ingredient to make a flavorful dal makhani. Be generous & use a good amount of butter. In India, cultured butter is used which actually brings an amazing flavor. You can also use the regular butter like the way I did. But be generous & add a good amount of it. If you are on a low fat diet, cut down your portion size instead of making a low fat dal makhani.
- I prefer to use half butter and half ghee for cooking the masala as using only butter burns quickly. You may use one for the other.
- Slow cooking lentils on a lowest heat brings out the best flavors. Dal makhani served in restaurants is so much flavorful as the lentils are cooked overnight or whole day on slow fire.
- Without simmering you won’t really get the essential flavors in your dal makhani. I suggest simmering for at least 90 mins after adding the cooked lentils to the tempering or masala.

quick_step:
- Fine chop 1 small to medium onion to make about one hundred and twenty g chopped (sixty five g)

cook_step:
- Fine chop 1 small to medium onion to make about one hundred and twenty g chopped (sixty five g)
- Soak black lentils and rajma for at least 8 hours. Well soaked lentils cook up to a creamy texture which is very important to make a delicious dal makhani. To speed up the soaking process, you may soak them in boiling hot water for 4 hours.
- Precook the lentils well before adding them to the makhani masala. Even slightly undercooked dal will not work well here.
- Butter is the key ingredient to make a flavorful dal makhani. Be generous & use a good amount of butter. In India, cultured butter is used which actually brings an amazing flavor. You can also use the regular butter like the way I did. But be generous & add a good amount of it. If you are on a low fat diet, cut down your portion size instead of making a low fat dal makhani.
- I prefer to use half butter and half ghee for cooking the masala as using only butter burns quickly. You may use one for the other.
- Slow cooking lentils on a lowest heat brings out the best flavors. Dal makhani served in restaurants is so much flavorful as the lentils are cooked overnight or whole day on slow fire.
- Without simmering you won’t really get the essential flavors in your dal makhani. I suggest simmering for at least 90 mins after adding the cooked lentils to the tempering or masala.

name: South Indian Lunch Thali
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak rice and toor dal separately for 20 minutes.
- Chop vegetables finely.
- Prepare tamarind paste by soaking tamarind in warm water.

quick_step:
- Soak rice and dal.
- Cook rice and dal separately.
- Prepare sambar and rasam with tamarind and spices.
- Cook vegetable curry and chutneys.
- Assemble all items on a plate to serve as a thali.

cook_step:
- Cook rice and dal separately until soft.
- Prepare sambar by cooking dal with vegetables, tamarind paste, and spices.
- Tempering mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil and adding to sambar.
- Prepare rasam with tamarind, spices, and seasoning.
- Make chutneys and fry papadums or other sides as needed.
- Prepare a sweet dish using sugar and flour if desired.

name: North Indian Thali
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak toor dal for 30 minutes.
- Wash basmati rice thoroughly and soak for 20 minutes.
- Chop mixed vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
- Prepare dough by mixing wheat flour with water and kneading well.
- Chop ginger and green chili finely.

quick_step:
- Soak dal and rice.
- Prepare and knead dough for rotis.
- Cook dal and rice separately.
- Make vegetable curry with spices.
- Cook rotis on griddle.
- Assemble all items on a plate and garnish.

cook_step:
- Cook soaked toor dal with turmeric and salt until soft.
- Cook basmati rice until fluffy.
- Prepare vegetable curry by sautéing cumin seeds, ginger, green chili, and spices, then add vegetables and cook until tender.
- Roll out dough into rotis and cook on a hot griddle with ghee until golden brown.
- Serve dal, rice, vegetable curry, rotis, and yogurt together garnished with fresh coriander.

name: Paneer Pulao
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak the basmati rice for 20 minutes, then drain.
- Cut the paneer into small cubes.
- Slice the onion and chop the green chili.
- Gather and measure all spices.

quick_step:
- Soak and drain basmati rice.
- Sauté whole spices and onions in oil.
- Add ginger garlic paste, spices, and paneer cubes.
- Mix in rice and water, cook covered until done.
- Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cloves, and cardamom; sauté until fragrant.
- Add sliced onions and green chili, sauté until onions turn golden brown.
- Add ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute until raw smell disappears.
- Add coriander powder and salt, mix well.
- Add paneer cubes and gently sauté for 2-3 minutes.
- Add the drained rice and stir gently to coat the rice with spices and oil.
- Add water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until rice is done and water is absorbed (about 15 minutes).
- Turn off the heat and let it rest covered for 5 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Matar Pulao
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak two hundred and forty g of rice for 20 minutes.
- Julienne 1 inch piece of ginger into thin slices.
- Slice 2 green chillies thinly.

quick_step:
- Soak rice and prepare ginger and green chilli slices.
- Heat ghee and roast whole spices and cashews.
- Add peas and rice, then water, salt, garam masala, and lemon juice.
- Cook in pressure cooker for 1 whistle and let pressure release.
- Rest pulao, garnish with coriander, and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pressure cooker and add two and one-half g cumin seeds on medium flame.
- Add peeled cardamoms, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and black pepper; roast lightly until aromatic.
- Add ginger juliennes and green chillies; sauté briefly.
- Add cashews and roast until they turn slightly pink.
- Add 1.one thousand two hundred g of green peas and roast for 1 minute while stirring.
- Add soaked rice and roast while stirring on medium flame.
- Add 1.one thousand two hundred ml water, 1.twenty five g salt, and 1.twenty five g garam masala; mix well.
- Add lemon juice and mix again.
- Close the cooker and cook until 1 whistle.
- Turn off the flame and let the pressure release naturally.
- Open the cooker carefully, fluff the pulao gently, and let it rest for 10-15 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Dal Tadka Recipe
instructions:
prep_step:
- Add dal to a pot or pressure cooker and rinse them very well with lots of water. Rub the lentils well with your hand while you rinse. Drain completely.
- Pour water and pressure cook the dal on a medium heat for 3 to 4 whistles. To cook in instant pot, pressure cook on high for 10 minutes. To cook in pot check my notes below.
- When the pressure drops naturally, open the lid. Dal should be soft cooked.
- Lightly mash keeping some of the dal intact. Add more water only if required to bring to consistency.
- While the lentils cook, to a medium pan pour oil and heat it. Add cumin seeds to the hot oil.
- They will begin to splutter, then add ginger garlic and saute on a low heat until fragrant.
- Add onions and green chilies. Fry them until slightly golden.
- Reduce the heat. Add red chilli powder, turmeric and garam masala. Give a quick stir.
- Stir in the tomatoes along with salt. Saute until the tomatoes become soft. The mixture begins to smell good at this stage.
- Transfer this to the cooked dal and simmer for about 6 to 7 minutes. Taste test and add more salt at this stage. Then add kasuri methi and give the boiling dal a good stir. Add coriander leaves and turn off the heat.
- Place a tall steel cup in the center of the pot. With a tong hold a wood coal over direct fire like a candle or lighter until a portion of it becomes red and hot. This will take about 2 minutes.
- Place this gently into the cup and pour two and one-half ml ghee directly over the hot coal. It will begin to release smoke. Quickly cover the pot and let the dal smoke for 3 to 4 minutes.
- Transfer the hot cooked lentils to a serving bowl. Pour 2 tbsps ghee to a small pan & heat it on a medium heat.
- Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds (optional). Let them fry & splutter on a low heat until aromatic.
- Next add red chilies and give a good stir. Add garlic and curry leaves (optional). Fry until light and aromatic. Do not brown.
- Stir in asafoetida and red chili powder. Quickly remove from heat and pour the tadka over the dal.
- Garnish dal tadka with coriander leaves. Squeeze some lemon juice over the dal while serving. Serve with Basmati rice , roti, paratha, naan, jeera rice or ghee rice.
- For two hundred and forty g dal mentioned in the recipe I use one hundred and eighty g toor dal (split pigeon peas), sixty g moong dal (or red lentils/ masoor) & thirty g chana dal (bengal gram). If you want you may just use two hundred and forty g toor dal. This combination is what makes this dal tadka so much special in flavor, texture and taste.
- Water: If using only toor dal, you will require lesser water to add at the later stage i.e while cooking with onion tomato masala.
- To cook in a pot , simply soak the lentils in seven hundred and twenty ml hot water for at least 30 minutes. Let it come to a boil over high heat. Then simmer for 20-30 minutes. If required add more hot water. Remove any scum that forms on top of the dal and discard it. Turn off the heat when they are soft and mushy. Follow the rest of the recipe.
- To cook in a Instant Pot , you may simply make the onion tomato masala first in the steel insert and add the lentils. Pressure cook for 10 mins. When the pressure drops, make a separate tadka in a small pan and add it.
- Amchur- If you want you may stir in amchur along with kasuri methi.
- Mustard seeds and curry leaves are not not used in a North Indian restaurant style dal tadka. I have included them as optional ingredients if you want you may use them.

cook_step:
- Add dal to a pot or pressure cooker and rinse them very well with lots of water. Rub the lentils well with your hand while you rinse. Drain completely.
- Pour water and pressure cook the dal on a medium heat for 3 to 4 whistles. To cook in instant pot, pressure cook on high for 10 minutes. To cook in pot check my notes below.
- When the pressure drops naturally, open the lid. Dal should be soft cooked.

If required add more hot water. Remove any scum that forms on top of the dal and discard it. Turn off the heat when they are soft and mushy. Follow the rest of the recipe.
