- Amchur- If you want you may stir in amchur along with kasuri methi.
- Mustard seeds and curry leaves are not not used in a North Indian restaurant style dal tadka. I have included them as optional ingredients if you want you may use them.

name: Hyderabadi Veg Dum Biryani
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
- Chop mixed vegetables into small pieces.
- Prepare ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies.
- Chop fresh coriander and mint leaves.

quick_step:
- Soak basmati rice and chop vegetables.
- Sauté spices and vegetables in tamarind oil.
- Cook yogurt and spice mixture with vegetables.
- Parboil rice and layer with vegetable mixture.
- Seal and cook on dum (slow steam).

cook_step:
- Heat tamarind oil in a pan and add whole spices; sauté until aromatic.
- Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and mixed vegetables; cook until slightly tender.
- Mix in yogurt, biryani masala, salt, coriander, and mint leaves; cook for a few minutes.
- Parboil the soaked rice separately and drain.
- Layer the cooked vegetables and parboiled rice in a heavy-bottomed pot.
- Seal the pot with dough or a tight lid and cook on low heat (dum) for 25-30 minutes.
- Turn off the stove and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
- Slice onions thinly and fry until golden brown.
- Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, green chilies, lemon juice, salt, and half of the fried onions. Let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
- Soak saffron strands in warm milk.
- Chop mint and coriander leaves.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with spices and yogurt.
- Soak and parboil basmati rice with whole spices.
- Fry onions until golden brown.
- Layer chicken and rice with herbs and saffron.
- Cook on low heat (dum) until done.

cook_step:
- Parboil the soaked rice with whole spices until 70% cooked and drain.
- Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan, add marinated chicken and cook until partially done.
- Layer the partially cooked chicken with the parboiled rice.
- Sprinkle fried onions, mint, coriander, and saffron milk over the rice layer.
- Cover the pan tightly and cook on low heat (dum) for 30-40 minutes until chicken is fully cooked and rice is fluffy.
- Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Perfect Mutton Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice the onions.
- Prepare garlic, ginger, and green chili paste.

quick_step:
- Heat mustard oil and fry onions until golden.
- Add mutton and cook for 10 minutes.
- Add garlic, ginger, green chili paste, and spices; fry well.
- Add water and meat masala; pressure cook for 3 whistles.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat mustard oil in a pressure cooker.
- Fry the sliced onions until golden brown.
- Add mutton pieces and mix well; cook for 10 minutes.
- Add garlic, ginger, green chili paste, and cumin seeds; fry for a few minutes.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; fry until oil separates from the spices (about 10 minutes).
- Add water and MDH meat masala; mix well.
- Cover the cooker and cook on medium flame for 3 whistles.
- Check and serve the tender mutton curry.

name: One Pot Dal Curry with Steamed Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash toor dal and moong dal together thoroughly.
- Soak the washed dals in water for 10 minutes.
- Chop ginger, garlic, onion, tomato, and slit green chillies.
- Prepare curry leaves and coriander leaves by rinsing and chopping.

quick_step:
- Wash and soak toor and moong dal for 10 minutes.
- Prepare tadka with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, green chillies, curry leaves, ginger, and garlic.
- Add onions and tomatoes, sauté for 2 minutes.
- Add spices, soaked dal, and water; pressure cook for 2-3 whistles.
- Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pressure cooker and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds; let them splutter.
- Add a pinch of asafoetida, green chillies, curry leaves, chopped ginger, and garlic; sauté briefly.
- Add chopped onions and tomatoes; stir and cook for 2 minutes until softened.
- Add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and the soaked dal along with water.
- Close the lid and pressure cook for 2-3 whistles until dal is cooked.
- Once pressure releases, open the cooker and garnish with chopped coriander leaves.

name: Vegetable Masala Khichdi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak rice and moong dal for 15 minutes.
- Chop onions, tomatoes, green chili, and mixed vegetables.
- Prepare ginger-garlic paste.

quick_step:
- Soak rice and lentils.
- Sauté spices, onions, and tomatoes in ghee.
- Add vegetables and spices.
- Add soaked rice and lentils, then water.
- Cook under pressure until done.
- Garnish and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, sauté for a minute.
- Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt; mix well.
- Add chopped vegetables and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
- Drain rice and dal and add to the cooker; mix well.
- Pour water and close the lid; cook for 3-4 whistles on medium heat.
- Let the pressure release naturally, open the lid and mix gently.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Masala Khichdi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, tomatoes, and green chillies.
- Prepare mixed vegetables by washing and chopping into small pieces.
- Measure and keep all spices ready.
- Blend four hundred and eighty g of rice to a coarse powder.

quick_step:
- Sauté cumin, curry leaves, and onions in ghee.
- Add ginger garlic paste, tomatoes, and salt; cook well.
- Add mixed vegetables and green chillies.
- Add spices and cook the masala.
- Blend rice and add with garam masala to the pan.
- Add water and cook on high then low flame until done.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds and curry leaves.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
- Add chopped tomatoes and salt, cook for 3-4 minutes.
- Add mixed vegetables and green chillies, cook for a few minutes.
- Add turmeric, coriander, cumin, and pepper powders; cook the masala for 7-8 minutes.
- Add blended rice, garam masala, and coriander powder; mix well.
- Add water and cook on high flame for 15 minutes, then on low-medium flame for another 15 minutes until rice is cooked and mixture is soft.
- Serve hot.

name: Veg Kurma with Chapati
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
- Grind coconut, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, and cumin seeds into a smooth paste using a little water.
- Finely chop onion and tomato.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables and prepare coconut-spice paste.
- Sauté onions, ginger garlic paste, and tomatoes with spices.
- Add vegetables and coconut paste, cook until tender.
- Finish with garam masala and garnish.
- Serve hot with chapati.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
- Add ginger garlic paste and green chili, sauté for a minute.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add mixed vegetables and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
- Add the ground coconut-spice paste and cook for 5 minutes.
- Pour water, cover, and cook until vegetables are tender.
- Sprinkle garam masala and mix well.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with chapati.

name: Paneer Bhurji Recipe
instructions:
prep_step:
- To make Paneer Bhurji gravy cool the onion tomato masala after sautéing the onion, tomatoes and spices. Blend to a paste with little water. Heat five ml oil and add a bay leaf, 2 cardamoms and half teaspoon cumin seeds. When they splutter, add the onion tomato paste and pour one-half to three-quarters water. Cook until you see traces of oil on top then proceed with the next steps.
- Homemade paneer is the best to make soft mouth melting bhurji. If using store bought paneer soak the crumbled paneer in some hot water or hot milk for about 20 mins. This helps to keep the paneer soft in the bhurji. If you use milk, pour the milk too to the pan along with paneer.
- To make it healthier just add some veggies like carrots, peas, capsicum & make mixed veg paneer bhurji.  Some times I also use greens like methi & palak to make the paneer palak bhurji.
- I known some people love scrambled eggs in their paneer bhurji. You can also scramble the eggs first and then add the crumbled paneer to it to make the paneer egg bhurji.
- Pour nine hundred and sixty ml milk to a pot and bring it to a boil. Add fifteen ml vinegar or lemon juice and Stir. When the milk begins to curdle well, turn off the stove. If the milk does not curdle then add fifteen ml more vinegar.
- Drain it to a colander lined with a muslin cloth. Rinse it well under running water. Squeeze off the excess whey and make a knot with the cloth.
- Hang the paneer for about 10 to 15 minutes to remove excess whey. Meanwhile chop the onions & tomatoes finely.
- Pour oil to a hot pan and add cumin seeds. When they begin to sizzle, add finely chopped onions and chopped green chili.
- Saute until the onions turn golden to light brown. Add ginger garlic paste and saute until the raw smell has gone, for about a minute.
- Add chopped tomato, salt and turmeric. Saute until the tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
- Stir in the red chili powder, kasuri methi & garam masala.
- Mix and saute until the raw smell goes off from the mixture & the masala leaves the sides of the pan.
- Stir in peas or capsicum if using. Fry until capsicum turns slightly soft. Crumble paneer well and add to the pan.
- Stir and fry till everything blends well just for 2 minutes. Taste it and add more salt and spices if required.
- Turn off the stove. Add thirty g chopped coriander leaves. Serve paneer bhurji with roti, paratha or bread. Sprinkle some lemon juice before serving.
- If you want to make bhurji gravy, simply cool the onion tomato masala and blend to a paste with little water. Heat five ml oil. Add 1 bay leaf, 2 cardamoms and two and one-half g cumin seeds. When they splutter, add the paste and pour one-half to one hundred and eighty ml water. Cook until traces of oil are visible. Stir in the paneer and add hot warm water to adjust the consistency.

quick_step:
- To make Paneer Bhurji gravy cool the onion tomato masala after sautéing the onion, tomatoes and spices. Blend to a paste with little water. Heat five ml oil and add a bay leaf, 2 cardamoms and half teaspoon cumin seeds. When they splutter, add the onion tomato paste and pour one-half to three-quarters water. Cook until you see traces of oil on top then proceed with the next steps.
- Homemade paneer is the best to make soft mouth melting bhurji. If using store bought paneer soak the crumbled paneer in some hot water or hot milk for about 20 mins. This helps to keep the paneer soft in the bhurji. If you use milk, pour the milk too to the pan along with paneer.
- To make it healthier just add some veggies like carrots, peas, capsicum & make mixed veg paneer bhurji.  Some times I also use greens like methi & palak to make the paneer palak bhurji.
- I known some people love scrambled eggs in their paneer bhurji. You can also scramble the eggs first and then add the crumbled paneer to it to make the paneer egg bhurji.

Heat five ml oil and add a bay leaf, 2 cardamoms and half teaspoon cumin seeds. When they splutter, add the onion tomato paste and pour one-half to three-quarters water. Cook until you see traces of oil on top then proceed with the next steps.

- Hang the paneer for about 10 to 15 minutes to remove excess whey. Meanwhile chop the onions & tomatoes finely.
- Pour oil to a hot pan and add cumin seeds. When they begin to sizzle, add finely chopped onions and chopped green chili.
- Saute until the onions turn golden to light brown. Add ginger garlic paste and saute until the raw smell has gone, for about a minute.
- Add chopped tomato, salt and turmeric. Saute until the tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
- Stir in the red chili powder, kasuri methi & garam masala.
- Mix and saute until the raw smell goes off from the mixture & the masala leaves the sides of the pan.
- Stir in peas or capsicum if using. Fry until capsicum turns slightly soft. Crumble paneer well and add to the pan.
- Stir and fry till everything blends well just for 2 minutes. Taste it and add more salt and spices if required.
- Turn off the stove. Add thirty g chopped coriander leaves. Serve paneer bhurji with roti, paratha or bread. Sprinkle some lemon juice before serving.
- If you want to make bhurji gravy, simply cool the onion tomato masala and blend to a paste with little water. Heat five ml oil. Add 1 bay leaf, 2 cardamoms and two and one-half g cumin seeds. When they splutter, add the paste and pour one-half to one hundred and eighty ml water. Cook until traces of oil are visible. Stir in the paneer and add hot warm water to adjust the consistency.

name: Bottle Gourd Kofta Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Grate the bottle gourd and press to remove excess juice.
- Wash and crush the grated bottle gourd using a sieve.
- Make a paste of tomatoes and green chili.
- Mix grated bottle gourd with gram flour, green chili, ginger paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt, and ajwain to form kofta dough.
- Leave the kofta batter to rest for 10 minutes.

quick_step:
- Prepare kofta dough by mixing grated bottle gourd with spices and gram flour.
- Fry koftas until golden and crisp.
- Prepare tomato-based gravy with spices and besan.
- Add water and cook the gravy until oil separates.
- Add fried koftas to the gravy and simmer.
- Garnish with coriander and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil on medium-high flame for frying koftas.
- Fry the koftas until golden brown on all sides, then remove and drain excess oil.
- In a wok, heat thirty ml oil and add cumin seeds on low flame.
- Add asafoetida, ginger paste, coriander powder, and turmeric powder and fry until light brown.
- Add tomato and green chili paste and cook until oil separates from the masala.
- Add red chili powder and roast the masala well.
- Add kasuri methi and fifteen g gram flour, mix well and fry for 2 minutes.
- Add four hundred and eighty ml water, salt, garam masala, and fresh coriander leaves, mix and cook covered for 3-4 minutes.
- Add koftas to the gravy, cover and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Paneer Bhurji with Roti
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop the paneer into small pieces or crumble it.
- Chop the onions finely.
- Chop the tomatoes.
- Chop the green chilies.
- Chop coriander leaves.

quick_step:
- Chop all vegetables and paneer.
- Sauté onions and green chilies in oil.
- Cook tomatoes with spices.
- Add paneer and mix well.
- Garnish with coriander and serve hot with roti.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onions. Cook until onions are translucent.
- Add chopped green chilies and sauté briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
- Add salt, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder. Mix well.
- Add the crumbled paneer and mix thoroughly with the masala.
- Add chopped coriander leaves and mix well.
- Cook for a couple of minutes and then remove from heat.

name: Chicken 65 with Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
- Marinate the chicken with yogurt, red chili powder, ginger garlic paste, salt, and cornflour. Set aside for 15-20 minutes.
- Wash and soak rice, then steam or cook until fluffy.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with spices and yogurt.
- Cook steamed rice separately.
- Tempered mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies for garnish.
- Serve Chicken 65 hot with rice.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.
- Deep fry the marinated chicken pieces until crispy and cooked through. Remove and drain excess oil.
- In a separate pan, heat a little oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies, sauté briefly.
- Serve the crispy Chicken 65 hot alongside steamed rice.

name: Veg Manchurian with Fried Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Finely chop all vegetables for the Manchurian balls and spring onions.
- Cook and cool the rice for fried rice preparation.
- Prepare ginger garlic paste and chop green chili.

quick_step:
- Prepare and chop vegetables and ingredients.
- Make dough and deep fry vegetable balls.
- Prepare Manchurian sauce and coat fried balls.
- Stir fry vegetables with cooked rice for fried rice.
- Serve Veg Manchurian with hot fried rice.

cook_step:
- Mix chopped vegetables with all-purpose flour, cornflour, ginger garlic paste, salt, and pepper to form a dough.
- Shape the dough into small balls and deep fry them until golden and crispy. Set aside.
- Heat oil in a pan, sauté ginger garlic paste and green chili, add soy sauce and spring onions to make Manchurian sauce.
- Add fried vegetable balls to the sauce and cook for a few minutes to coat well.
- In another pan, heat oil, sauté chopped vegetables, add cooked rice, soy sauce, salt, and pepper, and stir fry well to make fried rice.
- Serve hot Veg Manchurian balls with fried rice.

name: Gobi Manchurian
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil nine hundred and sixty ml of water with 2-fifteen g salt until very salty.
- Add cauliflower florets to the medium-hot salty water and boil for 3-4 minutes.
- Drain the cauliflower and keep it aside on a plate.
- Prepare a thick batter by mixing forty five g corn flour, forty five g maida, and five g salt with water, starting thick and then thinning slightly to coat the florets evenly.
- Coat the boiled cauliflower florets thoroughly with the thin batter using hands.
- Add thirty g corn flour and fifteen g maida to the coated florets to thicken the batter and mix well.

quick_step:
- Boil cauliflower florets in salty water for 3-4 minutes and drain.
- Prepare a thick batter with corn flour and maida; coat the cauliflower.
- Deep fry the coated florets twice for extra crispiness.
- Sauté garlic, green chili, and onion; add soy sauce, chili sauce, ketchup, and seasonings to make the sauce.
- Thicken sauce with corn flour slurry and add fried cauliflower.
- Mix well, garnish with spring onions, and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a kadhai or deep frying pan on medium heat.
- Deep fry the batter-coated cauliflower florets in batches until they start to float and turn slightly golden; remove and drain on a plate.
- Increase the oil temperature to very hot and flash fry the cauliflower pieces again for about 30 seconds until golden and crispy; remove and drain.
- Heat forty five ml oil in a wok on high flame.
- Add chopped garlic, green chili, and chopped onion; sauté for about 1 minute on high flame.
- Add salt, black pepper, and optionally MSG (Ajinomoto); mix well.
- Add fifteen ml light soy sauce, fifteen g red chili sauce, and fifteen g ketchup; stir and cook the sauce in oil for flavor.
- Add some chopped spring onion greens and mix.
- Add about half a cup of water and bring it to a boil.
- Prepare a slurry by mixing five g corn flour with thirty ml water and add it gradually to the boiling sauce to thicken it.
- Once the sauce thickens, turn off the flame and add the fried cauliflower pieces.
- Mix well to coat the florets evenly with the sauce.
- Garnish with additional spring onion greens and serve hot.

name: Paneer Manchurian
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut paneer into long rectangular pieces.
- In a bowl, add forty five g corn flour, forty five g maida, two and one-half g red chili powder, two and one-half ml soy sauce, and ginger garlic paste.
- Mix dry ingredients well and then add water little by little to make a semi-thick batter.
- Coat the paneer pieces evenly with the batter.

quick_step:
- Cut and coat paneer pieces with a spiced corn flour and maida batter.
- Deep fry paneer on high heat until crisp but soft inside.
- Prepare sauce by frying garlic, ginger, spring onion, and capsicum with schezwan chutney, ketchup, and soy sauce.
- Add water and thicken sauce with corn flour slurry to semi-dry consistency.
- Toss fried paneer in the sauce, garnish with spring onion, and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil on high flame and deep fry the coated paneer pieces in batches for about 2 minutes until crisp but not dry inside. Drain and set aside.
- Heat 1.seventy five ml oil in a wok on high flame, add thirty g garlic paste, fifteen g spring onion, and 1 inch ginger garlic paste; fry until light brown to release flavor.
- Add chopped green capsicum and stir fry quickly on high flame for less than a minute.
- Add fifteen g schezwan chutney, ten g ketchup, and fifteen ml soy sauce; cook for 25-30 seconds until oil separates from the sauce.
- Add salt and 1.twenty five g black pepper powder to taste.
- Add 1.one thousand two hundred ml water and bring to boil, then add slurry made from thirty g corn flour mixed with water gradually while stirring to thicken the sauce to a semi-dry consistency.
- Once sauce is shiny and thickened, add fried paneer pieces and mix gently to coat them well without breaking.
- Finish with chopped spring onion, mix gently, and turn off the flame.
- Serve hot.

name: Veg Schezwan Fried Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice onions and capsicum.
- Chop carrots, French beans, and other vegetables.
- Wash and drain any leafy vegetables.

quick_step:
- Heat oil and stir-fry mixed vegetables on high flame.
- Add leftover rice and Schezwan masala.
- Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.
- Garnish with green onions and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a wok on high flame.
- Add all chopped vegetables and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly cooked but still crunchy.
- Add leftover rice to the wok and mix well.
- Add Chings Schezwan Fried Rice Masala and stir to combine without adding extra salt or spices.
- Cook the mixture for 2 more minutes on high flame.
- Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

name: Paneer Pasanda with Butter Naan
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut paneer into desired shapes or stuff for pasanda.
- Prepare dough for naan by mixing maida, yeast, sugar, warm water, and oil; let it rise for 1 hour.
- Gather and measure all spices and ingredients.

quick_step:
- Prepare and let the naan dough rise.
- Cook the spicy tomato-based paneer gravy.
- Roll and cook butter naan on skillet.
- Serve hot paneer pasanda with butter naan.

cook_step:
- Heat butter in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste until fragrant.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
- Add red chili powder, garam masala, kasuri methi, and salt; mix well.
- Add paneer pieces and cook in the gravy for 5-7 minutes.
- Stir in fresh cream and simmer for 2 minutes; turn off heat.
- Roll out naan dough and cook on a hot tawa or skillet, applying butter on top.

name: Chicken Chettinad
instructions:
prep_step:
- Marinate the chicken pieces with lemon juice, turmeric powder, and salt. Set aside for at least 30 minutes.
- Slice shallots thinly and prepare fresh grated coconut.
- Gather and measure all whole spices and other ingredients for the spice mix.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with lemon juice, turmeric, and salt.
- Roast whole spices and grated coconut separately until brown.
- Grind roasted spices with fenugreek, ginger, and tamarind into a paste.
- Sauté shallots and curry leaves, then sear marinated chicken.
- Add spice paste and water, cook covered until chicken is done.
- Garnish with coriander and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat sesame oil in a pan and roast whole spices including coriander, fennel, cumin, black peppercorns, mace, cloves, cinnamon, star anise, green and black cardamom, and bay leaves on moderate flame.
- Add lichen flour and garlic cloves, sauté for 2 minutes.
- Add dried red chillies and toast the spices until deep brown, then transfer to a plate to cool.
- In the same pan, roast grated coconut until brown, then transfer to a plate to cool.
- Grind the cooled roasted spices and coconut with fenugreek seeds, ginger, tamarind, and a little water into a fine paste.
- Heat sesame oil again, sauté sliced shallots and curry leaves until golden brown.
- Add marinated chicken and sear on high flame for 2-3 minutes.
- Add the ground Chettinad masala paste, salt, and some water from the grinder to the chicken. Stir well.
- Bring the curry to a boil, then reduce flame, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Kasuri Methi Malai Chicken
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili finely.
- Clean and cut the chicken into medium-sized pieces.
- Measure out kasuri methi and other spices.

quick_step:
- Prepare and chop all ingredients.
- Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and chili.
- Cook chicken with spices and kasuri methi.
- Add cream and simmer until done.
- Serve hot with naan or rice.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
- Add garlic, ginger, and green chili; cook until fragrant.
- Add chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
- Sprinkle salt, black pepper, and garam masala; mix well.
- Add kasuri methi and cook for a few minutes to release aroma.
- Pour in fresh cream, stir gently, and simmer until chicken is cooked through and the gravy thickens.
- Adjust seasoning and cook for another 2-3 minutes before turning off the heat.

name: Navratan Korma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Roughly chop onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, and tomatoes.
- Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
- Soak saffron strands in a little warm water or milk.
- Roast pistachios and almonds if not pre-roasted.

quick_step:
- Prepare and chop all vegetables and ingredients.
- Cook whole spices and sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and chilies.
- Add spices, curd, tomatoes, and fenugreek; cook and grind to make gravy.
- Sauté vegetables with spices and partially cook them.
- Combine vegetables with gravy and cook until tender.
- Finish with nuts, cream, and optional sugar; serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add whole spices: cardamom, cloves, mace, and cinnamon; sauté briefly.
- Add roughly chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili; cook lightly until onions turn slightly brown but not fried.
- Add cashew nuts and mix well to combine for consistency.
- Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder; fry the spices well.
- Add curd at high flame and stir continuously until it starts boiling.
- Add chopped tomatoes and salt; cook for 5 minutes until tomatoes soften.
- Add fenugreek leaves and cook the gravy for a few more minutes until well blended.
- Remove whole spices and grind the gravy to a smooth paste once cooled.
- Heat oil and butter in a pan, add soaked saffron, garlic, ginger, and green chili; sauté lightly without browning.
- Add chopped raw vegetables and salt; toss for 3-4 minutes.
- Sprinkle turmeric, red chili powder, cumin, coriander, and kasuri methi; stir well.
- Add a little water and cook vegetables until half done.
- Add the prepared gravy to the vegetables and mix well; cook until vegetables are tender and flavors blend.
- Add green peas, roasted pistachios, roasted almonds, cream, and a pinch of sugar; stir gently and cook for 2 more minutes.
- Adjust seasoning and remove from heat.

name: Kashmiri Dum Aloo
instructions:
prep_step:
- Pressure cook four hundred and eighty g of potatoes partially until tender.
- Peel the boiled potatoes carefully.
- Crush the peeled potatoes lightly with a fork.
- In a bowl, mix five g Kashmiri red chili powder, five g salt, and a little water to make a smooth paste.

quick_step:
- Prepare a chili and salt paste.
- Fry potatoes until golden.
- Sauté whole spices and fry the chili paste.
- Add yogurt and cook gravy until oil separates.
- Add potatoes and fenugreek powder, then simmer briefly.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a wok and fry the boiled potatoes until golden brown. Remove and keep aside.
- In the same oil, add cumin seeds, bay leaves, cardamom, cloves, and asafoetida; sauté until aromatic.
- Add the prepared chili-salt paste to the spices and fry until oil separates.
- Add the ground curd and stir well; cook until the curd changes color and starts to boil (2-3 minutes).
- Add salt to taste and a little water to keep the gravy thin.
- Add roasted fenugreek powder and mix well.
- Add the fried potatoes to the gravy, cover, and cook on medium flame for 2-3 minutes to let flavors meld.

name: Achari Paneer Masala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut paneer into cubes and set aside.
- Finely chop the onion and puree the tomatoes.
- Prepare the achari masala by mixing mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and fennel seeds.

quick_step:
- Prepare paneer cubes and chop onions.
- Temper achari spices in hot oil.
- Sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste.
- Cook tomato puree with spices and yogurt.
- Add paneer and simmer in the achari masala.
- Garnish and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add the mustard, fenugreek, and fennel seeds; let them splutter.
- Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.
- Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add yogurt and cook for a couple of minutes on low flame.
- Add paneer cubes and mix gently to coat them with the masala.
- Add water as needed to adjust the gravy consistency and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Pepper Chicken Dry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and clean the chicken pieces thoroughly.
- Crush black pepper coarsely using a mortar and pestle.
- Slice onions finely and crush garlic and ginger.
- Slit green chilies and pluck curry leaves.

quick_step:
- Prepare ingredients by chopping onions, crushing garlic, ginger, and black pepper.
- Sauté aromatics in oil and add onions until golden.
- Add chicken and spices, cook covered until done.
- Dry roast on high flame for a crispy finish.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add crushed garlic, ginger, green chilies, and curry leaves; sauté until aromatic.
- Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add chicken pieces and cook on medium heat until they turn white.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and crushed black pepper; mix well.
- Cook covered on low heat until chicken is fully cooked and the masala dries up.
- Increase flame and sauté to get a dry texture with slightly crispy edges.

name: Kottayam Style Fish Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Blend the tomato to a smooth puree.
- Chop fenugreek leaves finely.
- Measure out all spices and ingredients.

quick_step:
- Boil water in a pan.
- Fry spices and tomato puree in coconut oil with curry leaves.
- Combine boiled water with the tomato-spice mixture.
- Add fish pieces and cook until done.
- Finish with fenugreek leaves and coconut oil.

cook_step:
- Pour nine hundred and sixty ml of water into a pan and bring it to a boil.
- Heat coconut oil in another pan on low flame and fry curry leaves with salt.
- Add chilli powder, turmeric powder, and coriander powder to the pan and fry briefly.
- Add the blended tomato puree and cook on low flame until oil separates.
- Add the boiling water to the tomato mixture and bring it to a boil.
- Add fish pieces to the boiling curry and cook for 5-10 minutes until fish is done.
- Add chopped fenugreek leaves and a drizzle of coconut oil, then mix gently.
- Turn off the heat and serve the fish curry hot.

name: Goan Prawn Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and devein the prawns, rinse well and set aside.
- Grind grated coconut with green chili and a little water to make a smooth paste.
- Chop onions finely and crush garlic cloves.

quick_step:
- Prepare prawns and grind coconut with green chili.
- Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, and garlic.
- Add spices and coconut paste; cook until oil separates.
- Add tamarind and prawns; cook until prawns are done.
- Finish with coconut milk and simmer gently.
- Serve hot with rice.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
- Add curry leaves, chopped onions, and crushed garlic; sauté until onions turn golden brown.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder and sauté for a minute.
- Add the coconut paste and cook for 5-7 minutes until oil separates.
- Add tamarind paste and salt, mix well.
- Add prawns and cook covered on medium heat for 8-10 minutes until prawns are cooked.
- Pour in coconut milk, simmer for 5 minutes without boiling to avoid curdling.
- Adjust seasoning and garnish with fresh curry leaves before serving.

name: Matar Paneer Recipe (Mutter Paneer)
instructions:
prep_step:
- For the simplest version, saute fine chopped onions until deep golden, then ginger garlic and then add pureed tomatoes & cashews. Saute until thick and add spices. Pour water and make a thick gravy. Add matar and paneer to this.
- To add yogurt & skip cream, you can follow my restaurant dum aloo recipe . Just skip the aloo and use matar and paneer instead with the amount of water mentioned in this post. I also have instant pot version in that post.
- To make matar paneer without onions and garlic, you can follow my paneer makhani recipe .
- Pour oil to a hot pan and add green cardamoms (optional), ginger & garlic. Saute for a minute and add onions.
- Saute until light golden for 5 to 6 mins. Add tomatoes, cashews and salt. Saute for 2 to 3 mins and cook covered until mushy and soft. If the pan dries out, add a splash of water while you cook.
- Cool this and transfer to a blender. Add the optional ingredient – yogurt or tomato paste and blend to a smooth puree.
- Heat ghee or oil in the same pan. Add cinnamon & bay leaf, let sizzle in oil for a minute.
- Lower the heat completely and stir in turmeric, chili powder, garam masala and coriander powder. Transfer the pureed onion tomato masala. (If your puree isn't smooth, turn off the heat and pass it through a strainer, directly to the pan)
- Saute for 2 to 3 mins until the masala comes together and turns thick. Stir in the rinsed green peas and water to make a gravy.
- Bring to a boil and cook partially covered on a medium heat, until the gravy turns thick and traces of fat are visible on the gravy. This takes me about 10 to 12 mins.
- Optionally fry paneer – Spread and heat seven and one-half ml ghee in a non-stick pan and place the diced paneer. Fry on a medium high heat until golden, for 3 mins. Turn them to the other side with a tong and repeat the process.
- Crush kasuri methi in your palm and add it. Add slit deseeded green chili, sugar (both optional) and paneer. Mix and taste test to adjust salt and garam masala.
- Cook for 2 mins for the paneer to heat through and turn off.  Stir in the heavy cream and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve matar paneer with Basmati rice , jeera rice , naan or paratha.
- Press saute button on the instant pot and pour fifteen ml oil. Sauté onions, ginger and garlic for 5 mins. Press cancel. (Or Alternately bring 1one hundred and twenty ml water to a rolling boil and add the onions. Boil for 5 mins and remove them.)
- To a blender jar, add the sauteed/boiled onions, ginger, garlic, tomatoes, cashews, cardamoms and yogurt (optional). Blend to a very smooth puree.
- Press saute button on the instant pot and pour ghee/oil. Add bay leaf, cinnamon and transfer the onion tomato puree. Stir in the red chilli powder, turmeric, salt, sugar, coriander powder and garam masala.
- Saute until the mixture turns slightly thicker and aromatic. Cover with an external lid to avoid splatters. This step takes about 5 minutes. Press cancel button.
- Pour two hundred and forty ml water and deglaze the pot well. Secure the Instant pot with the lid and position the steam release valve to sealing.
- Press pressure cook button (low) & set the timer to 5 mins. (If you want to put your rice together, soak basmati rice for 30 mins and drain the water. Place the rice bowl over a trivet and pour hot water.)
- When the IP is done, wait for 6 to 7 minutes & then release the rest of the pressure manually.
- Stir the gravy. Add frozen green peas and cook for 2 minutes. To avoid splatters, cover the pot when you cook. Taste test and add more salt if needed. If the curry is runny, cook it on saute mode for a few more minutes.
- Add crushed kasuri methi, cream, sugar, green chili (optional) and paneer. Let matar paneer rest for 10 minutes before serving
- To make 2x use only 2 cardamoms, for 3x- 3 cardamoms. Using too many cardamoms can impart overpowering flavors.
- For a nut-free option , omit cashews and use one-third to one hundred and twenty ml heavy cream at the finishing stage. Cut down the amount of water for the sauce, use only one hundred and eighty g.
- Cashews can be substituted with soaked almonds or almond flour or nut butter.
- Yogurt can be substituted with fifteen g tomato paste. Yogurt adds a bit of richness and brings a slightly tangy flavor. I have made this for many years without yogurt and tomato paste, it tastes as good even without them. But using very sour yogurt or too much tomato paste can make your dish too tart/sour .

quick_step:
- For the simplest version, saute fine chopped onions until deep golden, then ginger garlic and then add pureed tomatoes & cashews. Saute until thick and add spices. Pour water and make a thick gravy. Add matar and paneer to this.
- To add yogurt & skip cream, you can follow my restaurant dum aloo recipe . Just skip the aloo and use matar and paneer instead with the amount of water mentioned in this post. I also have instant pot version in that post.

cook_step:
- For the simplest version, saute fine chopped onions until deep golden, then ginger garlic and then add pureed tomatoes & cashews. Saute until thick and add spices. Pour water and make a thick gravy. Add matar and paneer to this.
- To add yogurt & skip cream, you can follow my restaurant dum aloo recipe . Just skip the aloo and use matar and paneer instead with the amount of water mentioned in this post. I also have instant pot version in that post.
- To make matar paneer without onions and garlic, you can follow my paneer makhani recipe .

- Cool this and transfer to a blender. Add the optional ingredient – yogurt or tomato paste and blend to a smooth puree.
- Heat ghee or oil in the same pan. Add cinnamon & bay leaf, let sizzle in oil for a minute.
- Lower the heat completely and stir in turmeric, chili powder, garam masala and coriander powder. Transfer the pureed onion tomato masala. (If your puree isn't smooth, turn off the heat and pass it through a strainer, directly to the pan)
- Saute for 2 to 3 mins until the masala comes together and turns thick. Stir in the rinsed green peas and water to make a gravy.
- Bring to a boil and cook partially covered on a medium heat, until the gravy turns thick and traces of fat are visible on the gravy. This takes me about 10 to 12 mins.
- Optionally fry paneer – Spread and heat seven and one-half ml ghee in a non-stick pan and place the diced paneer. Fry on a medium high heat until golden, for 3 mins. Turn them to the other side with a tong and repeat the process.

- Cook for 2 mins for the paneer to heat through and turn off.  Stir in the heavy cream and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve matar paneer with Basmati rice , jeera rice , naan or paratha.
- Press saute button on the instant pot and pour fifteen ml oil. Sauté onions, ginger and garlic for 5 mins. Press cancel. (Or Alternately bring 1one hundred and twenty ml water to a rolling boil and add the onions. Boil for 5 mins and remove them.)
- To a blender jar, add the sauteed/boiled onions, ginger, garlic, tomatoes, cashews, cardamoms and yogurt (optional). Blend to a very smooth puree.
- Press saute button on the instant pot and pour ghee/oil. Add bay leaf, cinnamon and transfer the onion tomato puree. Stir in the red chilli powder, turmeric, salt, sugar, coriander powder and garam masala.
- Saute until the mixture turns slightly thicker and aromatic. Cover with an external lid to avoid splatters. This step takes about 5 minutes. Press cancel button.
- Pour two hundred and forty ml water and deglaze the pot well. Secure the Instant pot with the lid and position the steam release valve to sealing.
- Press pressure cook button (low) & set the timer to 5 mins. (If you want to put your rice together, soak basmati rice for 30 mins and drain the water. Place the rice bowl over a trivet and pour hot water.)
- When the IP is done, wait for 6 to 7 minutes & then release the rest of the pressure manually.
- Stir the gravy. Add frozen green peas and cook for 2 minutes. To avoid splatters, cover the pot when you cook. Taste test and add more salt if needed. If the curry is runny, cook it on saute mode for a few more minutes.
- Add crushed kasuri methi, cream, sugar, green chili (optional) and paneer. Let matar paneer rest for 10 minutes before serving
- To make 2x use only 2 cardamoms, for 3x- 3 cardamoms. Using too many cardamoms can impart overpowering flavors.
- For a nut-free option , omit cashews and use one-third to one hundred and twenty ml heavy cream at the finishing stage. Cut down the amount of water for the sauce, use only one hundred and eighty g.
- Cashews can be substituted with soaked almonds or almond flour or nut butter.
- Yogurt can be substituted with fifteen g tomato paste. Yogurt adds a bit of richness and brings a slightly tangy flavor. I have made this for many years without yogurt and tomato paste, it tastes as good even without them. But using very sour yogurt or too much tomato paste can make your dish too tart/sour .

name: Awadhi Chicken Korma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Roast cashew nuts, chironji nuts, and desiccated coconut until light brown and grind into a smooth paste.
- Fry onions until brown and make a smooth onion paste with a little water.
- Mix yogurt with turmeric, red chili powder, yellow chili powder, and salt to make a spiced curd mixture.
- Prepare ginger garlic paste if not ready.
- Clean and cut the chicken into pieces.

quick_step:
- Roast and grind nuts and coconut to make a paste.
- Prepare fried onion paste and spiced yogurt mixture.
- Partially cook chicken with salt and ginger garlic paste.
- Combine chicken with nut paste, onion paste, and yogurt mixture; cook until tender.
- Strain and cook gravy separately with aromatic essences.
- Recombine chicken and gravy, finish with ghee and garnish.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan and add the chicken pieces with salt; cook partially.
- Add ginger garlic paste and sauté briefly.
- Add the nut paste and brown onion paste to the chicken and mix well.
- Add the spiced yogurt mixture to the chicken and cook on low heat until chicken is tender.
- Remove the chicken pieces and strain the gravy to cook it further until ghee separates.
- Add cardamom powder, rose water, and kewra water to the gravy and cook to enhance aroma.
- Return the chicken pieces to the gravy and cook for a few more minutes.
- Finish with a final drizzle of ghee and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Dal Palak
instructions:
prep_step:
- Roughly chop the onion.
- Chop the green chillies.
- Chop the ginger.
- Chop the tomato.
- Shred the fresh spinach leaves.

quick_step:
- Chop onions, green chillies, ginger, tomato, and shred spinach.
- Heat ghee and temper cumin seeds and asafoetida.
- Sauté onions, chillies, and ginger until translucent.
- Add spices, boiled lentils, tomatoes, and salt; cook together.
- Add shredded spinach and cook until wilted and combined.
- Serve hot with steamed rice.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a deep pan on high flame.
- Add cumin seeds and let them splutter, then add a pinch of asafoetida.
- Add onions, green chillies, and ginger; sauté on high flame until onions turn translucent.
- Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and roasted coriander seeds powder; mix quickly.
- Add boiled lentils and stir well.
- Add chopped tomatoes and salt; cook for a while.
- Add shredded spinach leaves and cook on high flame for about a minute until spinach shrinks and blends with the dal.
- Turn off the heat and transfer the dal palak to a serving bowl.

name: Tandoori Paneer Tikka
instructions:
prep_step:
- Take three hundred ml of curd in a bowl and mix it well.
- Add Kashmiri red chilli powder, garam masala, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, black pepper powder, ginger garlic paste, ajwain, kasuri methi, boiled chickpeas, salt, and mustard oil to the curd and mix thoroughly to make the marinade.
- Cut paneer into cubes and marinate them in the prepared yogurt-spice mixture.
- Let the paneer marinate for at least 15 minutes to absorb the flavors.

quick_step:
- Prepare the spiced yogurt marinade by mixing curd with spices and mustard oil.
- Marinate paneer cubes in the mixture for 15 minutes.
- Skewer the paneer and cook on a pan or stove with butter until charred.
- Serve hot with lemon.

cook_step:
- Skewer the marinated paneer cubes on wooden sticks.
- Heat a pan or stove and add butter if frying in a pan.
- Fry or grill the paneer tikka on medium heat until charred and cooked through, turning occasionally.
- Serve hot with a squeeze of lemon.

name: Malabar Chicken Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and cut the chicken into medium pieces.
- Slice onions finely and slit the green chilies.
- Measure and prepare all spices and ingredients.

quick_step:
- Prepare and chop all ingredients.
- Sauté whole spices and onions until golden.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and ground spices.
- Cook chicken until sealed.
- Add coconut milk and simmer until done.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom; sauté until fragrant.
- Add sliced onions, green chilies, and curry leaves; sauté until onions turn golden brown.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add chicken pieces and cook on medium heat until chicken is sealed and partially cooked.
- Pour in coconut milk and simmer the curry until chicken is fully cooked and the gravy thickens.
- Adjust salt and spice levels as needed and cook for a few more minutes before turning off the heat.

name: Egg Bhurji with Phulka
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, green chili, tomatoes, and coriander leaves.
- Prepare phulka dough by mixing wheat flour with water and kneading until smooth.

quick_step:
- Prepare and knead dough for phulkas.
- Chop vegetables for the egg bhurji.
- Cook the spiced onion-tomato mixture.
- Add and scramble eggs with spices.
- Roll and cook phulkas on a griddle.
- Serve hot egg bhurji with fresh phulkas.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions and green chili until translucent.
- Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add turmeric, red chili powder, and salt; mix well.
- Beat eggs and pour into the pan; scramble until cooked but still moist.
- Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
- Divide dough into small balls, roll into thin circles, and cook phulkas on a hot griddle until puffed and lightly browned on both sides.

name: Chicken Do Pyaza
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice the onions thinly and separate half for later use.
- Clean and cut the chicken into medium pieces.
- Chop tomatoes and slit green chilies.
- Mix yogurt with turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.

quick_step:
- Slice onions and prepare chicken pieces.
- Sauté half the onions and spices in oil.
- Cook chicken with tomatoes and yogurt mixture.
- Add remaining onions and finish cooking.
- Garnish and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds until they splutter.
- Add half of the sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger and garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add chicken pieces and cook on high heat until they change color.
- Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, coriander powder, and salt; cook until oil separates.
- Add the yogurt mixture and cook covered on medium heat until chicken is tender.
- Add the remaining sliced onions and cook for another 5-7 minutes.
- Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Egg Masala with Chapati
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil the eggs, peel and set aside.
- Finely chop the onions and green chili.
- Gather all spices and ingredients.

quick_step:
- Boil and peel eggs.
- Prepare onion-tomato masala gravy with spices.
- Add eggs to the gravy and simmer.
- Garnish and serve with chapati.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili; cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
- Add turmeric, red chili, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add water and bring the gravy to a simmer.
- Add boiled eggs, gently coat them with the masala, and cook for 5-7 minutes.
- Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
- Serve hot with chapatis.

name: Veg Jaipuri
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut vegetables (capsicum, onion, cauliflower) and paneer into julienne strips.
- Chop green chilies finely and mince garlic.
- Prepare the gravies: yellow gravy, tomato gravy, and white gravy.

quick_step:
- Sauté spices and vegetables in oil.
- Add gravies and cook until vegetables are tender.
- Finish with ghee, butter, cream, and coriander.
- Garnish with roasted papad and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat refined oil in a frying pan and add cumin seeds, red chilies, garlic, and green chilies; sauté briefly.
- Add all the julienne-cut vegetables and toss well; roast them lightly.
- Add syrup, chopped masala, and continue roasting the vegetables.
- Turn off the gas and add salt, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala; mix well.
- Turn on the gas and add yellow gravy, tomato gravy, and white gravy; cook until gravy is well blended and vegetables are cooked.
- Turn off the gas and add desi ghee, butter, fresh cream, and chopped coriander leaves; mix lightly.
- Add julienne-cut paneer and warm through gently on low heat.
- Garnish with roasted papad pieces and additional coriander leaves if desired.

name: Masala Bhindi Fry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash the bhindi thoroughly and pat dry completely.
- Trim the ends and cut the bhindi into 1-inch pieces.
- Chop the onion and tomato finely.

quick_step:
- Wash and chop bhindi, onion, and tomato.
- Heat oil and temper mustard and cumin seeds.
- Sauté onions and tomatoes with spices.
- Add bhindi and cook until crispy and done.
- Finish with garam masala and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds; let them splutter.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add chopped bhindi and stir to coat with the masala.
- Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until bhindi is cooked and slightly crispy.
- Sprinkle garam masala and mix well before turning off the heat.

name: Dhabha Style Paneer Do Pyaza
instructions:
prep_step:
- Peel and roughly chop onions into medium pieces; no fine chopping needed.
- Chop tomatoes finely.
- Crush or grind whole spices if preferred (optional).
- Chop green chilies.
- Prepare curd by mixing with red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder.

quick_step:
- Roast whole spices in mustard oil and sauté onions and garlic until browned.
- Add ground spices, tomatoes, and cook to form a thick gravy base.
- Mix spiced curd into the gravy and cook until oil separates.
- Roast paneer with onions, green chilies, and spices separately.
- Combine paneer with gravy, add cream, simmer, and garnish with coriander.

cook_step:
- Heat mustard oil in a pan until smoking; add whole spices (cumin, dried red chillies, cinnamon, cardamom, bay leaves, black pepper) and roast until fragrant.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until they soften and start to brown and crush down.
- Add garlic (whole or paste) and cook with onions.
- Add ground ginger, red chili powder, turmeric, and Kashmiri red chili powder; roast briefly without burning ginger.
- Add water quickly to prevent spices from burning, then add tomatoes and salt; cover and cook on medium flame until tomatoes are soft and mixture forms a thick paste with oil separating.
- Add the prepared spiced curd mixture to the pan, stirring quickly to avoid curd splitting; cook for 2-3 minutes until oil separates again.
- Add water to adjust gravy consistency; cover and simmer.
- In a separate pan, heat oil and roast coriander and cumin seeds (optionally kalonji).
- Add paneer cubes and roast on high flame until slightly browned.
- Add 2 onions (one roasted, one raw) and chopped green chilies to paneer; sprinkle turmeric and red chili powder; roast well on high flame.
- Add salt to paneer mixture at the end and mix well; turn off heat.
- Mash the cooked gravy slightly with the back of a bowl to form a smooth paste.
- Add cream to the gravy and mix well.
- Add the roasted paneer and onion mixture to the gravy; add a little water if too thick.
- Simmer covered on low flame for 10 minutes, then turn off heat and keep covered for 5 minutes to develop flavors.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Palak Corn (Spinach Corn Curry)
instructions:
prep_step:
- For extra flavor, saute onions and tomatoes for longer (until mushy) instead of boiling them with water. Saute spinach as well. This is highly recommended if you double or triple the recipe. For our everyday food, I prefer not to saute in oil for too long. So I boil them with water. Also sauteing will require a little more oil.
- If you are using besan, roast it very well until aromatic and add them to the sauteed onions. We are not sautéing the onions until golden in this recipe, so it is important to roast the flour separately.
- Avoid making the dish too hot. That will mute the flavors of the spinach and cashews.
- There is no advantage of making this dish in IP, except you can cook the basmati rice while cooking the onions and tomatoes. If you are using premium aged basmati rice that takes longer than 5 mins to cook in IP, you may cook longer or soak the rice for 30 mins and cook for the same 5 mins.
- Lemon juice as required to serve
- Heat oil in a pot and add the cardamoms, onions, green chilies, ginger, garlic, and salt. Saute for 4 to 5 mins until transparent. Add the cashews, tomatoes and water. Bring to a rolling boil on a high heat. Reduce to medium and cook covered until very soft, for 10 mins.
- Open the lid & reserve half of the green chilies aside so you can adjust the heat levels as you blend in the next steps.
- Stir in garam masala, salt, spinach and coriander leaves. Saute until wilted and cooked through, for 3 to 4 mins. Turn off and stir in the rest of the water.
- Blend using an immersion blender or a stand blender to a smooth or coarse puree, as per your preference. (cool down first, if using a stand blender). Taste test and adjust the green chilies/heat level at this stage.
- Return the palak mixture to the pot and add corn kernels. Bring to a boil and let simmer for 3 to 4 mins. If you are using mature spinach, you may cook for another 3 to 4 mins. Taste test and adjust salt & garam masala. Crush kasuri methi in your hands and sprinkle.
- Turn off and pour the cream. Corn palak is ready to serve at this stage. You may serve it with a squeeze of lemon juice if you don't want to make the tadka.
- Heat five ml ghee in a non-stick pan and place the paneer cubes. Fry until golden on a medium high heat, tossing them around gently. Stir in half to the corn palak and reserve the rest.
- Turn off the heat and add the remaining ghee, cumin seeds and red chilies. When the seeds sizzle, turn on and add the garlic.
- Let fry on a low heat until light golden. Turn off and stir in the hing, red chili powder and the rest of the fried paneer. Mix well and pour this immediately over the corn palak. Garnish with more heavy cream if you want.
- Perform the first step on saute mode and pressure cook for 5 mins after pouring water. I cook basmati rice along with this, placed on a high legged trivet. Gently release the pressure immediately. Follow the rest as mentioned above.
- Nutrition values include paneer, heavy cream, cashews and all other optional ingredients.
- If you any more sides, this can serve 6 people.
- Avoid mature coriander leaves and stalks as it can make your dish taste soapy.
- To use yogurt, whisk it well in a bowl and stir in 2 to forty five g of cooked corn palak. Mix well and add back to the pot. Avoid cooking after adding yogurt. Also omit tomatoes if you are using yogurt.

cook_step:
- For extra flavor, saute onions and tomatoes for longer (until mushy) instead of boiling them with water. Saute spinach as well. This is highly recommended if you double or triple the recipe. For our everyday food, I prefer not to saute in oil for too long. So I boil them with water. Also sauteing will require a little more oil.
- If you are using besan, roast it very well until aromatic and add them to the sauteed onions. We are not sautéing the onions until golden in this recipe, so it is important to roast the flour separately.
- Avoid making the dish too hot. That will mute the flavors of the spinach and cashews.
