- To a blender, add tomatoes, sautéed onions, cashews and water. Blend to a smooth puree. If you want you can also blend the cashews separately with water to a smooth cream.
- Remove the chicken from the refrigerator, to bring it close to room temperature.
- Melt butter in a pan & add all the whole spices – cinnamon, cloves and cardamoms.
- When they begin to sizzle, stir in the ginger garlic paste & green chilies. Fry on a low heat, for a minute or 2, till it turns fragrant but not burnt.
- Turn off the heat and stir in red chili powder, garam masala, cumin and coriander powder.
- Stir in the tomato cashew puree. If it is not smooth, strain it to the pan.
- Mix well and cover partially. Bring it to a boil on a medium high heat, reduce the heat to low or medium. Cook until the puree turns thick, keep stirring occasionally.
- Pour hot water and simmer for 10 mins, until the sauce thickens & traces of fats are visible on top of the sauce. Remove the whole spices and discard at this stage.
- Spread one tbsp. butter or ghee in a griddle/pan and heat it well. Place the marinated chicken pieces, spacing them a little apart.
- Fry on a medium heat for 2 mins and turn them. Don’t burn and do not overcook. Cook till the chicken is just cooked and all the marinade dries up. It is not necessary to fully cook the chicken at this stage.
- This way roast the chicken pieces in 2 to 3 batches, depending on the size of your skillet.
- Add chicken to the butter chicken gravy. Pour more hot water (about one hundred and twenty g, not in the recipe) if the sauce is too thick. Cover and simmer for about 5 to 7 minutes till it becomes tender.
- Stir in salt, sugar and kasuri methi. Taste test and optionally add more garam masala & another tablespoon butter for additional flavour (both are optional).
- Turn off and stir in the heavy cream. Garnish Butter Chicken with chopped coriander leaves and some cream. Serve with Turmeric rice , steamed Basmati Rice , Butter naan or Cumin Rice .
- Read my pro tips and Ingredients section in the post.
- Soak cashews in hot boiling water for 15 to 30 mins, if you don’t have a powerful blender.
- Use good quality ripe sweet tomatoes. Avoid using sour/tangy tomatoes.
- Using onions is optional and you may use them to cut down the sour taste of the tomatoes.
- The quantity & type of tomatoes and ground spices determine the color of your butter chicken gravy.
- Butter chicken is a mild curry, using a lot of spices alters the flavor and taste of the sauce.
- If using almonds, soak them in hot water for a few hours and remove the skin. Grind them with half cup water. You can also use sixty g blanched almond flour, grind it with half cup water until really smooth.
- You can also use 1 -14 oz whole peeled tomatoes to sub fresh tomatoes

name: Corn Palak Sabzi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and clean two hundred g of spinach leaves.
- Boil 1.5 glass of water and blanch the spinach leaves for 5-7 minutes until soft, then drain and let cool.
- Grind the blanched spinach leaves with garlic cloves into a smooth paste without adding water.
- Chop 1 big onion, 1 medium capsicum, 1 medium tomato, and slice 1 inch ginger.

quick_step:
- Blanch and grind spinach with garlic to make a smooth paste.
- Sauté cumin seeds, onions, capsicum, and tomatoes in oil.
- Add corn and spices; cook briefly.
- Mix in spinach paste and water; simmer.
- Finish with cream and cook for 2 more minutes.

cook_step:
- Heat forty five ml oil in a pan and add fifteen g cumin seeds; sauté for a few seconds on medium flame.
- Add chopped onions and fry for 2 minutes until color changes.
- Add chopped capsicum and fry for 2 minutes on medium flame.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook for 2-3 minutes until soft.
- Add fifty g frozen corn (or boiled raw corn) and cook for 1 minute.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, vegetable masala powder, chicken masala powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt; cook spices for 30 seconds on low-medium flame.
- Add the spinach paste and half a cup of water; mix well and cook covered on low flame for 5-7 minutes.
- Add fifteen ml fresh cream, mix, cover and cook for another 2 minutes on low flame.
- Turn off the gas and mix well before serving.

name: Veg Hyderabadi Curry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and chop all mixed vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
- Slice the onion and chop tomatoes.
- Soak cashew nuts in warm water for 15 minutes.
- Chop coriander and mint leaves.
- Prepare ginger garlic paste if not store-bought.

quick_step:
- Chop and prepare all vegetables and ingredients.
- Sauté onions, ginger garlic paste, and green chilies.
- Cook tomatoes until soft and add cashew-yogurt paste with spices.
- Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender.
- Finish with cream, garam masala, and fresh herbs.

cook_step:
- Heat oil or ghee in a handi or deep pan and add cumin seeds.
- Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger garlic paste and green chilies, sauté until raw smell disappears.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and oil separates.
- Grind soaked cashew nuts with yogurt to a smooth paste and add to the pan.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt and mix well.
- Add mixed vegetables and stir to coat with masala.
- Add water as needed, cover and cook until vegetables are tender.
- Add fresh cream, garam masala, chopped coriander and mint leaves, mix gently and cook for another 5 minutes.
- Adjust seasoning and garnish with additional coriander leaves before serving.

name: Paneer Mughlai
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut paneer into cubes and set aside.
- Soak cashew nuts in warm water for 15 minutes and grind to a smooth paste.
- Finely chop onions and prepare ginger and garlic paste.

quick_step:
- Prepare paneer cubes and cashew nut paste.
- Sauté whole spices and onions in ghee.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree.
- Mix in spices and cashew paste to form gravy.
- Add paneer and simmer with cream.
- Garnish and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan and add whole spices: cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and bay leaf.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add ginger and garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
- Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add cashew nut paste and cook for 2-3 minutes on low heat.
- Add water as needed to adjust gravy consistency and bring to a boil.
- Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
- Stir in fresh cream and garam masala; cook for another 2 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Chicken Mughlai
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and cut the boneless chicken into medium pieces.
- Slice onions finely.
- Prepare garlic and ginger paste.
- Whisk yogurt and cream together.

quick_step:
- Prepare chicken and ingredients.
- Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger.
- Cook chicken with spices and tomato puree.
- Add yogurt and cream, simmer until tender.
- Finish with garam masala and garnish.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté sliced onions until golden brown.
- Add garlic and ginger paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
- Add chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
- Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt; cook until oil separates.
- Add yogurt and cream mixture, stir well and cook on low heat.
- Add water as needed to adjust gravy consistency and simmer until chicken is tender.
- Sprinkle garam masala and cook for another 5 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

name: Dal Makhani Dinner Special
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak urad dal and rajma overnight.
- Chop tomatoes into big pieces.
- Finely chop onions.
- Prepare ginger-garlic paste if not ready.
- Finely chop coriander leaves for garnish.

quick_step:
- Soak urad dal and rajma overnight.
- Pressure cook dal with spices and water.
- Prepare tomato puree and cook with spices and onions.
- Mix cooked dal with tomato-spice mixture, add cream and butter.
- Prepare garlic tempering and add to dal.
- Garnish with coriander and serve.

cook_step:
- Add soaked urad dal, rajma, garlic cloves, bay leaf, big cardamom, salt, Kashmiri red chilli powder, and water to the pressure cooker.
- Cook the dal mixture in the pressure cooker until 4 whistles, then simmer on low flame and let it cool.
- Grind the chopped tomatoes into a puree.
- Heat butter in a wok, add bay leaf, big cardamoms, cumin seeds, and green chilli; sauté until aromatic.
- Add finely chopped onions and cook until translucent.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and salt; cook briefly.
- Add garam masala, coriander powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, and turmeric powder; cook the spices until aromatic.
- Add the tomato puree to the wok and cook until the mixture becomes soft and oil separates.
- Add the cooked dal from the cooker to the wok and mix well.
- Add fresh cream and a big cube of butter; mix thoroughly.
- Prepare tempering by heating ghee, adding garlic cloves and asafoetida, cooking briefly, then adding Kashmiri red chilli powder.
- Pour the tempering over the dal makhani and mix well.
- Garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Veg Achari
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and chop the mixed vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
- Chop tomatoes finely.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables and tomatoes.
- Heat oil and temper with pickling spices.
- Cook tomatoes and add spices.
- Add vegetables and water, then simmer until cooked.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, fennel seeds, and cumin seeds; let them splutter.
- Add a pinch of asafoetida and sauté for a few seconds.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, amchur powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add chopped vegetables and stir to coat with the spices.
- Add water, cover, and cook on medium heat until vegetables are tender and gravy thickens.
- Adjust seasoning and cook for another 2 minutes before turning off the heat.

name: Tawa Paneer
instructions:
prep_step:
- Cut paneer into large cubes.
- Mix curd, Kashmiri red chilli powder, garam masala powder, and salt to make the marinade.
- Coat paneer cubes well with the marinade and let it sit for about 10 minutes.

quick_step:
- Marinate paneer cubes with curd and spices for 10 minutes.
- Sauté onions, green chillies, and ginger-garlic paste until browned.
- Cook tomatoes and capsicum with spices to form a masala.
- Add marinated paneer and cook gently to combine flavors.
- Garnish with kasuri methi and coriander leaves and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat oil on a tawa or non-stick pan.
- Add finely chopped onions and chopped green chillies; cook until onions turn brown.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and salt; sauté briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until mushy.
- Add capsicum pieces and mix well.
- Add turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, chaat masala, and salt; mix well.
- Add a little water to help cook the masala and cook for about 10 minutes until oil separates.
- Add marinated paneer cubes and cook on medium-low flame for about 5 minutes, mixing gently to combine with the masala.
- Finish by adding kasuri methi and chopped coriander leaves.
- Serve hot.

name: Dahi Puri
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and mash the potatoes.
- Whisk the yogurt until smooth.
- Prepare tamarind and green chutneys if not store-bought.
- Chop fresh coriander leaves.

quick_step:
- Boil and mash potatoes with spices.
- Prepare and whisk yogurt.
- Fill puris with potato mixture and chutneys.
- Top with yogurt, sev, and coriander.

cook_step:
- Mix mashed potatoes with salt, chaat masala, red chili powder, and cumin powder.
- Crack open each puri carefully to create a hollow space.
- Fill each puri with the spiced potato mixture.
- Add tamarind chutney and green chutney over the potatoes.
- Top generously with whisked yogurt.
- Sprinkle sev and chopped coriander leaves on top.

name: Chicken Rezala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and cut the chicken into medium pieces.
- Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and salt for at least 30 minutes.
- Soak poppy seeds in water and grind to a smooth paste.
- Slice onions thinly.
- Soak saffron strands in warm milk.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
- Sauté whole spices and onions in ghee.
- Cook chicken until tender.
- Add poppy seed paste, cream, and saffron milk.
- Simmer until gravy thickens and flavors blend.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan and add whole spices: green cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and bay leaf.
- Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add marinated chicken and cook on medium heat until chicken is tender and oil separates.
- Add poppy seed paste, nutmeg powder, and mix well.
- Pour in cream and saffron milk, simmer gently for 10 minutes.
- Adjust salt and cook until gravy thickens to desired consistency.

name: Matar Mushroom Masala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and slice the mushrooms.
- Finely chop the onions.
- Mince garlic and grate ginger.

quick_step:
- Prepare vegetables by chopping and pureeing.
- Sauté spices and onions to build the masala base.
- Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates.
- Add mushrooms and peas, then simmer until cooked.
- Finish with garam masala and garnish.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds until they splutter.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
- Add minced garlic and grated ginger; cook for a minute.
- Add turmeric, red chili powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.
- Add mushrooms and green peas; stir to coat with spices.
- Add water as needed and simmer until mushrooms and peas are cooked.
- Sprinkle garam masala and cook for another 2 minutes.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Corn Palak
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and chop the spinach finely.
- Chop the onion, tomato, green chili, and mince garlic and ginger.

quick_step:
- Chop spinach and vegetables.
- Sauté onions, ginger, garlic, and chili.
- Cook tomatoes with spices.
- Add corn and spinach; cook until tender.
- Finish with garam masala and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds; let them splutter.
- Add chopped onions, ginger, garlic, and green chili; sauté until onions turn translucent.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; mix well.
- Add sweet corn kernels and chopped spinach; stir to combine.
- Pour water, cover, and cook on medium heat for 8-10 minutes until spinach is cooked and corn is tender.
- Sprinkle garam masala and mix well; cook for another minute.
- Turn off heat and serve hot.

name: Paneer Shahi Korma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice the onion thinly.
- Soak cashew nuts in warm water for 15 minutes.
- Soak saffron strands in warm milk.
- Cut paneer into cubes.

quick_step:
- Prepare ingredients: slice onions, soak cashews and saffron, cube paneer.
- Sauté whole spices and onions until golden.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and cashew-yogurt paste; cook masala.
- Add spices and paneer cubes; simmer with water.
- Finish with cream and saffron milk; garnish and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan and add cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon; sauté until fragrant.
- Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until raw smell disappears.
- Grind soaked cashews with yogurt to a smooth paste and add to the pan.
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; cook the masala until oil separates.
- Add paneer cubes and mix gently.
- Pour some water to adjust gravy consistency and simmer for 10 minutes.
- Add fresh cream and soaked saffron milk; cook for another 5 minutes on low heat.
- Garnish with chopped coriander leaves if desired and serve hot.

name: Shahi Chicken Korma
instructions:
prep_step:
- Marinate chicken with red chilli powder, salt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and yogurt for 1 hour.
- Chop onions finely.
- Grind fried onions into a paste after frying.
- Grind whole spices (cumin seeds, cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, black pepper) for the final spice mix.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with spices and yogurt for 1 hour.
- Fry onions until golden brown and grind into a paste.
- Cook marinated chicken with whole spices and dry masala.
- Add curd, almonds, and water; then add onion paste and cook.
- Add ground spice mix and Kevra water; simmer until done.
- Serve hot with bread or rice.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and fry chopped onions on high flame until golden brown, stirring continuously.
- Remove fried onions from oil and keep aside.
- In the same oil, add whole garam masala spices (cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, black pepper, bay leaves) and sauté briefly.
- Add marinated chicken and cook on high flame for 5-7 minutes until masala dries and separates.
- Add beaten curd and chopped almonds, mix well, cover and cook on high flame for 7-8 minutes.
- Add water to make a thick paste and then add the ground fried onion paste, mix well, and cook covered on medium flame for 4-5 minutes.
- Add the freshly ground spice mix and Kevra water, then add more water, mix well, cover and cook on low flame for 10-12 minutes.
- Turn off the flame and let the Korma rest before serving.

name: Deewani Handi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, garlic, green chillies, and tomatoes.
- Half boil vegetables: carrot, baby corn, green peas, beans, and cauliflower.
- Soak cashew nuts if needed for blending.

quick_step:
- Prepare and half boil mixed vegetables.
- Make a spiced tomato and cashew nut gravy.
- Blend the gravy into a smooth paste.
- Cook the paste with spices and add half boiled vegetables.
- Finish with butter, fresh cream, and fresh coriander garnish.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
- Add chopped garlic and onion, sauté until golden brown.
- Add chopped green chillies, turmeric powder, and Kashmiri chilli powder; cook briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cashew nuts, turmeric powder, degi mixed powder, salt, and water; cook for 5-6 minutes to make the gravy.
- Blend the cooked gravy into a smooth paste and set aside.
- In the same pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, chopped garlic, and onion; sauté well.
- Add chopped green chillies, turmeric powder, Kashmiri chilli powder, and then add the prepared gravy paste.
- Add water as needed, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt; cook the mixture.
- Add half boiled vegetables to the gravy and cook until vegetables are tender.
- Finish by adding butter, fresh cream, and garnish with fresh coriander.
- Cook for a few more minutes until the gravy thickens and the flavors blend well.

name: Sev Puri Dip
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and dice the potatoes.
- Chop coriander and onions finely.
- Mix coriander and spices into the curd to make a spiced curd layer.

quick_step:
- Mix coriander and spices into curd.
- Layer spiced curd in a serving bowl.
- Add tamarind chutney, boiled potatoes, green chutney, and onions in layers.
- Chill the dip for several hours if desired.
- Top generously with sev just before serving to keep it crunchy.

name: Egg Butter Masala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak dried red chilies and cashews in water/milk for 5 minutes.
- Boil eggs, peel them, and keep them aside in cold water.
- Grind soaked tomatoes and red chilies into a fine paste.
- Grind soaked cashews into a smooth paste.
- Finely chop garlic and onions (use a chopper if needed).
- Cut boiled eggs on one side, keeping the other side plain.

quick_step:
- Soak dried red chilies and cashews; grind tomatoes and chilies into a paste.
- Boil and peel eggs; finely chop onions and garlic.
- Prepare gravy by frying spices, onions, tomato paste, and cashew paste until oil separates.
- Add water, garam masala, and milk malai to the gravy and bring to boil.
- Lightly brown eggs in butter with spices and add to the gravy.
- Simmer for 2 minutes, then let rest before serving.

cook_step:
- Heat oil and butter in a wok until butter melts but does not brown.
- Add whole spices (as per recipe) and fry for 30 seconds to 1 minute to release aroma.
- Add finely chopped garlic and sauté until it gets color.
- Add finely chopped onions and brown them on medium flame.
- Add turmeric powder and Kashmiri red chili powder; roast for 1 minute.
- Add tomato and chili paste along with salt; cook until water evaporates and oil separates.
- Add coriander powder and chicken masala; roast well to enhance flavor.
- Add cashew paste and cook for about a minute without over-roasting.
- Add about two hundred and forty ml water and bring the gravy to a boil.
- Add garam masala and mix well.
- Add milk with malai and adjust taste; add sugar if needed.
- In a separate pan, heat butter without browning it, add eggs and lightly brown them.
- Add turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, julienned green chilies, and sauté for 1 minute.
- Transfer eggs and spices into the gravy, add coriander seeds, mix, and cook for 2 minutes.
- Turn off the heat and let the curry rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Paneer Butter Pepper Fry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Dice paneer into cubes.
- Soak cashews in warm water for 10 minutes.
- Blend soaked cashews with tomatoes to make a smooth puree.

quick_step:
- Dice and fry paneer cubes in butter with spices.
- Soak cashews and blend with tomatoes to make puree.
- Prepare tadka with jeera, chillies, onions, and ginger-garlic paste.
- Add tomato-cashew puree and cook gravy.
- Add fried paneer to gravy and simmer.
- Garnish and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat butter in a pan, add salt, turmeric, and red chilli powder, then fry paneer cubes until golden brown on all sides. Set aside.
- In the same pan, add jeera, red chillies, green chillies, and chopped onions; sauté until onions turn translucent.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and basic masalas, cook for a minute.
- Add the tomato-cashew puree and cook until the gravy thickens.
- Add the fried paneer cubes to the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.
- Garnish with coriander leaves and kasoori methi before serving.

name: Chicken Butter Pepper Fry
instructions:
prep_step:
- Clean and cut the chicken into medium-sized pieces.
- Finely chop garlic and ginger.

quick_step:
- Prepare chicken and chop aromatics.
- Sauté garlic, ginger, chilies, and curry leaves in butter and oil.
- Cook chicken with salt until tender.
- Add black pepper and cook until coated and crispy.

cook_step:
- Heat oil and butter in a pan over medium heat.
- Add garlic, ginger, green chilies, and curry leaves; sauté until fragrant.
- Add the chicken pieces and salt; cook until chicken is tender and cooked through.
- Sprinkle freshly ground black pepper and mix well.
- Cook until the chicken is coated well with butter and pepper and slightly crispy.

name: Vegetable Dum Biryani
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil water with black pepper, cinnamon, bay leaf, and ghee.
- Soak the basmati rice in the boiling water until partially cooked.
- Chop onions, tomatoes, potatoes (if using), coriander, and mint leaves.
- Mix curd with biryani masala, garam masala, coriander powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, and turmeric powder to make the spice mix.

quick_step:
- Boil and soak basmati rice with whole spices.
- Prepare spiced yogurt mixture with biryani masala and other spices.
- Cook onion, green chilli, garlic, and tomatoes to make the masala base.
- Add potatoes or paneer and cook with the masala.
- Layer cooked rice over the vegetable masala, garnish with coriander and mint.
- Cover and cook for 5 minutes to finish the biryani.
- Serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions; cook until soft.
- Add green chilli and garlic paste, cook briefly.
- Add chopped tomatoes and salt, cook on high flame until tomatoes soften.
- Add biryani masala and cook until oil separates from the masala.
- Add chopped potatoes or paneer and cook well with the masala.
- Add the cooked rice on top of the vegetable masala, sprinkle chopped coriander and mint leaves.
- Cover and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes to allow flavors to blend and rice to finish cooking.
- Turn off the stove and serve hot.

name: Veg Frankie Roll
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and mash the potatoes.
- Chop onions, tomatoes, and green chili finely.
- Prepare dough by mixing all-purpose flour with water and a pinch of salt; knead to a soft dough.

quick_step:
- Prepare and knead the dough.
- Make the spiced vegetable filling.
- Roll out dough and fill with the vegetable mixture.
- Cook the rolls on a griddle until golden and crisp.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste until fragrant.
- Add chopped onions, green chili, and tomatoes; cook until soft.
- Add boiled potatoes, green peas, and spices; mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
- Divide dough into small balls and roll out into thin circles.
- Place a portion of the vegetable filling on the rolled dough and fold to form a roll.
- Cook the roll on a hot griddle with a little oil until golden brown on both sides.

name: Chicken Dum Biryani
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
- Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, green chilies, lemon juice, salt, and some fried onions for at least 30 minutes.
- Prepare saffron soaked in warm milk.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with spices and yogurt.
- Soak and parboil basmati rice.
- Layer chicken and rice in a pot with herbs and saffron.
- Seal and slow cook on low heat (dum).

cook_step:
- Parboil the soaked rice with whole spices until 70% cooked and drain.
- Layer marinated chicken at the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot.
- Add a layer of parboiled rice over the chicken.
- Sprinkle fried onions, mint, coriander leaves, and saffron milk over the rice.
- Seal the pot with dough or a tight lid and cook on low heat (dum) for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
- Turn off the heat and let it rest for 10 minutes before opening.

name: Bhel Puri
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, tomatoes, and coriander leaves finely.
- Boil and dice the potato.
- Prepare tamarind and green chutneys if not store-bought.

quick_step:
- Mix puffed rice, chopped onions, tomatoes, and boiled potato in a bowl.
- Add tamarind chutney, green chutney, lemon juice, chaat masala, and salt.
- Garnish with sev and chopped coriander leaves.
- Serve immediately to retain crunchiness.

cook_step:
- No cooking required; this is an assembly snack.

name: Bihari Chicken Bhuna Masala
instructions:
prep_step:
- Add turmeric powder and salt to the whole chicken pieces and mix well.
- Prepare the masala paste by mixing turmeric, red chilli powder, garam masala, cumin powder, black pepper, chicken masala, and water in a bowl.
- Slice onions and crush ginger and garlic.

quick_step:
- Marinate chicken with turmeric and salt.
- Prepare spice masala paste with dry spices and water.
- Fry chicken pieces in mustard oil and set aside.
- Sauté whole spices, ginger, garlic, and onions until brown.
- Cook masala paste until oil separates.
- Add chicken to masala and cook until done.
- Add water if needed to prevent sticking.
- Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat mustard oil in a wok and fry the chicken pieces on high flame for 4-5 minutes, then remove and set aside.
- Add more mustard oil to the wok and heat, then add cumin seeds, bay leaves, dry red chillies, coriander leaves, crushed ginger, and garlic.
- Add sliced onions and garlic cloves with salt, and fry until the onions turn brown.
- Add the prepared masala paste to the wok and cook until the oil separates from the masala.
- Add the fried chicken pieces back into the wok and mix well with the masala.
- Cook the chicken on medium heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- If the chicken sticks to the wok, add some water to prevent burning.
- Once the chicken releases oil and is cooked through, garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve.

name: Veg Gassi with Rice
instructions:
prep_step:
- Peel and chop potatoes and carrots into small pieces.
- Chop the small onion finely.
- Prepare the spice masala by grinding or mixing mustard seeds, urad dal, and red chillies.

quick_step:
- Chop vegetables and prepare spice masala.
- Sauté mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and onions in coconut oil.
- Add spice masala and vegetables; cook with water and salt until tender.
- Add boiled eggs and simmer.
- Serve hot with rice or chapathi.

cook_step:
- Add coconut oil to a pan and heat it.
- Add mustard seeds and urad dal; sauté until they turn golden.
- Add curry leaves and chopped onions; sauté until onions are translucent.
- Add the ground spice masala and cook for 30 seconds.
- Add chopped potatoes and carrots to the pan, mix well.
- Add water and salt; cover and cook until vegetables are tender.
- Add boiled eggs to the curry and simmer for a few minutes.
- Adjust consistency with water as needed and cook on high heat briefly before turning off.

name: Kori Gassi
instructions:
prep_step:
- Soak bedgi chillies in warm water for 10 minutes.
- Grind soaked bedgi chillies, grated coconut, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and garlic cloves into a smooth paste.
- Clean and cut the chicken into pieces.
- Prepare tamarind water by diluting tamarind paste in water.

quick_step:
- Soak and grind bedgi chillies with coconut and spices to make a paste.
- Prepare chicken pieces and tamarind water.
- Sauté mustard seeds and curry leaves, then cook the spice paste.
- Add chicken and cook briefly, then add tamarind water and simmer.
- Cook until chicken is tender and curry thickens.
- Serve hot with Kori Roti or rice.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and curry leaves until they splutter.
- Add the ground spice paste and sauté until oil separates from the masala.
- Add chicken pieces and salt, cook for 5 minutes on medium heat.
- Pour tamarind water and additional water as needed, bring to a boil.
- Simmer on low heat until chicken is cooked and the curry thickens.
- Adjust salt and spice levels as needed and cook for a few more minutes.

name: Masala Samosa
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and mash the potatoes; set aside.
- Heat oil in a pan, add mustard and cumin seeds until they splutter.
- Add chopped green chili and grated ginger; sauté briefly.
- Add peas, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, amchur, and salt; cook until peas are soft.
- Mix in the mashed potatoes and cook the mixture for a few minutes; let it cool.
- In a bowl, mix flour, salt, and oil; gradually add water to knead a firm dough.
- Divide the dough into small balls and roll each into a thin oval or circle.

quick_step:
- Prepare and cook the spiced potato and pea filling.
- Make a firm dough from flour, salt, oil, and water.
- Roll dough, cut, and shape into cones.
- Fill cones with the potato mixture and seal.
- Deep fry until golden and crispy.

cook_step:
- Cut the rolled dough into halves and form cones by sealing the edges with water.
- Fill each cone with the prepared potato filling and seal the open edges tightly.
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
- Fry the samosas in hot oil until golden brown and crispy on all sides.
- Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels before serving.

name: Ruhi Style Soft Paneer Pakora
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop green coriander and green chillies finely.
- Cut paneer into long sticks.
- Mix gram flour with chopped coriander, green chillies, cumin seeds, red chilli powder, ajwain, and salt.
- Add water gradually to make a smooth batter and let it rest for 10 minutes.
- Prepare chutney by blending coriander, black pepper, bhikayani or saffron (or peanuts/cashews), white salt, and lemon juice; then mix in curd.

quick_step:
- Prepare batter with gram flour and spices, let it rest.
- Make coriander chutney with spices and curd.
- Cut paneer into sticks and coat with batter mixed with baking powder.
- Deep fry pakoras on medium heat until golden and soft.
- Serve hot with chutney and sprinkle chaat masala.

cook_step:
- Add baking powder to the rested batter and mix well.
- Heat oil on medium flame for frying.
- Dip paneer sticks into the batter to coat them evenly.
- Fry the coated paneer sticks in hot oil on medium flame until golden brown and cooked through, about 2 minutes.
- Remove pakoras and drain excess oil.
- Sprinkle chaat masala on pakoras after they cool slightly.

name: Onion Pakoda
instructions:
prep_step:
- Slice 4-5 medium onions thinly.
- Chop 2-3 green chillies and a handful of coriander leaves.
- In a mixing bowl, combine sliced onions, green chillies, coriander leaves, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, coriander powder, ginger garlic paste, and salt.
- Add two hundred and forty g besan and thirty g rice flour to the mixture.
- Add water gradually and mix well to form a batter that holds together but is not too runny.

quick_step:
- Slice onions and chop green chillies and coriander.
- Mix onions with spices, besan, rice flour, and water to make batter.
- Heat oil for deep frying.
- Drop batter portions into hot oil and fry until golden and crispy.
- Drain and serve hot with chutney.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
- Take small portions of the pakora batter and drop them carefully into the hot oil.
- Fry the pakoras, flipping occasionally, until they turn golden brown and crispy on both sides.
- Remove the pakoras with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
- Serve hot with green chutney.

name: Roasted Chana Snack Mix
instructions:
prep_step:
- Measure out roasted chana and keep aside.
- Mix all the dry spices in a small bowl.

quick_step:
- Gather roasted chana and spices.
- Heat oil and roast chana in a pan.
- Add spices and salt, toss well.
- Roast until crispy and cool before serving.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan on medium heat.
- Add roasted chana to the pan and roast for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Sprinkle the mixed spices and salt over the chana and toss well to coat evenly.
- Continue roasting for another 5 minutes until the chana is crispy and fragrant.
- Remove from heat and let cool before serving.

name: Aloo Bonda
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and peel the potatoes, then mash them until smooth.
- Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves until they splutter.
- Add chopped green chili, grated ginger, turmeric, red chili powder, asafoetida, and salt to the pan and sauté briefly.
- Mix the sautéed spices into the mashed potatoes and combine well. Let the mixture cool.
- Prepare a smooth batter by mixing gram flour, salt, turmeric, and water.

quick_step:
- Boil and mash potatoes.
- Prepare spiced potato filling by sautéing spices and mixing with potatoes.
- Make gram flour batter.
- Shape filling into balls and coat with batter.
- Deep fry until golden and crispy.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
- Shape the spiced mashed potato mixture into small balls.
- Dip each potato ball into the gram flour batter, coating it evenly.
- Carefully drop the coated balls into hot oil and deep fry until golden brown and crispy.
- Remove the bondas with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.

name: Bread Pakora Stuffed
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and mash the potatoes.
- Mix mashed potatoes with chopped green chili, coriander leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt.
- Prepare a smooth batter by mixing gram flour with water and a pinch of salt.
- Cut bread slices into desired shapes if preferred.

quick_step:
- Prepare spicy mashed potato filling.
- Make gram flour batter.
- Stuff bread slices with potato filling and dip in batter.
- Deep fry until golden and crispy.

cook_step:
- Take a bread slice and spread the potato mixture evenly on one side.
- Cover with another bread slice to make a sandwich.
- Dip the stuffed bread sandwich into the gram flour batter, coating it well.
- Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the coated bread pakoras until golden and crispy.
- Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels before serving.

name: Vegetable Cutlet
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil potatoes, carrots, and peas until soft and mash them together.
- Chop green chili and coriander leaves finely.
- Mix mashed vegetables with green chili, ginger, coriander, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
- Shape the mixture into small round or oval cutlets.
- Coat each cutlet evenly with bread crumbs.

quick_step:
- Boil and mash vegetables.
- Mix with spices and herbs.
- Shape into cutlets and coat with bread crumbs.
- Shallow fry until golden and crispy.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan for shallow frying.
- Fry the cutlets on medium heat until both sides are golden brown and crispy.
- Remove and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.

name: Hara Bhara Kebab
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and chop the spinach finely.
- Boil and mash the potatoes.
- Boil the green peas until soft.
- Grate ginger and finely chop green chilies.
- Mix spinach, green peas, mashed potatoes, ginger, green chilies, garam masala, salt, bread crumbs, and cornflour to form a dough.

quick_step:
- Boil and mash potatoes; boil green peas.
- Chop spinach and mix all ingredients to form a dough.
- Shape into kebabs.
- Shallow fry until golden and crispy.

cook_step:
- Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into round or oval kebabs.
- Heat oil in a pan on medium flame.
- Shallow fry the kebabs until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
- Remove and drain on paper towels.

name: Cheese Corn Balls
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and mash the small potato.
- Boil the yellow corn and finely chop the green capsicum.
- Chop coriander leaves.
- Grind brown bread to make bread crumbs.
- Prepare a batter by mixing all purpose flour with water to a pouring consistency.

quick_step:
- Mix cheese, mashed potato, corn, capsicum, and spices to form a binding mixture.
- Shape mixture into small balls.
- Prepare a flour batter and coat balls with flour, batter, and bread crumbs.
- Deep fry until golden and crispy.
- Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.

cook_step:
- In a mixing bowl, combine grated cheese, mashed potato, boiled corn, chopped capsicum, coriander leaves, red chilli flakes, oregano, black pepper, garlic paste, corn flour, and a pinch of salt. Mix well to bind.
- Apply a little oil on your palms and shape the mixture into half-inch balls.
- Roll each ball in plain flour, dip in the all purpose flour batter, then coat with bread crumbs.
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan and deep fry the balls until golden and crispy.
- Remove and drain on paper towels. Serve hot immediately to enjoy the melted cheese inside.

name: Veg Spring Rolls
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onion, green chillies, capsicum, carrot, and cauliflower into small pieces.
- Mix flour and corn flour with water to make a batter of medium thickness and set aside.
- Prepare a mixture of dry flour and water to use as glue for sealing the spring rolls.

quick_step:
- Prepare and chop all vegetables.
- Make batter from flour and corn flour and cook thin crepes.
- Cook vegetables with seasoning to make filling.
- Fill crepes with vegetable mixture and roll, sealing edges with flour paste.
- Deep fry spring rolls until golden and crispy.
- Serve hot with chutney or tomato ketchup.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and sauté onion and green chillies until cooked.
- Add capsicum and carrot, cook for a few minutes.
- Add cauliflower and cook until tender.
- Season with salt, black pepper powder, and soy sauce; mix well and remove from heat.
- Heat a non-stick pan and spread a thin layer of the flour-corn flour batter to make a thin crepe; cook lightly on both sides.
- Place some vegetable filling on the crepe, apply the flour paste on edges, and roll tightly to form spring rolls.
- Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the spring rolls until golden and crispy on both sides.
- Remove and drain excess oil before serving.

name: Paneer Tikka Skewers
instructions:
prep_step:
- Roast the gram flour in a pan until it turns brown and fragrant.
- In a bowl, mix the roasted gram flour with curd, red chili powder, garam masala, turmeric, coriander powder, amchur powder, salt, and oil to form a marinade.
- Add chopped onion, tomato, capsicum, and paneer cubes to the marinade and coat them well.
- Allow the mixture to marinate for at least 30 minutes to absorb the flavors.

quick_step:
- Roast gram flour and prepare the spiced yogurt marinade.
- Mix paneer and chopped vegetables into the marinade and marinate.
- Skewer and grill the marinated paneer and vegetables.
- Brush with butter and lemon juice, then serve hot.

cook_step:
- Heat a grill or pan on medium heat.
- Skewer the marinated paneer and vegetables onto skewers.
- Roast the skewers on all sides until the paneer is cooked and slightly charred.
- Brush the cooked paneer tikka with butter and sprinkle lemon juice before serving.

name: Tandoori Aloo
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil the baby potatoes until tender, then peel and keep aside.
- In a bowl, mix yogurt, red chili powder, garam masala, ginger garlic paste, lemon juice, oil, salt, and chaat masala to create the marinade.
- Add the boiled potatoes to the marinade and coat them well. Let them marinate for at least 15 minutes.

quick_step:
- Boil and peel baby potatoes.
- Prepare a spiced yogurt marinade.
- Marinate potatoes for 15 minutes.
- Bake or grill until charred and cooked.
- Garnish and serve hot.

cook_step:
- Preheat the oven or tandoor to 200°C (400°F).
- Place the marinated potatoes on a baking tray or grill rack.
- Cook for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until the potatoes are charred and cooked through.
- Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Pav Bhaji Snack Platter
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash, peel and chop potatoes and tomatoes.
- Chop onions and bell peppers finely.
- Boil potatoes and green peas until soft.
- Chop coriander leaves and cut lemon into wedges.

quick_step:
- Boil and mash vegetables.
- Prepare bhaji by cooking mashed vegetables with spices.
- Toast pav bread with butter.
- Serve bhaji with buttered pav, lemon wedges, and coriander garnish.

cook_step:
- Heat butter in a pan and sauté onions until translucent.
- Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until raw smell disappears.
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
- Add boiled potatoes, green peas, and bell peppers; mash them together.
- Add pav bhaji masala, red chili powder, and salt; cook for 10 minutes while stirring.
- Toast pav bread with butter on a griddle until golden and crisp.
- Garnish bhaji with chopped coriander and serve hot with lemon wedges and buttered pav.

name: Vada Pav
instructions:
prep_step:
- Boil and peel the potatoes, then mash them smoothly.
- Chop green chilies and curry leaves finely.
- Prepare the batter by mixing gram flour with turmeric, red chili powder, salt, baking soda, and water to a thick consistency.
- Add mustard seeds, chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and ginger garlic paste to the mashed potatoes and mix well.

quick_step:
- Boil and mash potatoes with spices.
- Prepare gram flour batter.
- Shape potato mixture into balls and coat with batter.
- Assemble vada inside pav buns and serve.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
- Shape the potato mixture into round balls (vada).
- Dip each vada into the gram flour batter, coating it evenly.
- Deep fry the coated vadas until golden and crispy.
- Slice the pav buns horizontally and lightly toast them if desired.
- Assemble the vada pav by placing a hot vada inside the pav bun and serve with chutneys and fried green chili.

name: Misal Pav Snack Bowl
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and soak moong sprouts if needed.
- Chop onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
- Cut lemon into wedges.

quick_step:
- Prepare and chop all fresh ingredients.
- Cook the misal curry by sautéing spices, onions, tomatoes, and sprouts.
- Assemble the snack bowl with misal, farsan topping, and garnish.
- Serve with pav bread and lemon wedges.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.
- Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
- Add tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt; cook until tomatoes soften.
- Add moong sprouts and some water; simmer until sprouts are cooked and curry thickens.
- Assemble the bowl by pouring the misal curry into serving bowls.
- Top with farsan and chopped coriander.
- Serve hot with pav bread and lemon wedges on the side.

name: Masala French Fries
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and peel the potatoes.
- Cut the potatoes into thin sticks for fries.
- Soak the cut potatoes in water for 10 minutes to remove excess starch.

quick_step:
- Cut and soak potatoes.
- Toss fries with spices and lemon juice.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan.
- Drain the potatoes and pat them dry completely.
- Deep fry the potatoes in hot oil until golden and crispy.
- Remove fries and drain excess oil on paper towels.
- In a mixing bowl, toss the hot fries with red chili powder, chaat masala, salt, black pepper, and lemon juice until evenly coated.

name: Peri Peri Fries
instructions:
prep_step:
- Wash and peel the potatoes.
- Cut the potatoes into thin strips for fries.
- Soak the cut potatoes in water for 10 minutes to remove excess starch.

quick_step:
- Cut and soak potatoes.
- Mix peri peri sauce with spices.
- Serve hot as a spicy snack.

cook_step:
- Heat oil in a deep frying pan.
- Drain and pat dry the potato strips.
- Fry the potatoes in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
- Remove fries and drain excess oil on paper towels.
- In a bowl, mix peri peri sauce, minced garlic, chili powder, and salt.
- Toss the hot fries in the peri peri sauce mixture until evenly coated.

name: Cheesy Garlic Bread
instructions:
prep_step:
- Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
- Slice the bread loaf horizontally into halves or thick slices.
- Mince the garlic cloves finely.
- Mix softened butter with minced garlic, chopped parsley, and salt.

quick_step:
- Preheat oven to 375°F.
- Mix garlic with butter and parsley.
- Spread mixture on bread and top with cheese.
- Bake until cheese melts and bread is crispy.

cook_step:
- Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly over the bread slices.
- Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese generously on top.
- Place the bread on a baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
- Optionally, broil for 1-2 minutes to get a golden crust on top.

name: Chilli Cheese Toast
instructions:
prep_step:
- Finely chop green chili and garlic.
- Finely chop fresh coriander leaves and optionally green capsicum.
- Remove the edges of the bread slices if desired.
- Mix processed cheese with butter until creamy and smooth to avoid lumps.
- Add chopped green chili, garlic, coriander, capsicum, and a pinch of dry basil to the cheese-butter mixture and combine well.

quick_step:
- Toast bread slices on one side until light golden.
- Prepare a creamy mixture of processed cheese, butter, chopped green chili, garlic, coriander, and optional capsicum.
- Spread the cheese mixture on the toasted side of the bread.
- Cook the bread with cheese topping until cheese melts and becomes crispy.
- Serve hot as a delicious snack.

cook_step:
- Toast the bread slices on one side in a hot pan or toaster until light golden and crisp.
- Spread the prepared cheese-chili mixture evenly over the toasted side of the bread.
- Place the bread on the pan or salamander (oven) and cook until the cheese melts and the top becomes slightly crispy.
- Serve hot with ketchup or as desired.

name: Veg Cheese Sandwich Grill
instructions:
prep_step:
- Chop onions, tomatoes, capsicum, and green chili finely.
- Grate the cheese and keep it ready.
- Mix chopped vegetables with salt, black pepper, and chaat masala.

quick_step:
- Prepare and mix chopped vegetables with spices.
- Butter bread slices and layer vegetables and cheese between them.
- Grill sandwich until crispy and cheese melts.

cook_step:
- Butter one side of each bread slice.
- Place the bread slices buttered side down on a pan or sandwich grill.
- Spread the mixed vegetables evenly on two slices of bread.
- Sprinkle grated cheese over the vegetables.
- Cover with the other bread slices, buttered side up.
- Grill the sandwich on medium heat until the bread is golden brown and cheese melts, flipping once.

name: Paneer Biryani Recipe (Easy Dum Method)
instructions:
prep_step:
- Rice: For any biryani recipe, I usually prefer aged basmati rice as the grains become fluffy, tender and non-sticky when cooked. Parboiled basmati rice (sella basmati rice) is another variety I like to use. You can make this biryani with any long-grained, non-sticky rice.
- Cooking rice: Do not cook the rice completely, should be slightly underdone. Fully cooked grains will end up in a mushy biryani since the rice cooks further during the dum-cooking process.
- Paneer: Use homemade paneer for best taste and texture. For frozen paneer, thaw in warm or hot water for some minutes.
- Marinating paneer: I always marinate paneer for 30 minutes at room temperature. If I have more time, I marinate overnight in the refrigerator.
- Adding vegetables: You can add some steamed green peas and steamed veggies like carrots, cauliflower, potatoes to this recipe. But you will have to increase the curd and other spices accordingly to accommodate them.
- Making birista: The fried onions (birista) can be made a day before and stored in an air-tight container. You can also make a big batch and freeze for a longer storage and use.
- Whole spices: I recommend adding all the spices and herbs in the same proportion as listed in the recipe. The only suggestion I offer, which will alter the flavor slightly, is to replace caraway seeds (shahi jeera) with cumin seeds.
- Nuts and dried fruits: Fried cashews and raisins can be added on top of the rice layers.
- Vegan option: For a vegan biryani, use tofu, oil and a dairy free curd and milk like cashew or almond milk/curd. Avoid soy or peanut yogurt, as it gives an after taste.
- Rinse basmati rice very well in water till the starch clears from the water. The water should be clear and not cloudy or opaque.
- Then soak the rice in water for 30 minutes. Later drain the rice well and keep aside.
- Bring nine hundred and sixty ml water to a rolling boil in a pot.
- Add whole spices – cinnamon, tej patta, cloves , green cardamoms, caraway seeds. Also add salt.
- Now add the soaked rice. Do not stir the rice.
- Keep the flame to high and cook the rice without lowering the temperature.
- The rice grains have to be cooked till 75% or three-quarters done. They should have a bite to them when eaten.
- Drain the rice in a colander. You can also rinse the rice grains to remove starch if any and to stop the grains from cooking. Cover with a lid and keep the rice aside.
- When the rice is soaking, prep the ingredients for the biryani. Slice the onions. Heat the oil or ghee in a small frying pan and add the sliced onions.
- Stir and begin to fry the onions till they turn golden. Add one or two pinches of salt for quick browning of the onions. Stir often for uniform browning and fry on a low flame.
- Here the onions have begun to get golden.
- Once the onions become golden, then remove them with a slotted spoon and place them on kitchen paper towels. Keep the fried onions aside.
- Warm the milk on stove top or in the microwave. Add 16 to 18 saffron strands to the milk. Stir and keep aside.
- Whisk full fat curd (yogurt) in a mixing bowl till smooth.
- Add ginger paste, garlic paste, chopped green chilies, chopped coriander leaves and mint leaves. Mix well.
- Now add the spices- turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, coriander powder, caraway seeds and lemon juice.
- And salt as required. Mix again.
- Then add the half of the fried onions and the paneer cubes.
- Mix gently. Cover and keep the marinated paneer aside for 30 minutes.
- Add the same oil in which we fried the onions to a pan or pot.
- Add the marinated paneer and layer neatly.
- Make a rice layer now. Add all the rice. I have just made two layers. If you want you can make four layers.
- Add the remaining fried onions, chopped coriander and mint leaves.
- Sprinkle the saffron infused milk.
- Dot with ghee. You can also add rose water or kewra water.
- Cover with a aluminium foil or with a moist kitchen cotton towel or napkin.
- Place the lid tightly on the pan and place it on a tava or griddle. For the first 5 minutes dum cook the biryani on a medium heat.
- Then lower the flame and cook the biryani.
- On dum for 12 to 15 minutes. You can also cook the biryani in a preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes at 180 degrees C (350 degrees F). Use an oven proof pot or pan.
- Serve the Paneer Biryani hot with boondi raita or cucumber raita or onion raita or kuchumber salad.
- Enjoy Paneer Biryani hot or warm with raita like an onion-tomato raita or cucumber raita or boondi raita. You can also serve with sliced onion-lime salad or onion-tomato-cucumber salad.
- Pairing it with curries like mirchi ka salan and bagara baingan also tastes awesome. Even a simple plain yogurt tastes nice with it.
- Place any leftovers in any sealed box or container and refrigerate for 1 to 2 days. Reheat by warming in the oven at 90 degrees Celsius (190 degrees Fahrenheit) or by steaming in the Instant pot for 5 minutes.

cook_step:
- Rice: For any biryani recipe, I usually prefer aged basmati rice as the grains become fluffy, tender and non-sticky when cooked. Parboiled basmati rice (sella basmati rice) is another variety I like to use. You can make this biryani with any long-grained, non-sticky rice.

- And salt as required. Mix again.

- Mix gently. Cover and keep the marinated paneer aside for 30 minutes.
- Add the same oil in which we fried the onions to a pan or pot.
- Add the marinated paneer and layer neatly.
- Make a rice layer now. Add all the rice. I have just made two layers. If you want you can make four layers.
- Add the remaining fried onions, chopped coriander and mint leaves.
- Sprinkle the saffron infused milk.
- Dot with ghee. You can also add rose water or kewra water.
- Cover with a aluminium foil or with a moist kitchen cotton towel or napkin.
- Place the lid tightly on the pan and place it on a tava or griddle. For the first 5 minutes dum cook the biryani on a medium heat.
- Then lower the flame and cook the biryani.
- On dum for 12 to 15 minutes. You can also cook the biryani in a preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes at 180 degrees C (350 degrees F). Use an oven proof pot or pan.
- Serve the Paneer Biryani hot with boondi raita or cucumber raita or onion raita or kuchumber salad.
